xUECX_2U_KF75a2dhm9duA.text: I LOVE Hula's. I also highly recommend only coming to the Phoenix location. Great vibe, the patio is nice and dog friendly. The servers are fantastic, Keith is my favorite, hands down. On our last visit there, Soupy was EXTREMELY nice and made up for the terrible birthday experience I had at their Scottsdale location. Get the blood orange martini on the rocks and the spicy thai chicken bowl, you won't be disappointed. `

zpsOry0y1RSrNYnXaSmWBg.text: My boyfriend and I drove by this place on a Friday night and really wanted to try it but the wait was an hour, so we decided to come back another time. We ended up going on a Sunday night (which the server said is the slowest night) and it was dead. We got seated and although the we were a tad over dressed loved the place! We got the scorpion bowl which was only $15 and we got a good buzz  he ordered jerked pork which was amaze. It came with a side of plantains and corn bread which was a nice filler. I got the blackened wasabi ahi which was also amazing. I've been searching for some decent fish here and I finally found it!! Service was great and we got our meals very fast. Hula's for the win and we will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The scorpion bowl

NL1J8Gup4KWIo2S8vprhsA.text: I really want to try this place out again but I haven't worked up the courage to do so. My husband and I went for a date night and ordered the lobster bisque and a burger. We were very pleased and excited that we had found this gem! The next day while looking through Phoenix Health inspections, we were mortified to see Hulas for uncleanliness. The inspection was specific that multiple roaches were found in the bar area and unsafe food temps. I get very picky when it comes to raw foods and uncleanliness. From what I observed, everything looked AMAZING however I can't help but think about their health code violations. Maybe next time I go, I should ask for their restaurant grade! If you don't believe me here is their health/inspection report! They were graded with a D  UPDATE: I received a response from the owner and was informed that since the previous inspection, new rules/regulations and positions have taken place to make sure their restaurant rules are up to par. Maybe I might make my way over sometime this week and try the poki! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EVGi0VWtoVAH68iloxk3DA.text: What a gem for the mainland! I love their specials they have throughout the week. Dana and his crew definitely got everything RIGHT with this place. The decor, food, atmosphere, drinks, and service are all great. I'm a particular fan of the black bean burger; it's not like many of the veggie-based burgers. This is thick, hearty, flavorful, and not heavy. I don't know if your tastebuds would, but mine boogie with glee. I also like the shrimp tacos with their version of slaw. Again, not heavy and just the right blend of acid and sweet.   Their happy hours are such great deals, and happy hour on the weekends is practically the entire day! Anybody up for some Tiki Time?   The patio is fantastic for sitting and sunning along the light rail path. You can glimpse the dome of St Francis Xavier or look across toward the interior of the restaurant. Either way, you feel like you are in a happy Phoenix place.   The best part? A pup friendly patio, and that's always platinum to me! Not only to they allow dogs, they'll bring out a bowl of water and include a cookie or two, too! Two paws up!

JMsiLmoH82vm8O_ecNYK6g.text: The pineapple mimosas are pretty darn amazing! My issue was with the food. I got the breakfast sandwich which was pretty pricey for just the sandwich and no side. There was WAY too much egg and the bacon seemed low quality. When I arrived for brunch there was no hostess to be found, yet the sign said wait to be seated. I waited around for a few minutes then had a seat at the bar. The service was friendly but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

JYEt5cQSFTwKu8DkQAPQDQ.text: I like the coconut shrimp and sweet potato fries. The specialty drinks are very good, some are a little sweet for my taste, but there's a full bar. I especially like coming during the winter and sitting on the patio near the fire pit. The last time we were there it looked like they were setting up for live music on the patio. It's never overly crowded when we've gone. The staff has always been attentive and friendly. The place is inviting, comfy and good place to relax with friends.

tULtD4cxWK1Fv85FBFj1PQ.text: HIT AND MISS. MOSTLY MISS. GO FOR THE TUNA STARTER AND ORDER A DOUBLE PORTION; REAL HIT!  THE FOOD -- tuna sashimi dish is great value, great flavors. order it. -- coconut rum with watermelon liqueur a winner, if only the bartender would remember to add the fruit. do you need a recipe book? -- hash with eggs arrives eggs-over-hard despite my instructions for easy -- toasted english muffin slathered with butter, but not toasted. -- chicken salad's chicken was bland except for the rub on the edge. boo. -- taco plate features raw, unprepared corn tortillas. yeah, i can pull one from the bag and dump something in it too! why would i pay for that? -- salsa too salty -- cole slaw just not interesting, ends up a plate filler. blech.  THE DECOR -- hip sealed concrete, bulk tiki statues everywhere, and faux Eames chairs complete the hip look, framed by Green-Apple table shades and roll-up garage-door walls. -- designers kept the awesome hexagon street-facing window and high ceilings in the bar area. kudos.  THE REST -- starting to develop a pet peeve for "sauces" delivered via ketchup squirter bottle atop my item or side dish. IT GOES UNDERNEATH THE ITEM OR NEXT TO IT! OR IMAGINE.... IN IT. -- no reservation taken unless you've got six in your party. BOO. be ready for 30-minute wait in summer when no one's sitting outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jgEcG00kIsaoWLb-2etdNA.text: Fabulous food, drinks, ambiance and service. Just perfect! Loved my pork sandwich. The mac & cheese was delectable!  Painkiller & Dr. Funk drinks went down smooth. An extra nice treat for Mother's Day.

EY06OqXFF-CpX7kV-bymNA.text: I'm updating my review as I feel I was being a bit (or a lot) pissy the day with my 3-star rating.  I've always really like this place.  It takes an entire team of excellence to get a 5-star rating and I shouldn't have let just one bad moment define my overall experience with Hula's over the past 3 years!  It really is one of my favorite places!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hula&#39;s delivers!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hula&#39;s from my balcony!

m9VoeCiut0-3bw22-kMnvw.text: I had high hope that this place is super awesome! Everyone was talking it up and said how great and wonderful the food was. Hmmm...it was just average.   We had a party of 9 and more than a few items on the appetizer menu ran out. I ordered a Hawaiian white fish Ceviche. It was so soar I couldn't finish the whole fish. My friend ordered a mahi mahi. The fish tastes very well but he didn't like the sauce that goes with it. With that said, the server brought out another one with no sauce in it.  I asked around all of my foodie friends. No one seems to complain about the food but didn't exactly like it either. I still want to give it 3 stars due to great customer service. Other than that I probably will not come back here again.

RrdLxI3nJ-mdxIuWo9SOyg.text: We had so much fun here.  It was such a beautiful night too.  Our server was awesome. The food was awesome! Everything about this place was awesome. Definitely going back. Loved the laid back open air seating.

p3a4qqgFY7nRbg-rqlMXFg.text: Stopped in for lunch and awesome!  Poke was fantastic and Ceviche was fantastic!!!  Forgot I was in Phoenix!!!

Q8pbnoI_ETFkXzTVUj-mpw.text: Usually I rate a 5!  Don't come when it's busy as you won't get the same quality.  Today food was greasy, bad service and the wrong orders! Usually it is very good but come at odd hours.  For busy times, go to the downtown Scottsdale location as they handle volume better.  When staffs under pressure it's not a good outcome from the kitchen to the wait staff.  Wish I had gone to Scottsdale. I think they may have been under staffed. My only one star for them - too busy of a day I guess though there were empty seats ... ? Keith the bartender worked all day and had to serve starting at dinner - management? Where are you?   . What happened?  Scottsdale we go...

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is the place we had to put all of our plates as they stacked up on the table...

T7j5gOIzIMIuMOes_bUA3g.text: We couldn't figure out why the lunch menu was so short but when we got our food we realized why! The portions are beyond generous!  I had the Luau Pork Sandwich which was absolutely enormous! There was pork and slaw falling out onto my plate. While the slaw is slightly different tasting, it is complimentary to the flavor of the pork and the sandwich was excellent.   It wasn't very busy when we went and the atmosphere is nice and modern just like it says! I can imagine this place gets pretty busy on a Friday or Saturday night considering the set up.   This would be a good place for a date but I am not sure that I'd take my kids, the place is kinda small and intimate, more for couples.   I will definitely go here again to try something else!

vCvi99hZoE1OA4mTbaNCTw.text: I was at Hula for late night drinks on a Saturday. I had the Zombie, and it was delicious. I can't speak much to the quality of the food, but the menu was intriguing. I was satisfied and it was a lovely spot to end a restaurant/bar crawl.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The zombie

PVjFawez3uhmAUDlv8p2ZA.text: Have happy hour every month and the bar service is slow and gives the feel like you are putting them out!  Knock it off or I will move my 300+ happy hour somewhere else!

-SY5H6b0kzARORNjyxlVog.text: Great place.  Great service, great food, fun atmosphere, pet friendly (server gave my dogs an iced bowl of water) only downside is most of the cocktails are very sweet.  not my cup of tea, but if you like tropical, sweet, rum drinks this place is for you. however, the blood orange martini is a good option for people who prefer a less-sweet drink. I get it every time. love the ceviche, also get that every time. chicken sandwich, ahi caesar, lobster bisque, all great choices i have had and were delicious.

YLvklhjAMPwlAkdgvoZCOg.text: We have eaten at Hula's a couple of times since moving to the valley last year.  We really like both of the locations and look forward to being frequent visitors.  I love their unique menu.  Some favorites are the Spicy Thai Chicken Bowl and the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Plate.  Also the kids meals are huge!  Drinks are lacking a little (Scorpion Bowl is disgusting) but that won't stop us from coming back!

KtnQDnQRrVXYcEDO-K9Cvw.text: No time for a long, insightful, somewhat humorous review.  Hadn't been here in at least 2 years. Was a bit surprised it wasn't busier.  Calamari appetizer - it's a 4 but I love the sauce. Just a bit chewy which is ok b/c of the sauce.  Service was a 5. Suong was great (at least that is what I think her name was.  My wife gave the blood orange martini a 5.  Beer selection is a 3 (yes, I'm a beer snob).  For dinner I had a shrimp taco and a fish taco - both excellent.  If you haven't been here in awhile or if you've never been here, it's worth a visit.  P.s. We missed happy hour but there are some good deals.

j3D2ObZ6iM0s_uZeLdei6g.text: Fish tacos! I've you read my other reviews I am a huge fan of seafood and fish tacos. I was not disappointed when I was brought her as a surprise. The Baja tacos were delightful. I also tried the spicy edamame as an appetizer, which was delicious as well. I would come here again if in the neighborhood.

y3nk7XHw5JN-LjUsNbBnig.text: Love this place.  Have been here several times all on Wednesday nights when they have all night happy hour.  The place is always crowded with a lot of energy.  Here are the items I have tried.  Food:   Jerk pork plate , ceviche, pot stickers, pork tacos, spicy Thai fish cakes, coconut cream pie, regular and sweet potato fries, fried sweet plantains.   All wonderful, no complaints.  The only negative is the pot stickers only come fried.  You cannot get them pan fried or steamed.  (At least that is what we were told by our food server).  Drinks:  Zombie, Mai Tai, Painkiller, Hula's Hurricane,  Dr. Funk, Hawaii 5-0.  Favorites  are the Painkiller and Mai Tai.   The Mai Tai's are a little more tangy than the traditional.   Fun atmosphere.  Indoor and outdoor setting.  Great place you will enjoy your experience.

ku3VEX0OhjZ_NSTmllFlmw.text: Favorite things:  1. Blood Orange Martini 2. Thai Fish Cakes 3. Fish Bites 4. Cool, modern, retro decor 5. Great patio area 6. Really great bar service 7. Location  Only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars:  1. Price, however it redeems itself during happy hour!  I have a favorite drink now, and it is the Blood Orange Martini from Hula's. The Pink Bikini is good, and if you want more bang for your buck order the Zombie. Tiki drinks run about $7 or $5 during happy hour. Really great place to relax, but if you are on a budget this place can be a bank buster. The appetizers all look amazing, and I've order fish bites, thai fish cakes, and sweet potato fries. Mmm...the fish is so fresh and the dipping sauces have me swooned just as much as the BO martini. I'll frequent this place more often, but know that 3 drinks or 2 and an appetizer is gonna run me around $25...eek.

sOmcI1KCU6LCxcgYjINC-A.text: One of my all time favorite places in PHX! I recommend it to everyone visiting or moving here! Staff is always happy, hustling and energetic! Great vibe, even better drinks! Mai Tai is the way to go!

Xtezhbsk_3EuFyY1oAnyBQ.text: I realize the review page says Hula is not a place for kids but since it was 1:00, in the p.m. I figured my husb. and I could give it a try with our 3 year old and not give anyone a heart attack.  Mosly elderly folks at this time of day.  We were greeted timely enough and allowed to sit where we pleased.  Chose the booth seat against mirrored wall.  Our boy was well behaved, only a little loud happy talking here and there.  He coiored with crayons and paper that we brought.  Stayed at the table with us.    We were not told someone will be with you in a moment by other server who tended to others for about 5 minutes.  When our server came, we ordered tea, water, a fancy juice for our boy and shrimp rolls.    Shrimp rolls came before drinks.  They were crispy on outside but filled with imitation crab and only a few bits of shrimp.  Good sauce.  Tea and water came and then then a few minutes later the juice.  The boy enjoyed a big juice with cerrries, oranges, and an umbrella.  Husb. ordered a fish dinner with sweet potato fries, ceasar salad and mac n' cheese for our boy.  Would share.  It was a LONG time before main food finally came.  I asked about it as we all were getting antsy.  Server told us that it would be less than 5 minutes as they were waiting on the mac n' cheese.  She said sandwich (we didn't order a sandwich but we took it anyway) was ready and did we want it now, before the mac n' cheese.  Yes!  Sandwich and fries came out COLD and the salad came out warm.  All three tasty though.  Mac n' cheese came too and it was NOT hot.  All in all, maybe they didn't like that we had a 3 year old with us.  There was a group of young twentish girls giving us the eye.  Don't worry, we'll never take him there again.  Not sure if I'll even go with girlfriends for happy hour.

FowkqxQp7ZbtzrOjwZyFvw.text: Loved the place the food and the service. Heat lovers .. Do try their edamame. Everything was a pleasant surprise and I love surprises like these. Have recommended this place to so many..

ArnCqj74M8yS_TWJg5S1qw.text: I loved this place.  Great place to be. It just feels like living hanging here.  It's almost better than being in Hawaii.  Everyone was very nice. Not just the bartender who  gave us great service but also the host and who ever ran our food out while it was hot and fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome keylime pie.

6pGe3Ye7GFNxji7TruV8og.text: Be sure to have a Mai Tai. Its so good you can't have just one!!

6nt2JH0nHYUhfB7WBOc_Kg.text: I visit this place for the 1st time last week. I had passed this place a couple of times and really wanted to visit mostly due to the outdoor seating and look of the restaurant. I went on a Wednesday night, they had late happy hour which was great. Got a Pink Bikini Martini which was good, Hawaiian Ceviche which was awesome, nice chucks of fish yummy!!!, Also I got the sweet potato fries...loved them. These were just the appetizers which were like $3-$5 during the happy hour time. Since they were so cheap I kinda stocked up on the appetizers. For the main course I have the Spicy Thai Chicken Bowl, OMG..it was so good.  The wait staff was quick and attentive and it was a little busy.   I would mos def go back to this place, good food, good ambience, great place to go just chill out.

sbkFOBDZZKA-9dG9BR04gg.text: Food was good.  The ribs were great and the lobster bisque was too.  The service was super slow, but our waitress was sweet.  Cool atmosphere, wish it had more of a "Hawaiian" theme.  Got in super fast.  Great location!

lM2FydW6-Pge0ttsZhv8fA.text: Really cool location and atmosphere.  The island/tropical themed cocktails are pretty awesome.  I love the coconut shrimp rolls but I wish the menu was a little more robust.  Not a ton of options.  Overall, still a really good spot.

3VhrBGRuh2etmkt1JEhFZQ.text: I had my birthday luncheon/happy hour here this past weekend  - wonderful time.  Bar staff kept my group plied with booze and food.  Unfortunately, there are still about 49 things on the menu that I haven't tried.  I guess I'll have to go back.  :)

W1xODf6PuKFLxt3wby3p-w.text: Food was delicious and fun atmosphere for a night out. Our server had too much attitude and that ruined the experience. Because of food allergies I had a few questions and it took her too long to come back I answer my questions (and she was passing our table frequently so it wasn't like she was talking to the chef). After getting frustrated I tried to wave her down and she started getting rude with us.

tI9xStBW78FZXma_zSgvzA.text: I wanted so much to love this place and tried it on multiple occasions.  But alas, it's just ok.  Service is fine.  Bartenders are friendly.  Food is solid, but not exceptional.  Never had anything bad, but never had anything memorable either.  And the cocktails always disappointed.

xmQU9DfxIZq3qtCSKALKMA.text: Style over Substance. The decor and theme are cool. The staff is a bit smug and pretentious. The food is overpriced . The Pork Sandwich was tasteless and gross. The salads are on a bed of ...lettuce. Just very low grade food.

GzUogodR804LgAZLTmY3FA.text: My partner and I went there for the first time and we were a bit confused on how to get a table. Once we realized that we had to go inside, where the hostess stand is, we were immediately started. Or server was very friendly and suggested some appetizers. I love, LOVE, the spicy edamame and she enjoyed the fish bites. The drinks are on point! We will be back!

ccCRJzlbxcyZG20oX7muGg.text: Stopped by for happy hour and to grab a light dinner. I was hoping they had Katsu on the menu but they did not. The menu didn't have many light optins that i was interested in. Obviously it's a tiki and Hawaiian theme so I was hoping they would have one of my Hawaiian barbecue favorites. I settled on the fish sandwich, which was very tasty. Perfect seasoning and the fish is not a deep fried patty like most it was lump fish meat (can't remember which fish variety). It was really tasty. They have tiki mugs for signature drinks and 4 taps that serve only Kona beer varieties. Overall, I liked the concept and would probably come back with friends.

Z5ul7gL_BjofORNtWzRrng.text: I came back and it was awesome. There was room inside looking towards the outside and it was really nice. My server Andrew was nice and stayed on top on refills. I am glad I came back.

0lMF2UUNmjxE7Gyil2KX4g.text: Couldn't choose between the ribs or the Luau pork plate and the waiter recommended the pork. I thought it was all right, but they sure doused it in 12 gallons of soy sauce and sort of over did it with the sweet pineapples. After being forced to eat white rice every night for the past 19 years due to a very persuasive/aggressive Asian mother, I vowed to stop eating it when I got out of the house but because it was so overly sweet and salty, I had to ask for more of the rice that came with it just to mellow my mouth out.   While I should give it 3 stars, I can honestly say that you cannot beat their happy hour prices. Thanks to this place, my boyfriend and my wallet are both happy and he's able to drop his 'macho' guard, He now happily drinks Orange Martinis and Mai Tai's, but at Hula's. Anywhere else and it's back to his manly Samuel Adams and Four Peaks. Le sigh.

CXPCC4gZpsR7BbSt0JQJHw.text: Went to dinner on a Tuesday night with a group of 5. Waited for about 15mins for a table as they were pretty busy. A couple of big parties were there that night. Service was horrible! He barely said 2 words to us. Our food came out separately so we had to wait for everyone to get their meal. The food was surprisingly good. I had the habanero lime roasted chicken tacos. Except for the sharp bone found in my tacos they were pretty good. I would suggest making reservations or calling ahead before making the 45min hike across town to have dinner.

FWmpet_tnG9ahDn7_rAq2A.text: Fun vibe, dog-friendly patio, and fish tacos to die for.  One of our visits was on Easter Sunday - the place was packed with families, yet service was still fast and friendly.  I bought  a couple of their tumbler glasses for the cute logo. Always a good time.

bVFRm2KsDIapCAF9SseTkQ.text: The restaurant concept is top notch. Layout & flow are awesome. The garage doors which open up the dining room are really cool.   The food was insanely fresh & good. Ceviche was perfect. Loved the crunch shrimp roles with Pineapple remoulade.  Loco Moco was on point. Because the hamburger pattie is flame grilled & the mushroom gravy is well balanced, the entree felt light & decadent.   Only tried the Hurricane cocktail, but would certainly order again.   BIG FAN

l82_FMngO6u3PpW5mpqqmw.text: Delicious.. service is always friendly and awesome. I get there blackened ahi tuna with sweet potato fries.. amazingnesss and a must try

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

j7ahk_5-Q9Uq482_Pk426A.text: Good food and atmosphere. Like their new location. Love the real tiki feel of the side room. The waitress was very responsive and friendly. Definitely a great place for a date.

ZMHhz6wo0m8MPodln7aYEg.text: Go big or go home! This review will be short and sweet, just like Hula's drinks, because I always go to Hula's for one reason- their $15 Scorpion Bowl! What can I say, it's a bang for your buck with tons of rum and brandy and even fire in the middle of their signature green bowls and neon long straws that I absolutely adore! I came here to celebrate finishing my MBA. I came here when I had a rough day. I came here when I landed in Phoenix after a long vacation and needed a welcome home drink. Hula's is the best place to drink festively and so be it, it is my go to celebration spot and should be everyone else's, too!  Also, tip: during Happy Hour come ready to spend some Lincolns because you can get a ton of apps and cocktails at $5 a piece. On Wednesdays the HH extends for drinks for all night! Cheers all!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes this is all you need to celebrate!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coming back to Phoenix after a long vacation, headed straight to the Scorpion Bowl!

O7VmAJhBGFLLO-bFyj8OFw.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!  Ate here in February 2 nights in a row!  Great drinks, great food, WONDERFUL service.  Been here many times and will definitely be back!

nuTHsR8YnPh9Z7R1HTXagA.text: Yum yum yum! Finally tried the downtown location and had a good time. Food was great! Kona coffee was FANTASTIC. I tried the crispy fish tacos this time and was not disappointed. Hulas has good portion sizes and their food has great flavor. The only downside was that we had a larger party and it was freezing outside, they sat us in the furthest possible place from the heaters outside and when we asked about sitting at the long table, near the heaters, which were empty at the time, they would not let us move. We had to go get towels out of our cars to keep was.

AkNioMHNNXTJSRkKiaDAMA.text: Great new location!  The food is fabulous the only issue is there's no bike racks!  Their other location had bike racks, it was great for the biking community.  Get some bike racks so we can come back.

SYDyg4gr-h-kd0CirGDt_g.text: We were very excited to check out the new location as we have been eating here for years. We ordered an Uber bc we planned on having a fun date night with cocktails. Upon arriving was a 20 minute wait, which is fine. They had a speak easy that we had cocktails in while waiting for our table. The speak easy had a bar and the bartender made delicious drinks, however was not very friendly. Our phone notified us that our table was ready so we closed out our tab and went to the hostess stand. Once we got to the hostess stand the girls told us that our table was no longer available because a man had his walker blocking his way to our table. I respect the elderly and understand that their walkers/wheelchairs may take up excess room. So they put us back on a wait.   They text us a second time, and as we waited for the two hostess to finish their conversation; they looked annoyed as we waited and than asked 'did we text you?'  Than my boyfriend was about to lose his mind and we left. This is primarily a personnel review.  We know from the past the food and drinks to be great, as well as the staff, but tonight we walked out before we even had a chance to eat.  Boyfriend...pissed

iv69jlqSLnAfWPVUVEMUWg.text: Came here on Friday night. Had to wait about 30 min for our table but it wasn't too bad waiting at the bar   Our servers were very attentive and the appetizers and drinks were all amazing!  We'll definitely be stopping here again when we're in town next!

B09AYY-RDrqQBcgVkhCh2g.text: Happy hour is great! I've had the Hawaii 5-0 & the Lilikoi Margarita- both drinks tasted great! The chicken wings and crispy coconut shrimp rolls were delicious!

KLJOxrTpF3ggNRsaQS5qlw.text: Our first time here and will not be our last! Cat, the bartender was amazing: friendly, attentive and knowledgeable! We shared the calamari and shrimp tacos and felt like we were back in Hawaii! Bob Marley played in the background and the decor was modern chic! Can't wait to try more food and drinks!

31zpDQfXDYNZw0WZSihKdw.text: We went to Hula's for brunch last Sunday.  We had visitors from both Illinois and Wisconsin.  I made a reservation for the patio for 8.   I was pleased to receive a call on Sunday morning confirming my reservation. We really appreciate being able to get a reservation when we have a group. It was very hot on the patio.  I did not even give it a thought when I made the reservation that it would be uncomfortable for us. Our waitress, ( I wish I would have taken note of her name) was wonderful.  She managed to move us inside.  Thus saving our brunch. She did a GREAT job with us!!  We tipped her well, as we appreciated her so much.  She got our orders correct and our checks too. This was difficult with us moving.  Thank you so much for making Hula's a place that is a must when we have guests.  Everyone had a great time and the Illinois friends enjoyed the spam. We loved Ticoz's and are happy we now have a great new place to gather with our guests and our Arizona friends. Dana, you have come a long way with the new Hula's. You got off to a rough start, but have made it our favorite place!!  Thank you so much!!!

ysflr0G3v0YOf4kQY0dWDg.text: Hula's did not disappoint me on my most recent visit.  Oh - and being they were open later than almost everything in Phoenix on January 2 - they were a life saver.   I ordered a Hula burger with sweet potato fries (natch). It was perfectly cooked to temp.   Yes, I had one Dr. Funk for old times' sake. I rarely drink these days (a few times over the last couple years), but I could not resist. It was just as delicious as I remembered.   The waitress sat my friend and I in a corner of the restaurant, which was fine for conversation.  She was friendly and available without being bothersome.   My friend had the shrimp tacos and enjoyed them.   Overall, I had a great meal.    I think I will visit again with my fiance when he is in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Dr Funk and my friend who is moving here this Summer

4H17W7uVBD2RZxXcb87uoA.text: This was a very cool hangout. It is a great place for Happy Hour with friends or even to go on a date. The food was really good too. Their sweet potato fries were soooo good. I went for a company promotion party and it seemed to be able to accommodate a lot of people.

GS3_FpGweZ_R8DUQqNhWSw.text: 5 stars for drinks, When It comes to food it was ok up until the manager decided to keep the doors open allowing a lot of flies invade the restaurant, even in 110+ degree days. We've decided to not eat in here anymore because flies are landing on customers food, the opened drink garnish container, pretty gross thought on what we're getting for food and how many flies are in the kitchen. My last black bean burger I started to wonder how many beans compared to flies is in my burger. I've noticed a customer mention this to the manager on a few occasions when I was there, all he does is shrug his shoulders in confusion and ignores the request.

zdz0kKBImpBDJUb6ph9tPw.text: This place looks so cool and chill ready to try it. Get the scorpion bowl it's definitely a party starter. This is the first time we came staff is great good ambiance. I recommend to come here and try it for yourself!!!!

E9wOaHzcieshvbk_ZG2SUg.text: Traveling west from Columbus, Ohio with our dog we stumbled across Hula's on bringfido.com and we are so glad we did! We visited around 3pm on a Tuesday (lunch) so it wasn't very busy. Our server brought out a water dish right away (so hospitable) & he was very attentive to our needs (aka drink refills cuz it was hot af out.) The decor is top notch, even the bathrooms. I wish there were a location in Columbus as the food is a refreshing change & their happy hour looks great! Next time I'm in PHX i will be sure to stop back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Even the take home boxes are cute!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch menu
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi Wasabi bowl

j1XOm9Y3cXz9jLzF3msFmQ.text: We've been here many times and loved it every time.  Great drinks: best Mai Tai I've had in Phoenix.  Wonderful appetizers especially the addictive Fish bites.  For entrees they do fish very well.  My wife is hard to please with fish and just loves the way they prepare it.  Great atmosphere too.  I just hope the new location is as fun.

qP82sEX2P2M-xT_FvWqgdg.text: I had Hula's on my "to do" list for waaaaay too long! We went for a proper birthday celebration and had a wonderful time. Everything about this place was just about perfect. From the time I made the reservation, to the super cool atmosphere, to the mod tiki decor and music choices, to being greeted and seated by the adorable hostess, to the service at the table, to the clean restrooms, and of course, to the delicious and innovative food and drinks. ALL ON POINT. We started with the coconut shrimp rolls, spicy edamame, and calamari. The pineapple horseradish sauce with the coconut shrimp was lovely and sweet/spicy. The edamame was the best I've had in a long time. It was very well seasoned and spicy with lots of yummy flavor crumbs we enjoyed as much as the edamame itself. Our least favorite was the calamari, which was very thick cut...like calamari steak fries. The sauce was like an aioli. Many would love it this way and we ate it and enjoyed it, but probably wouldn't pick it again. Our entrees were all excellent. I highly recommend the Jaeaiian Jerk pork. It is super tender and very flavorful with just the right combo of flavor and mild heat with proper jerk spice. The Duke's pork is very sweet with a soy pineapple flavor base. Also, if you are hungry...order one of their bowls. The Thai Chicken bowl was so delicious, with a lovely peanut sauce and addition of avocado for that extra creamy richness. The combo base of black beans, cabbage and rice is so much better than plain rice. We also had snapper. The plantains, johnny cake and mango salsa are all excellent as well. Now, the drinks...oh boy! The Tiki Bastard (ginger beer bourbon rum), Lilikoi margarita (passion fruit), and Painkiller (rum juices) were all amazing. But, the Blood Orange Martini was the star of our table. All of these drinks were so well balanced and not sicky sweet. Excellent fresh ingredients. We loved our experience and will definitely be returning for lunches, dinners, and the incredibly reasonable and fun Happy Hour.

F_sAc1B5EXOQW8aIvhepQQ.text: My daughter and I came on a Wednesday night. It wasn't too busy and we got a seat by the fire. The server was very friendly and said we could order off the happy hour menu even though we weren't in the bar. We had the tofu tacos and Mac nut crusted tofu. The tofu tacos had great flavor. I would probably skip the Mac nut crusted tofu. The tofu was more soft than I was picturing and I just wasn't into it. It also came with rice and some cole slaw.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

k3nScMyRNrwY-OJRRtaQ7A.text: Best poke in town. Although probably the only poke. Seriously, I recently had poke in Kauai at a top 100 yelp restaurant and this  actually compares favorably. It needs a touch less soy sauce though, and macadamia nuts not in any poke in Hawaii.  ADDENDUM Owner sent me a kool email.  It is nice to know they care!

J7qy9PKsLcTObqkUjwNHLQ.text: Their burgers are great and they have a big speciality drink menu to try , definately a regular spot of mine.

7_7e0-QNGKCcs34uS7hxsQ.text: I love the service whether I'm calling for pickup or dining at the restaurant. The Big Sur Black bean burger is my favorite.

UiJvM3KYO885g78LsMh6iw.text: Started with a GREAT Maithai! Had the coconut shrimp rolls... both amazing! Try the Mahi Mahi blackened.. yea it is a bit spicy, but is nicely balanced with a cream drizzle over the top. Great ambiance... great drinks and food! Give it a go! Don't forget the service... friendly accommodating and really made you feel at hone. Our first time here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened Wasabi MahiMahi

O3wtQR1mpVimoNvjzrw2NA.text: I went here on a Thursday night with a group of friends and our experience was horrible. Our waitress was rude and basically forgot about us. We ordered the scorpion bowl and it tasted very watered down and the pricing of the food did NOT reflect its quality. I would not recommend this place, if i could give no stars i would.

8P6VCAL8FLjG4xpGA2CZCQ.text: Prior to this, I'd only been to the Hula's in Scottsdale and I have to say, I actually prefer the location and atmosphere of the Phoenix Hula's! I stopped in here just for a drink - heartbreaking, considering how much I love the food at Hula's - but as always, their drinks were on point. Four of us split the Scorpion Bowl and it was a decent size to split between the four of us. Our waiter only came around once to check up on us, though to be fair we did only have drinks. Love this place!

3rnTuo6xKu3s5Iuf1m4HnA.text: Feels like my home away from home.  They always make me feel welcomed at the bar... Thanks Keith, Jarrod and Christine :) shout out to Bailey and Andrew  You must try the edammame (sp?) and the poke!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qpkalGziL7zdFfPOOzHVfA.text: Dr. Funk was soooo good I went online and watched the Hula's video on how to make this drink myself and ordered glasses at retro store.  This will most certainly be my summer drink.  The prices were good and the food was delish as well - had a thai chicken bowl and ahi ceaser salad with mango.  I said I wish we had a Hula's in San Diego and was told there is a place downtown, but only serves drinks called False Idol.  I feel I had quite an experience at Hula's and hope to return soon.  Parking was easy and nearby shopping fun too.  We got here early and beat the lunch time rush.

nc0W7nJWTG1kalbGlk_yKQ.text: First time officially going out for Tiki drinks - and Hula's is definitely the place to go for a good, cheap, local tiki cocktail!  If it's cool enough to sit outside and enjoy the patio - I highly recommend it. Inside can be a bit crowded and noisy like a cafeteria..  Moving onward - during happy hour, most tiki drinks are only $5! And they have some yummy food on special too! (The spicy edamame was delicious.)  While we were there, we got the Dr. Funk, Painkiller, Zombie and the One-Eyed Pyrat. They were all great but the Dr. Funk and the Zombie were definitely my fave! The presentation of the drinks is awesome too. Each drink comes in a tiki mug to match the theme of your drink; so fun! Now I know why so many people are into tiki cocktails! I think I may be a new fan!  From what I hear and have seen, they have a pretty good dessert menu! I definitely gotta try a piece of their Coconut Cream Pie next time! ;)

wWgaI8KnJcyYLqoRTcLyTg.text: I mean, if I was trapped on an island I could eat here every day. I wrote a review to highlight that this will be you chance to experience the best coconut cream pie your tongue has encountered

e07VuHoSCnznSTTBbzNQFA.text: Our server Keith was very friendly and checked in on us a lot!  The food was yummy - had the kalbi ribs and was one of the best I had!

4gvRy-KKl9fWRfu6nIf79g.text: This made for a good lunch spot with a friend. I asked for the spicy Thai chicken bowl, but less rice and more cabbage. It ended up being rather like a cabbage-based salad, which was okay by me! The chicken was nice and tender, though the spiciness was rather overwhelming for me, personally. I ate it all, but it's not a dish I'd order again.  The atmosphere was very nice in there and we had great service. My friend greatly praised their happy hours, and I'd like to visit again during that time.

3qsKS2eckTsgGZ42rv8-HA.text: Love this place! It's really cute for happy hour or date night. I have not found something on the menu that I didn't like. The food is amazing.  For drinks, try the blood orange martini. Yum.

euQC2j_LgG17foA7fF007g.text: When you are driving from the city, you should look for the Twist sign and sharing the parking lot is Hula's.  This place has a great vibe and I have no doubt that it would be an ideal happy hour spot.  However, I am rating it a 3-star for a two reasons:    1) The food.  Let's face it, that is the end all be all right?  If the food is average, then I have to give it an average score (not bad... just not great either).  I had the recommended Mahi with Blackend spice and wasabi potatoes.  If you like overwhelming spice, this is your dish!  I felt the blackend spice was sufficient and I told the hostess that point.  It overwhelmed any taste of the fish itself.  2) While I thought our hostess was really nice, she needed support on a Monday night.  Drinks were slow in coming.    So it was fun to stop by, but not sure it was worth a special trip.  Cheers.

DE2aEs5LenDTlcgbQDxFyg.text: Great little tiki bar! They have really great happy hour specials. Most the drinks were $5 and there was a large selection. Four or five apps on the happy hour as well. My favorite app was the ceviche. It was really good! Fresh, bold flavors, and plentiful. I also had he shrimp rolls and they were good. Tried one of someone elses pot stickers and some edamame. The splicy edamame was really good and unique. The pink bikini martini was my favorite drink. The watermellon flavor is subtle but refreshing.   They had old Elvis movies playing on the wall the evening I went which was a fun touch. I think the patio will be a great spot this fall. Clean bathrooms, friendly, fast servers, and great new happy hour spot on my list!!

iHcYrRz346YDfMPhnJoI6Q.text: I was so excited to see the drink list - many of which the last time I had access to those drinks was in the Caribbean itself. I mean I've never seen a Painkiller (a drink created in the USVI/BVI area) outside of the Islands. Its pretty authentic tasting here - except the ceramic coconut! I also ordered a fish sandwich which was delicious. The pricing is right and the location is ideal in Old Town Scottsdale. Well worth the visit as its clean and designed well.

zVSamdlJ5pnJVHgyy0c4eg.text: Is the food good? Yes it is. Is the food great? Ehhh. It's just pretty good. My wife and I shared two different plates to get more of a taste of what Hulas has to offer. I ordered a chicken breast burger of some sort with sweet potato fries. The burger was good enough, the sweet potato fries were luke warm and could have been a little crunchier. She didn't care for the cajun hamburger she'd ordered. I thought it was pretty tastey. She ordered french fries. Pretty average, nothing special. Overall, I feel there are better dine-in options on Central. I do like the Hulas' atmosphere, and it's likely I'll return to give it another go sometime.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken or beef patty? Sweet Potato or French fries?

9QPjke9gN76rMONxYDV1fw.text: awesome happy hour today at Hula's! We had the margaritas,blood orange martini in the rocks and cran mimosas. All delicious! Great apps as well at a great price! Service was superb and everyone was super warm and friendly! My son just moved a block away and this will be our HH spot for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mai Tai and Margarita.. both $5 during HH

ZJvRHIGFcgG5VU0eS_cecA.text: This place was great! We went on a Friday night with hardly any wait.  We got a drink and the bar and then we're seated quickly.  The edamame was SUPER spicy, don't recommend that, but everything else way delicious!

9gEl0CywdV7l0ohqjMxe5Q.text: I really wanted to like this place. The staff is disorganized and you really cannot tell who is working there. The busboy looked like some kid who just walked in off the street. The food was just okay. The jawaiian jerk chicken plate; favor was okay but the rice was gluey and the johnny cakes where very dry and only one plantain slice?  The loco moco; the burger patty was burnt and tasted like old grill. Once again the rice was gluey and the gravy had a skin on it. About the only decent part was the egg. I have far better at plate lunch joints for half the price. This place says tiki but really doesn't deliver.  The signature cocktails are okay but not True to tiki and the staff seemed oblivious and as if they would rather be somewhere else.

_c451sRWQVy6K9qYLBtctQ.text: Just because the server will take back a poorly mixed drink or charred beans doesn't make it a good place to eat and drink.  The food at Hula's needs to be good and consistent, not just returnable.  On a Saturday night, four of us hit Hula's at 6pm.  What's so striking when you enter is how open the bar and dining room are to the patio, which needs a few more tables and chairs, I'd say.  Central Phoenix enthusiasts love a good adaptive reuse project, and the one at Hula's, especially because of the preservation of the impressive and large hexagonal window, puts it in the same category as Postino Central and St. Francis as far as an amateur's view of architectural renovations.  We started by sharing the sweet potato fries, which are on-par with Maizie's and even those at Delux.  They were crisp, evenly cut, and intensely creamy and sweet.  After this, though, it was downhill.  Though my companions enjoyed their drinks, my Zombie, served in a tall opaque glass with a mustachioed character who looked a lot like me, was poorly mixed, lacking lime juice, and faintly soap-tasting.  The server gave me a couple minutes to weigh the drink's future, and after agreeing to suffer through it, I changed my mind and sent it back.  (The Zombie would later still appear on the bill.)  The Dark & Stormy I ordered in its place, with dark rum and ginger beer, was drinkable, but inferior to the drink of the same name at St. Francis, which, for $2 more, tastes $4 better.  I think it's in the quality of the ginger beer.  My friend's fishcakes were mostly overcooked and had to be cut with a knife, like chicken.  The ceviche, though palatable, my other friend said, appeared dry and haphazardly plated with some giant tortilla chips.  As the lone veggie in the bunch, I ordered the Spicy Tofu Tacos, which come with a spicy chili sauce and a side of rice and black beans.  Though the food came out of the kitchen quickly -- 12 minutes or so -- I wish it hadn't.  The tofu, a recently unpackaged watery brick no doubt, was merely sliced, warmed (not grilled or fried or marinated over night), and dusted with chili powder; therefore, the tofu was tasteless.  The tacos were double-wrapped in flour tortillas, which created a thick, awkward mouthfeel, so I just used one of the tortillas on each of my two tacos.  But the most disappointing part of the meal was the rice and beans, which are hard to screw up.  The black beans were so badly burned in the pot that even their juices saturated the scoop of rice with their charred, charcoal (bad) smoke flavor.  I mentioned this to the server, and she later would deduct half of the plate's $11 price (though the extra Zombie remained on the ticket).  We passed on dessert and went to St. Francis and later Fez for drinks.  Hula's would be a great happy hour spot on the patio if it offers consistent drinks and some happy hour food specials.  Two stars for potential, and I will try once more.  As it stands now, though, an accommodating server cannot compensate for an inconsistent bartender, burned beans, and uninventive vegetarian options.  note: I am totally aware that restaurants don't have to cater to my or other people's various dietary preferences (i.e., vegetarians and vegans), and that I choose to go to these restaurants.  I just want some rice and beans to rely on.

6DDQHEj3je-fFrV-_neS-g.text: I have not been here for over a year but have been wanting to write a review.  It was a nice evening and the garage doors/walls were open.  Hula's has a very comfortable atmosphere.  We started with the Spicy Edamame, loved them!  For main course, I had the Lemongrass Encrusted Butterfish.  My husband had Duke's Luau Pork Plate.  They were both good but I liked the fish better.  I am planning on going again when the weather cools down.

Sxd8PVGb3xEiphSsUn5cGA.text: Meet with old friends on the patio last night. Even with the rain it was delightful. Our server was attentive and the happy hour bites were quite tasty.  I enjoyed on tap the longboard ale from the Maui Brewing Company, something I've only been able to do in Maui or in a bottle locally. I would definitely go again.

UjuMbkRGMctSbf9Swn94Pw.text: Really fun place, great service, lousy food! It's probably a great place to go and have drinks and hang out, but seriously..... the food sucked.... No thanks.... after being in Hawaii this past year, this was a not very authentic. Whatever....  Have fun with the drinks.

IcaHbSa0I6-XFHS-x_vOhg.text: After a long day and a longer week, I agreed to fetch the BFF from the airport in exchange for dinner.  We initially decided on Maizie's, but when the entire lot at the Landmark was full, we circled around to the adjacent complex and decided to try Hula's instead.  The patio was full, but we were immediately seated inside.  Our waitress Victoria was quite charming and gave us plenty of time to look over the menu while we chatted.  After a few minutes, he decided on a beer and I asked for a passion fruit iced tea and the Zombie - a delightful combination of rum and fruit juices.  After we ordered, we sat back and enjoyed the ambiance.  The indoor seating area was empty, but a group of four was seated beside us.  I wasn't sure about the close seating with connected tabletops, but it really wasn't so bad, even when a group of four was seated right beside us.  I excused myself to use the restroom and was happy to see it was clean and non-smelly.  A short while later, our meals arrived.  We both ordered burgers - his was beef and had mushrooms and mine was Ahi, and of course, we both ordered the sweet potato fries.  Unfortunately, they were undercooked!  We let our waitress know, and she took our plated after apologizing.  She returned minutes later with our burgers and a promise of a fresh basket of fries for us to share.  The fresh batch of fries was much better - hot, crispy on the outside, and perfectly cooked on the inside.  I think Mazie's are better, but these were definitely good.  Our burgers were each served on really nice, thick buns with sesame seeds.  I can't speak for my friend's meal, but my burger was wonderful!  I asked for no slaw and the sun-dried tomato pesto aioli on the side.  The aioli had a really nice flavor and tasted great on the burger.  The ground tuna seemed to have been combined with diced serranos which gave it a really, really nice flavor and a bit of heat.  Despite being stuffed, we each finished our meals and sat talking for a long while after.  Our waitress was super-attentive and kept the iced tea and water refills coming steadily.  Nice surprise: after the bill was paid, she brought us an order of shrimp rolls.  She said it was an incorrect order but wanted us to have them since we were so great.  I'm not a fan of shrimp, but the rolls looked and smelled delicious.  I tried some (sans shrimp) and loved the flavor of the toasted coconut flakes and the really great pineapple dipping sauce.  I am very much looking forward to returning to Hula's again and again.  Lunch service will begin on November 1, which seems too far away.  Great service, great food, great ambiance - love it!

SxuuaXXLggT46Fydc0Viuw.text: Can't believe this place put up with the drunkiness we came with! 6 girls, on the prowl--what could go wrong? Not much at Hula's!! Wonderful, affordable food and drinks. My only complaint is we had a reservation and waited around an hour for our table. Not much of a complaint; we sat at the bar and drank ALOT!! Excellent food and service.

h5tp9yd12N4guI3E_Z9qCA.text: We sat outside on the patio on a beautiful, sunny, Tuesday afternoon. I ordered a "something pink bikini tini" and it was pretty darn tasty. We ordered the sweet potato fries which were good. The sauce they served with the fries definitely stole the spot light though! It was slightly sweet & creamy. I ordered the Coconut Shrimp Rolls & salad off their lunch menu. They were delicious, but I wish they were a little heavier on the coconut. From the looks of their happy hour menu, it looks like a great deal. I will definitely be back to try out their happy hour!

289Nm9QUdYVfPQUE7EYdCA.text: I can easily give Hula's 5 stars. We've now been to Hula's numerous time since their opening and they seem to get better with each visit. Initially, like most new restaurants, their service was suffering but now it is awesome! Their menu has grown and become even better. I love the pulled pork sandwich and my partner is a huge fan of the chicken Cesar. This place is great for happy hour or for a relaxing meal. Highly recommend Hula's!  Awesome atmosphere!

AfdQT8hXqi0cjKlttMMEiw.text: My sister and I were actually planning on trying out St. Francis down the street, but upon driving up, discovered it is closed on Mondays! So, we headed down the street to Hula's to check out their soft opening.  I had walked over there earlier to check it out and grab a menu and everyone was so friendly, so I suggested to my sister we eat there.    They were only offering a limited menu for their soft opening, but this menu along with the regular menu which offers about three times as many delicious menu options were both fabulous!   We decided to sit on their patio, which despite the large fire pit in the middle was remarkably cool for a summer night! The atmosphere was great - nice and quiet yet you still feel like you're somewhere happening and trendy.  It actually kind of felt like we were eating in a trendy part of LA.  The staff was all very friendly, and our service was prompt and pretty efficient.  They goofed with the food they brought to our table twice, but it did not affect our dining experience at all, as the food was still brought out within 15 minutes or so.  This was pretty impressive for their first night.    Now on to the food ....  soooo good! We started with the seared ahi wontons, which were pieces of fresh ahi tuna atop a crisp wonton and served with a wasabi sour cream/green onion garnish - perfect combination of flavors.  Both my sister and I said we would order this again as a meal.  We shared a lemongrass encrusted ono, which came with rice and a cabbage slaw.  This was also a perfect combination of flavors.  The portion was fairly large, too, so it was a great dish to share - we even were able to take home some leftovers.  The one comment my sister had was that she would order the sauce on the side next time because it was kind of rich, but I was pretty happy with it.  We did not order any alcoholic beverages, so I cannot comment on those, but from the looks of the drink menu and all of the people around us ordering drinks, they seem to be pretty good! I had their passion fruit iced tea, and it was so good I asked for some to go.    I give this place four stars not five because of a small snafu ... I brought the leftovers (which the server packaged for us in a container she labeled with the contents and the date), and while my boyfriend was eating them just minutes later, he found a short black hair in the dish .... Kinda gross but hoping it was just an off moment for them because I still cannot wait to go back and try some other menu items like the Thai Chicken bowl and the shrimp tacos!

OXNJjb53SFqA0xhIgD9JpA.text: We had all the appetizers...seaweed salad, shrimp, sweet potato fries..., they were all yummy and I put the funky pineapple yellow sauce on my seaweed salad and that made it taste better...its a cool place.

y-6QXlnzbpSaVxOslAQYTA.text: I've been here 3 times now. The first 2 for cocktails and a small plate and last time (using a Groupon certificate) for Brunch. The seaweed salad was good and I really loved the plantains. For brunch I had the hula hash- pork with an egg on top over hash browns. SO GOOD! I was not fond of the Bloody Mary, but the mimosa was up to par and only $3.

rYJCf_6hpPz7dxwam-GAgA.text: Just had a wonderful dinner experience at Hula's. Our server name was Ginger (like the movie-star from Gilligan's Island!!) she was AWESOME. The food, wine atmosphere, staff were all great. My partner and I owned a restaurant in San Diego, so we know food and this was a great food experience. I had the pork and cole slaw sandwich and he had the coconut crusted chicken. We couldn't decide which was best. Total tab was $40 and change with 2 glasses of wine. You really must try Hula's it will be the best favor you do for your taste buds!!

MhlHbY2WBE2tr4Gu_XVnlg.text: Super cool atmosphere, phenomenal food and wizardly crafted drinks make Hula's a guaranteed good time for anyone who enjoys the best parts of life! B-)

dh03LaRQxBB6qmqykZZGmQ.text: I think I may be obsessed with this restaurant. I've recommended it to so many people. It's a retro tiki bar, with really friendly service. I get the fish tacos, and the fish sandwich is TDF too. Also, try the Hangover drink - well, actually try any of their cocktails. Sweet potato fries FTW. They're also accommodating to big parties if you call ahead. LOVE THIS PLACE!

yYzMYOfqL6HuBKZsARHUuQ.text: This is a terrific place to get drinks and a bite to eat.   It's perfect for social events like happy hour or a date, or just to chill and watch people.  Strong drinks.  Awesome poke.

0T2YpmL_iQ0dzkfOiCvQBQ.text: Ok, third time here, l love it, food is great, prices are good. They even allow dogs on the patio. Only negative is that if you dine alone they treat you as if you weren't, meaning they leave you waiting as if you had someone to talk to.

PV03J-vyLYuAcArraCNuFA.text: I love Hawaii and I love rum and Tiki's and like Polynesian sauce from Chick Fil-A and I like Pineapples and cool looking glasses and happy hours.  I love Hulas because it has all these things.  What really makes this place is the drinks, I haven't had such good tropical drinks since i visited Hawaii, seriously they hold up and hold up well plus they come in awesome glasses that you can purchase or if your a real douche steal ( I don't condone that).  The only reason Hulas doesnt get 5 stars from me is the food, its been hit and miss for me.  Not bad but not AMAZING, and when you build a place like this with such fantastic drinks and an excellent ambiance you would only expect the food to follow suit.  That being said I will go again and try something new again and hopefully I'll find that dish that blows me away but for the mean time I'll enjoy drinking like I'm on a tropical island in the middle of the desert.

RMOcLpRzCOvGAk9V6WHEkw.text: I went there for lunch and had the awesome Calamari Sandwich!  The Calamari is lightly battered and is in large strips, looking more like a chicken breast than the tentacles I'm used to.  The sandwich was topped with Hula's special coleslaw that gave it a nice bite and crunch.  The Calarmari was tender and not rubbery at all.  The sweet potato fries were great side dish.  An excellent lunch meal.  My only complaint was that I was sitting under an airduct that was dripping water on me.

EA8IInbYMjCAsHdAmfDzQA.text: Hula's is set to replicate that of a mod 1960's, tropical bar with old surfer movies playing on the ceiling. The atmosphere gets five stars and the staff was friendly and service excellent but the food is overpriced and the food was satisfactory. I'm a huge ahi tuna fan; however, the Island Style Poke I wasn't completely impressed with. For vegetarians the Spicy Tofu Tacos were quite tasty but I would venture out to say that if you want a fun atmosphere with tropical style drinks, then this would be the spot. I was disappointed in the wine list but Hula's has a great selection of tropical drinks served in fun glasses. A fun spot for cocktails and their happy hour goes from 4-6 with $5.00 appetizers and signature tropical drinks. I won't say I'll never go in for drinks but the food I could live without.

NzkS2ilbljovOGXg4UmPPw.text: Honestly, this might not have been my first call ex ante as it seems like a place for a slightly younger crowd, but my dear love insisted that she needed a Dr Funk after the afternoons activities and so we went for an early dinner. We had a delightful time on the patio-ceviche, poke and butterfish were absolutely lovely as were the Dr Funks which seemed to have the desired effect, and I had a great view for the whole meal. I will definitely be back to this wonderful place.

HKzNMlqKotYVhtAwhd637g.text: The south seas grilled fish tacos were so excellent! Good atmosphere & great service well complimented an evening shared with newfound friends! I'll definitely be back...so many mouth watering menu items tempting me!

Sfmy5TJjY1xXEhkFwblCrA.text: I enjoyed a local brew and fantastic fish ceviche followed by shrimp and chicken taco. The food was fresh and well presented. The bar staff was very friendly and engaging and gave me advice on the best bar to watch a football game . The decor speaks Hawaiian complemented by text mex flavours on the menu. The outdoor dining area is large and open to the bar. I liked it and would definitely go back.

kiw0zxL_qhad3atKzrHbMw.text: I've probably been to Hula's half a dozen times now and figured it was time to write up a rather glowing review. Never have had anything but great service here, the food has always been consistently amazing and they make some awesome house cocktails. I've come for happy hour quite a few times, and we even came here on NYE for their live music and all-night happy hour - what a fun crowd and a great time. Brunch on the weekends has always treated me great as well, I love their spin on a benedict. All in all, a solid go-to spot with a fun theme in downtown phoenix.

Js9syfF2RofFMo7qrd-CAg.text: We order takeout at least once a week. Everything is delicious, even when the revolving takeout/host staff get it wrong (which is 98% of the time). The Fish Bites and Modern Tiki Fish Sandwich are my absolute favs., but whether they are served at lunch or not depends on who (again, takeout/host staff) you order from evidently. Atmosphere is fun! Never had a wrong order dining in.

jmWWzFxMzXTCiQ8fGPtlDA.text: Love the sweet potato fries!! Bartender lady was very sweet, but didn't know much about food. Good happy hour fantastic choice of alcoholic beverages. I will return

JQKBL9wIMXLXhXuy0Neeow.text: Been here a total of 3 different times and have been happy for each of those times!  Atmosphere: feels like you are in a tiki hut off some island :)  The food: have not had dinner here, but I can make a dinner out of coconut shrimp egg rolls and at Happy hour Prices....awesome deal, I think!  Drinks: i like them sweet, and they got them good, and strong, if you ask me.   Highly suggest the place, great atmosphere, several tvs so you can watch the game, sit outside and enjoy the nice Phx weather coming our way, or in the dining area. GO!

WqVUczlT1BCmWLC2GBYtdw.text: Sometimes you sacrifice sub-par customer service for great food, and other times you'll settle for sub-par food/drinks for the great customer service and ambience; amazingly you'll get the best of both worlds here. I have had nothing but great experiences every time I have been here and even told myself after my second to last visit that I would leave a positive review, but after tonight's service I made it a priority to leave my input. The service is always very attentive and kind, and the food and drinks selection is to die for. Me and my boyfriend swear by the cajun burger and mac and cheese both, paired with sweet potato fries and regular fries (they'll allow you to split both)--it's the stuff dreams are made of. The cocktails are fantastic in that they have a myriad of fun and exotic options for a reasonable price, yet they make sure not to skimp on the potency; notable selections would the blood orange martini (on the rocks) for a sweet and tart option, or a Scorpion Bowl (large tropical cocktail served in a bowl suitable for 2-4 people with a flaming shot of 151 in the middle) if you're sharing a good time with some friends. Our servers there have always been great, but a special thanks to both Kate and Kyle for consistently exceptional service. Both have truly gone above and beyond to accommodate our needs without batting an eyelash.   I work in reputation management so I understand the importance of great establishments getting the public praise they deserve. Every restaurant should strive to be like this one--Hula's employees and management, keep doing what you're doing, don't change a thing.

bdCjNKig4UEOGtRV_7Xnog.text: I was here with a group of about 10 for happy hour on a Saturday.  We sat on the patio, which was nice with misters for the whole area.  Our waiter was attentive and didn't balk at seperate checks (which I've had happen many times).  We all got a variety of rum based drinks, which were all very good.  The food was also very good, I got the chicken skewers and the pulled pork, and both very well cooked and flavorful.  I would have liked more chicken, or some veggies, for the price.  The staff was very good, refilling waters and handled the larger group very well.  I enjoyed the enviornment.  I would go back.

WbmuVt_yTYOr3LjmTS6UaQ.text: Went for brunch and was disappointed but based on the reviews I decided to give hulas another chance for happy hour  I would say drinks only. The food was bland as just sad ex: the rice not cooked and was actually crunchy

0z784ZTa5g_A51CujnRdNg.text: Throw the word "tiki" into any phrase and you've got a party.  No exception here.  Hula's has perfected the art of combining meat with fruit/sweets (love the coconut shrimp rolls) and those Hawaiian inspired cocktails that knock you on your butt.  Want a drink that's on fire? No need to head to Springfield for a Flaming Moe, you can order a cocktail here that literally comes in a flaming bowl.    The atmosphere is fun and the place is bright and cheerful in the day and dim and cozy at night.  The service is always excellent.  Or maybe that's just what you think after a couple of their drinks...   It's a great little spot, definitely worth your time to check it out!

riUDTQZueTMnY8KryX8rpQ.text: Have you tried their  banana coconut cream pie???? Get your butt over there and get it. There was even a layer of chocolate in there !! That is insane ....it was insane and only $6. Go get it right now.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. banana coconut cream pie : )

raaaVW1Imk4I9_hD2tgZgw.text: Do not go to this place...without me!!! Food great service was so fast I couldn't believe it . The waiter was very knowledgeable.. its a hipster crowd a little different but a great  environment.I want to go back really soon.!!

LcCrOfNCRK6NCHwjLDiSew.text: clarify - seats are resin plastic, not terrible for a patio situation.  I am upgrading review for two reasons; my brother who was with me dogged me for the rating, he felt it was an incredible night ( he is from Denver and wishes he could drop by anytime!!) and second the owner is engaged and messaged about my experience, I always give credit when feedback is embraced and responded too. That unfortunately does not happen nearly often enough for what is really a service business. Great place, now on my top places to go across the country!! And besides, who does not love a Tiki-Bar !!!

CUpA81NplP5GRDnjG-NwHw.text: Seriously, one of my favorite Phoenix eateries. Ceviche is the best in town, and the rest of the Hawaiian fare is simply delish. Fish bites are ridiculously yummy. Great beers on tap, and the service is laid back yet attentive.

O-MTFmHeMY2BDFsS_Q21RQ.text: Ah, to the many countless nights I have spent here soaking up what I refer to as "the best drinks in the valley" hands down. To the mornings I have spent recovering from similar nights.  Hulas will always be on the tip of my tongue the second someone ask "where should we go in Central Phoenix?"    The fish cakes are amazing, as is everything else.  The service is incredible.  The ladies there make sure I am never empty handed (even if that means delivering it to me while I get distracted hitting on certain people ::clears throat:: Dana)  Hula's is where I typically bring my first dates, just ask the servers I'm sure they will attest.  I have held my last two birthday parties here and they are always more than accommodating.    Whether is brunch, lunch, dinner or drinks you can't go wrong here.

-BklcWB3-yI9ht1j3w9ASQ.text: So happy there's a 2nd location in Scottsdale. Luv the drinks! Fun atmosphere! Luv the vegan options!

14mPDLPfEjBfFcKG5Tgzbw.text: **Note** Changing from 1 star because the proprietor responded, researched it and found out he'd been affected by white tuna sushi elsewhere.  They're keeping 'ex lax fish' on the menu though.  I just hope they advise the possible side effects.  We had an early supper here, no drinks.  Had borh the blackened and pan seared  Butterfish, very good.  I'd never heard of butterfish before but took the plunge.  What happened when we got home caused me to look it up: learned it has good texture and flavor - both check.  So why the 1 star?  Seems that butterfish is another name for a fish called escolar, which has vast quantities of wax ester in it.  Another name for excolar is "the ex lax of fish".  Right on.  For both of us,  We got lucky apparently, it is often worse and lasts for days.  Why have it on a menu when it can have these kinds of side effects?

oi5O-PJphbXTAvKU-vQlDw.text: The food here is great..good prices at happy hour too.  Problem here is the environment.  An open wall allows too many flies inside--I had to fight a bunch off my taco.  And the customers...SCUMMY HOMELESS types, the ones you see begging on the street--I always wondered where they spend their  money--They eat here!  NASTY!! And worse they appear to be 'regulars' since they are on a first name basis with the servers.  NASTY!!!   I will return but I think I will go to the Scottsdale location from now on--can't be any worse.

EVxpqjTGIcqZXB8VcYQ3lg.text: Hula's is my favorite place to be in Phoenix. The food is delicious and more on the healthy side. The drinks are amazing and, well, they are drinks - not so healthy =-) The staff are friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere is relaxed and I love the fact I can sit at the bar, have some ahi tacos and watch an episode of Gilligan's Isle on the big screen - or wall which ever you prefer (the batman the movie is fun to watch too!)

bTO3UejEVGBr3t_bKV-zxw.text: Love the atmosphere at this spot however I have to admit I was expecting more traditional Hawaiian food not Hawaiian fusion cuisine so I was a bit disappointed however everything we ordered was packed with flavor especially the wings!!

pbgYLifhURb8u_-4csf3Mw.text: Second visit before I left a review. Just to be sure. Amazing   The mi tai was amazing. Can't stop at one. I'm a huge jerk chicken fan. And a Jamaican visitor so it good.  I enjoy the sitting the servers and the food.  It's an amazing experience. Do it.

XZYYgAWE_qAidLVQdGSFRg.text: How can you go wrong with Hula's?  Answer, you can't. The vibe is super chill and is a fun tropical theme. Awesome section on the menu  (almost to many choices). They have some fun mixed drinks like the tropical itch (with an back scratcher) and the scorpion and great drink for two. The happy hour menu is hard to beat, the ceviche being my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour and  a fire pit, yes please.

tppNdFHEz7dOFX3-eYz6Gw.text: Top Notch food, excellent Pork sliders, Yummy pork tacos, delicious Ceviche, and sweet Crispy Coconut Shrimp Rolls.  Sooo good. Service was Good. But some confusion about Happy Hour pricing, only cocktails on weekend. But they were gracious about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vYf87NTXNjwDKUCOnJ6mKg.text: Been here a couple times with co-workers and every-time has been a good experience. Only bad thing about this place is the horrible parking.  This place is pretty clean, has friendly & fast service, and good food.  Top all this off with good company and it's a perfect experience. All my co-workers were happy with the place as well and nobody had to take any leftovers home.   Overall a great little place, I'll be glad to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu Spicy Tofu Tacos!

BhWghd75xWRGYh340fo3AA.text: I've been to Hula's several times (to the old location) and I thought I left a review. The reason for the 3 stars is because Of NOT having a changing table in their bathrooms old and new locations.  There are two stalls in the women's bathroom and one big one for disabled and one small one. I had to get creative and I took their bamboo end table into the big stall and used it as a changing table lol. I am not putting my adorable baby boy in a bathroom floor. That stall is big enough to install one on the wall. Of course I put the end table back. We went during the late afternoon. The food is delicious (unfortunately I can't have a lot of their food since I'm allergic to coconut...boo). The food is pricey. Service is great. I'll change my rating when they install a changing table in the big stall.

HWz-NkGFAhKDNJiZpws73g.text: Cozy, open and airy. A fresh modern take on tiki.... super minimalist on the tiki side with a a mid-century modern vibe. The bar is open and spacious with plenty of cozy booths to hide away in. We trekked for MANY miles to to check out this new (recently relocated) joint and were a little disappointed that the Captain's Cabin the "secret" speakeasy located next door was closed; Although, the manager did let us in for a quick peek. The drinks at Hula's were delicious! We sampled several and found them all to be above average to excellent (The Dr. Funk lived up to his namesake). On this occasion,  I drank my dinner; however,  the food pouring out of the kitchen looked and smelled delicious! Our server Tia was amazing... a beverage angel! 4 stars only because the Captain's Cabin was closed.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OumWjEy3H-fWe0y53c5j_g.text: Run here to get the fish bites. Seriously- I never would have ordered these on my own and what a mistake I would have made. Delicious fish, great texture in what seemed like a panko/cornmeal coating. Oh man. So good. The folks at the table next to me were locals, ordered them as well, and totally agreed. Also, this is the first place EVER, that I have tasted a crunchy sweet potato fry. Ordered the POKE bowl and it was delicious. Tuna was spot on. Service was good. Ate outside. Need the t-shirt.

X0vXul4JdtecuLwkc3mREA.text: Cory really knows how to take care of her customers. Fast service with a smile

iPazJjIhjG1tJcX7Qgz8pA.text: 4:00 pm on a Saturday, not too busy, sat at the bar. Excellent! Bean Burger! Delicious sweet potato fries! Delicious Chicken Teriyaki Pineapple sandwich! Amazing drinks! Relaxing atmosphere, perfect music, great service! Will DEFINITELY be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bean Burger

Us1_1uvhUll42jkn7wkVmA.text: Great food and service! Me being a pescatarian, it is very hard to find a restraint that gas more than a few selections for me to choose from, Hula's gas not just a few but many! The waitress even remembered my name after only one visit, that'll defiantly make you feel like more than just another customer

sNVqhsw4ZdqIu3VV21S9Zg.text: The new spot is nice on 7th street & Camelback/Missouri aka "The new restaurant row." Service was as nice as the previous location on central. The decor is a little more modern but not to over the top as to not lose their identity. Tiki bars may not be making a comeback but this place is doing a great job with keeping the spirit alive. The happy hour is great the drinks can be a little sweet but that's how you get caught off guard after a couple. Plenty of space since they opened up the old Ticos building. Once it cools down the outdoor patio will be the spot! Try the coconut shrimp rolls and have a dark/stormy cocktail and chill.

v8dky-Z3pIjIbWZhR4a0pQ.text: I have been coming to this Hula's for years.  It is one of my favorite spots in midtown.  So many memories coming to Hula's.  It would either be coming with a group of friends or coming late at night to have a drink after work or coming here on dates.  What matter which time or who I was with the service is always great.    One Wednesday's they have happy hour all night.  The menu is a decent size for being a happy hour menu. I normally get the pork tacos and a couple of Mai Tai's and I'm all set for the evening.    On the patio they have a big fire pit that they turn during the winter months. So that you can stay warm while you are drinking and eating. I enjoy sitting by the fire pit on night to keep me warm, since I'm cold all the time.   Last thing, if you feel like trying something different you should come to Hula's for there brunch and try the Spam Benedict.  It is amazing, I enjoy having it once in a while.

sG4CVfxHMVeVze_WB7coyw.text: Enjoyed American-Tiki infusion. Started with an Ahi appetizer. Great ginger and avocado blend with wonton bites.  For my entree I had a nice Ahi Caesar salad with a spicy mango dressing. You have to try the Hula Mai Tai. Be prepared for the first one, it gives you a kick.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hulas Mai Tai.

_e1iih-o_OIy7mdq7tGiWw.text: Cliff notes version - Food - ok, Service - Ok-ish, Drinks - watered down and mostly crap. Also why I try avoid the place if I can even though they are less than a mile out.   Now lets be fair, im not fond of the cuisine so I will say they have some vegetarian options, and they are good, again nothing great, but then thats not their main business. I would think its sea food and from my friends who have had food here it is pretty good.   Service - what service ? It can range form OK to abysmal depending on the mood of the person and that is reason enough to not bother.   Drinks - Absolute waste. I dont see why anyone would come here for their drinks .   2 stars and I'm being kind.

nidwM9LxRpjhMdrKJoFb8w.text: Have been loyal to Hula's for years - back when it was on Central. Visited on a recent Sunday and sadly, it was my last time. The drinks and food are ok. The service is horrible now. I love downtown Phoenix and have enjoyed watching it evolve and change demographics over the past three decades. This experience was horrible. I had to constantly get up and ask for service. When the drink I ordered was ready and sitting in front of the bar tender on the bar I was tired of it sitting there and asked the bar tender if I could grab my own drink. The guy shrugged and pretended to have no clue where the drink belonged and therefore was unable to help me. It was absurd. Service isn't always this bad but on this particular day ALL service was horrible enough to end my choosing Hula's.

K15_tGs9nb7Av9bf5F6Udg.text: Mostly pluses! Came at 5pm for early dinner.  Tried HH apps, pot stickers and shrimp egg rolls. Hearty portion, and pot stickers were rather thick and heavy, but tasted good.Tasty dipping sauce. Shrimp roll was very crispy fried half's of egg rolls. Pretty good.  Wife had Baja fish tacos, which she enjoyed. I had the 1/2 slab of BBQ ribs, and they were excellent! Came with perfect sweet potato fries and some forgettable cole slaw. Service was good, pleasant vibe. So glad we had an excuse to finally try this place.
