Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Movie on the ceiling!

c_3LZJBmswGNXntF3qZ-kQ.text: The atmosphere here is nice, the food and drinks were delicious. The service was ok but didn't turn me off from visiting hula again!

a8P5fffP80qQEPJS6KF90A.text: Interesting that it is asking me to review them, and yet I have already... twice! Not sure where my reviews are going. Sigh, Great place for happy hour, people watching, dinner etc. Check them out if you are in the area.  Side note: Sorry that my review is not more thorough, but when you have already reviewed them twice and given rave reviews I am not sure what else to say.

iB4274Eqpo9YGcrLVC7plw.text: We had a great time! Omg the food was shockingly good ... A little spicy yes but excellent. We are here on a Tuesday so we had the "2 N 2". 2 drinks , 2 apps for $20! A great deal! We had: Drinks- dr funk and painkiller( tropical / like pina colodas on the rocks.both drinks came in cool glasses! Apps: Hawaiian ceviche , albacore calamari( sauce on this was awesome) We were still hungry: Lobster bisque( a wee bit spicy!) Ahi tacos - spicy as well and even the beans had some heat... Very hip looking place w/ a great vibe .. Very casual and it even has an outdoor fire pit! Hopefully we will be back soon!

gRaH5WoyeKth_OXcNmA7nA.text: Awesome brunch spot! The basis of any brunch place is solid hash browns and this place delivers. The loco moco is a hangover cure and a little piece of heaven. I would also recommend the ahi eggs Benedict. The Cajun hollandaise sauce was lighter and more flavorful than other eggs Benedict.   The drinks were a lot stronger than I was expecting (which is not a bad thing at all). Our group of three avid drinkers got one of flaming bowl drinks to share and we at the perfect level of drunk while eating our food. The resurgence of tiki bars is something I don't personally don't grasp however this modern take on them is very conducive to a boozy brunch.

dzv0gVqpaINUa02Di8KkLw.text: I was told before going not to expect much. We decided to try it anyway...unfortunately the information I received was correct.    My wife and I both had the mahi.    Mashed potatoes were good, vegetables weren't cooked thoroughly and were a little cold, may have had something to do with my order not being correct and having to send it back.  Fish looked like a a square filet-o-fish from McD's...    Service was slow and we watched our server meander around with no apparent goal in mind.  And he only appeared to have our table and one other.  Not impressed with the service or the food...will not be back.

7QAMk54WmthTuB031tvM6g.text: Wow! Sat down for a quick refreshment and ended up staying all evening, the bartender Matt was hands down the most interesting man I've ever met, recommended the "Dr.Funk" and gave so much insight on the history of Funk music, I haven't stopped listening to Rick James ever since! I will definitely be returning next time I'm in the area, I just hope Matt is behind the bar.

MuPAXPOV478Uja9zlRCZXw.text: I've been to the old town Scottsdale location and it's amazing, wasn't so impressed with the downtown Phoenix location though. They were pretty slow to bring the menu and pretty slow to.come back to take our order. The food was ok, nothing I would go back for though.

mIjppJ-UXn73vTA1wC6b8A.text: Cute place with very friendly staff.  My wife loves the spicy Thai fish cakes, crisp exterior, flaky fish inside with very nice flavor.  I had the steak sandwich which was a bit tough but very flavorful.

_9oErdcLNpzl7ETehIdmUA.text: The new location is so beautiful! Very modern and spacious. They have a large bar area, a smaller intimately seated room, the main dining area and a large patio area.   Service was very friendly and pleasant. The menu is pretty big with a lot of choices! I always get the spicy Thai chicken bowl (it's seriously drool worthy) but tonight I decided to try their seafood. I ordered the mahi pan seared (no sauce) with veggies and plantains (I ALWAYS order the plantains, they are a must). My order came out wrong and I ended up having to wait another 20 minutes for it to come out correctly.. by then most of my party had almost finished their food. I was a little underwhelmed by my food mess up but it came out perfect the second time. Fish was very fresh, large portion, veggies were seasoned just right and the plantains are always delicious.   This is a great spot to bring out of town guests, it always wows them! I always leave hulas with a happy belly!

NHv6Eb6ecEpWgs8WjtdsGA.text: I came back to test the new location, great host, friendly bartenders, the bar top I was at by the host stand smelled like dirty rag.  I cleaned it off myself which smelled fine but while I was doing it the bartender helped me which was great but I think when I cleaned it smelled better.  Anyway her cleaning it made it smell way better than the first time I came it. It's great she helped.  The restroom looks cool, (men's) I like the walls.  The urinal is short like for kids though. :(   Food came fast which it always great.   Scorpion bowl is always great, glad they kept that!!!  I tried my favorite fish Maui but instead of my wasabi style I tried the one with the mushrooms, I was still good but I prefer the wasabi! I love it!   Performance and service standards have increased thank you M. Dana

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scorpion Bowl

eqjMRxmr-xoq6_n8bKhkPQ.text: Talk breakfast to me, baby!  I was in Phoenix visiting my little Grandma for Christmas and visiting all the tiki spots around town, when someone in one of the tiki groups I follow suggested Tiki Don and I visit Hula's Modern Tiki for brunch.  Now, I'm a pancakes-egg-sausage kinda gal myself, but I decided that I would give in and let the Don guide our brunch adventure.  I am so glad I did!!!!    This place is THEE best brunch venue I've EVER been to!  I ordered the plantain French toast with eggs, bacon and hash browns.  Don ordered the Mahi Eggs Benedict and some sausages.  Oh, we also ordered a Painkiller cocktail for good measure.  The food was abundant and tasted incredible!  I ate everything on my plates!  Don has been talking about those Benedicts for days!   The service was impeccable, the tiki mug selection was great (and affordable) and the tiki decorated room was rad!   5 solid starts from this foodie!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating with fire pit
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Painkiller tiki cocktail with a Rum float!

WbhADfdg40PMDtbOTh2wMw.text: While they were out of the wine we wanted, the second choice was good.   We ordered the Hula's fish tacos and chicken bowl.  Food was delicious and great service.  You won't be disappointed here and I am sure we will be back soon.   They have great specials throughout the week to try and prices are reasonable.   Please try this place and enjoy the great food and service as we did.   Jessica was being trained by Tia and they were perfect.   Many thanks for a great meal and experience.

uhhGSLU7D6vYlXVjjDk_ow.text: You guys nailed it! We were looking for "different" for lunch and it was GREAT! Good vibes from the staff, the atmosphere was modern and fun, and put food was so falvorful!   Probably not the spot I'd bring little kids, but my teen would love it and most definitely a girls night out spot!   I had the tofu curry bowl and it was so good!!! Vegan and all!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LISxwaXnTr-Y-K0p7GPqVw.text: This place has the best seasoned tofu I have ever tried! Being a vegetarian, it's difficult to find variety outside from your junk food such as fries and salads. Their spicy tofu tacos were such a delicacy that I crave for it out of nowhere just because the texture of the tofu and the seasoning were prepared so perfectly. Not only that, but their rice was literally the best rice I've ever tried! It was so soft and that is exactly what I love about rice! Not only that, but was there a hint of coconut to it? I've been told Hawaiian rice contains coconut. My parents recently went to Hawaii and fell in love with their rice because of the hint of coconut in it and have tried to remake it in the same flavor and texture but have been unsuccessful. Maybe I'll take them here one day to see if this place lives up to their expectations of Hawaiian rice!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BEST TOFU TACOS EVER

QN4dmFI8t6JE9sHKJOHn-g.text: They have a very good happy hour menu! Food and drink wise. (Especially food.) I was surprised with how much food was on their happy hour menu. Besides the spicy tofu taco, all of it was pretty good!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hawaiian Ceviche
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lilikoi margarita
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Tofu Tacos

ICLK6dpeawnJio6ycwWlBA.text: My go to place ! Love the atmosphere and great staff and food . Never dissapointed!!! The patio is small... but it is still cute! Ceviche to die 4! Drinks amazing.

MUcE0QkLteislzy1fr7gUg.text: Hands down my favorite restaurant in Phoenix so far. I've been here twice already and the wait is short and the food is fantastic.  My coworker and I come right after the gym so around 730-8. People sitting at the bar and outside and plenty of tables to go around. We ordered the Cesar spicy shrimp salad with extra shrimp and also another entree and they split everything for us without a charge! The salad is refreshing the shrimps are firm and tasty with lots of Cajun flavor. I wouldn't say it's spicy haha but delicious YES!  The lemongrass encrusted salmon was bomb af highly recommend it. We will def be back a couple more times while we are in town.

MbSpBqJr_rzkyvk6zqnnbw.text: The food was absolutely wonderful, and the drinks were no exception. We had one slight issue and it was taken care of eloquently by management and staff. At no point did we feel like we were imposing. We were catered to here, and the main courses are only second to the desserts.  Ashley was our waitress, and our service was impeccable!

JgTgxQIuDzRKImaxYzL90A.text: First time here and food was delicious! The ceviche has the perfect balance of spice and flavors. We had the jerk chicken and habanero chicken tacos. Very delicious and good portion size served.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hawaiian Ceviche

VsqxqxD9jGwA0K5soCyHJQ.text: Walked across the street to check this spot out with a friend on a Friday night. Our bartender was super friendly and took care of us even with a busy restaurant/bar. For my fellow mezcal lovers, they have it at the bar! Our bartender made us some Valentines Day drinks using the mezcal I requested and I was very satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lD18Hbqs-v_7-q0eWKnPKw.text: Hulas has been one of my favorite restaurants for quite some time. When I heard they had opened a new location, I definitely had to come and check it out. Parking at the new location seems fairly limited, but they did have a valet to hopefully alleviate with any parking woes there might be.   When I arrived, I was promptly greeted by the hostess and shown to a long table that would be ideal if I were there with 20 of my closest friends. Instead, there were 5 of us and I would have rather had a booth or smaller table for our party.   Since it was Wednesday, they had all night happy hour. Drinks and apps for $6 is a pretty great deal, particularly since you get generous servings with the appetizers.   Ordering my first beverage was no problem whatsoever - I got a Tiki Bastard and it came out promptly. As the rest of my group arrived, we were able to put in our first round drink and food orders. As the night wore on however, our waitress didn't seem to come back to check up on use quite as frequently. I had to wait quite some time before I was able to catch her to order my second drink.   Other than that, I split the Asian BBQ wings, sliders, fries and a key lime pie with a girlfriend. The wings were tangy and sweet and perfectly crisp. The sliders while not the best, you get 3 for $6 during HH so cant really complain. The key lime pie had a crispy crust but I think could have used a little more lime flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Such great wings!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dr. Funk
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Key lime pie! Perfect end to a yummy meal

85mhz1ppdqoErirxvddLKw.text: What's the time between lunch and dinner?! Hula is the perfect spot for a quick meal and of course drinks. The ribs were over cooked but Cherise took care of it! I didn't complain because the flavors were still delicious , simply suggested for the next customer. Cherise didn't make me feel bad for speaking up because sending back for is always risky! Thanks Cherise for great customer service !

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribs, edamame and tacos

VVkwIjMG6WUz6c8pCmlyKg.text: Yum! When you can't get to Maui for a mai tai Hula's is the place to go. The food and ambiance is great too!

KUbHzNQUm6eA-9FtwZ9WsA.text: A Phoenix favorite! Such an awesome place, absolutely delicious food and the staff is always been friendly. Been dining at Hula's for 3 years now and I recommend it to people all the time!

gcptBw8f1DS_9mf0DRft6A.text: Love this place! Amazing food and service. We've been here several times and always enjoy the laid back vacation-y vibe. The loco moco is a favorite of mine, but the hangover hash, crispy chicken tacos, and fish tacos are also great. Can't wait to come back!

v-of-DlpPF_I4vv6OeWTSA.text: I had the hang over hash this time. It was ok I don't think I would get it again. Very disappointed to hear Kat was leaving.

ETlAB7nhJJdDaunRUtk5CA.text: Had dinner here last night, it didn't get off to a great start ...  there was a long wait for a table so we grabbed a seat at the bar... the bar staff (or at least the one that 'when she felt like it' bothered to serve us) were unfriendly, inattentive and borderline rude.   Fortunately it got better, the servers at the table were great, the food was better than average and the drinks were fun.   We went for a couple more drinks in the little bar next door after our meal, 5stars to that guy, the bartender was awesome!

f8QFPNItsDbSJrxCZH6zFQ.text: Great cocktails, if you're in the mood for something tropical or as Jimmy Buffet calls them "Boat Drinks" this is the place. The food is well prepared and very good.

MJ5HL5IjhNimcY2N4NtNKw.text: Hulas is one of my favorite restaurants! I keep coming back for their pork tacos and their shrimp rolls! My friends and I have tired almost everything on the menu and have never been disappointed!

TbRODSYK4vlvK-LTmDlrwQ.text: First time here. I decided to grab something to eat since my business partner was running a little late. We had an event to attend on the opposite side of the street. The service and food was really good. I had the Baja tacos. The order had taken longer than what I would have thought since I was the only one at my table. Outside of that plenty of food for one person. The only downside is my limes were dried out and not enough salsa. Outside of that I would definitely return.

T0VY1yZ4_-TyQKtEPegKiw.text: This was the site for the first ever Back to Drinking UYE. Yelp friends getting together for happy hour. Wednesday is all day happy hour at Hula's so that is why Wednesday was picked this time. I called them a day before to let them know we were coming and they had no problem reserving a spot for us. I have never been here before but I have always wanted to try a Tiki place and had heard good things about this place. Everything I had heard was True. This place is great. I like the decor a lot and the Elvis movies projected on the wall was pretty cool too. I didn't even realize there was a whole other sit down area on the other side until just before I left. The staff was very nice. Our waiter, who's name I didn't catch, was very good. As people showed up he came over with ice water and asked what else they would like and was always checking up to make sure everyone was ok. They had reserved a long table for us across from the bar and we had 12 people show up all together. Good turn out for the first one. I like the fact that they have Longboard beer on tap. All the appetizers were very good and the drinks were good too. There were a few drinks that I personally didn't like but that was just me. The Hawaiian Ceviche was the the first app out of the gate for me. A white fish with coconut milk, chili, cilantro and garlic served with giant wonton chips. That was so good. Great way to start off and it keep getting better. Next was Spicy Thai Fish Cakes. The white fish again with cilantro, chili, red onion, fish sauces and ginger. Very tasty. Then someone said potstickers and I love potstickers so had to get some of those. When they came out I noticed that they were fried and that worried me because some times places fry them too long and they get very tough but these were just right. I probably ate too much and drank too much because the bill was a little high but I had a great time and so did everyone else. I wasn't to thank Hula's for putting up with us. I will definitely be back and want to try more than just apps next time. I love the Tiki glasses too. They whole night was awesome and I want to thank everyone who came out. I can't wait for the next Back to Drinking UYE. This place goes on my new list of favorite bars.

CkJXTwkqQ48aalsOiIaYSQ.text: Freaking tacos man. THOSE TACOS. It's all so delicious. They have an absolutely gratifying albacore salad. Wonderful drinks. I love it when I'm loving rum. You gotta drop a pretty penny but it's totally worth it. I believe they have some excellent happy hour specials and they have a rockin' brunch. Whoever picks their music is doing good and those movies being projected add a nice touch.

dP8WDV_od_VQ_AH5skzU4w.text: I went in there expecting not to like it but ended up loving it the food was exceptional I had the veggie burger and it was one of the best I've had in town the painkiller drink it was delicious quite sugary but they really are so there's was good and the Decor was pleasant was very friendly and helpful I will definitely be back

1r8j98-HxuVoX4pi08iNQw.text: I would do bad things for a plate of Hula's Jerk fish.  (It can also be made with tofu, chicken or pork)  I'd probably lick their jerk sauce off of an old shoe.  I'd share a johnny cake with a prison inmate if it meant I got to eat the other half.  I'd go on a date with a homeless man as long as we came here.  If I had to, I'd pour the entire dish in my purse and eat it out with chopsticks.

KgOG6N-FX1ZOHB73-pLX4w.text: A year or so ago, I wrote a review after visiting Hula's that was not favorable. I didn't think I would ever give the place a second go. Tuesday night, however, another couple suggested we meet up for drinks there. I had been laid up for two days and was feeling better, so getting out of the house seemed really necessary, and one good thing Hula's still had going for it was that it was walking distance to my house. Another good thing it still had going for it was the drinks. So, distance and drinks in mind, the boy and I decided to give Hula's another chance.   I don't know when it was in the past year, but Hula's radically changed their menu. There's still fish with a variety of rubs and some BBQ stuff, the menu seems twice the length. Once I realized the menu was so different, I decided I had to try the food, so I went with the Seared Ahi Tacos, part of their Labor Day special, and it was like a complete 180 from my memories of last year. Even the rice was ten times better. The other couple we were with had split a steak sandwich, which they loved,  including the salad that came with it. I wasn't hungry enough to eat both the tacos that were on my plate, but I wished I was. SO GOOD!  I also had the Hula's Hurricane, which I picked because it was the only drink that didn't have syrup or seem like it was mostly juice, but it was good. After a couple rounds, we decided we needed to try the scorprion bowl, which comes out lit on fire, so that's obviously a win. It's pretty sweet, but very tasty, and gets you in exactly the right mood to decide to go to Rosie's for karaoke.  The service was an issue last year, and to some extent still is. Our server was really nice, but we had a couple of empty glasses for a while, and I hate waiting to get a refill on a $8 drink. A couple of times the bartender brought our drinks over, and he was nice, too.   I'm really happy I decided to check out Hula's once more. I love the MCM vibe, and that patio is perfect for our 79 degree autumn nights. With the changes in the menu and quality of the food, I'll definitely be hanging out there more throughout the coming months. It really looks like Hula got it in gear. Add a few more attentive servers and it will be in tip-top shape for a Cen Pho restaurant.

L_SCi-0zOHQpLEv20kb07A.text: Hula's is another place that is on my bucket list and a few friends met here for dinner before seeing a show at Crescent Ballroom. We went on a Saturday evening and it wasn't too busy, which doesn't surprise me for a DTPHX restaurant on the weekend. We started off with coconut shrimp rolls and potstickers, which were very good. In hindsight we probably shouldn't have gotten them though because the entrees are HUGE. 3 of us had burgers while the other had a bowl, and 3 of us took about half of our meals home (and I had mine as a drunk midnight snack). I had the cajun burger with regular fries and a cocktail which all come in adorable Hawaiian themed glasses. The service was great and the price was on point with what we received. They definitely lived up to the hype.

et3dGPkZttE1UvLoR76H5Q.text: All of my experiences at Hula's have been pleasant. Sitting at the bar or by the fire, it's a good atmosphere. The waitstaff are cool and the food service is timed nicely. I'm trying to find excuses to give more stars, but there is something just pulling back my fourth star and I think it's the sparkle. There is no sparkle for me.  The food is ok, but not awesome. Some things are done very well like the jungle sauce on the tofu or the fish on the fish sammie. But other things are not, like the actual tofu or the bread on the sandwich. Not a fan of the super sweet cocktails, and no wine specials for happy hour. To boot, I just don't get that feeling of soaking up the sweet Phoenix scene that's common to the Central/Camelback hot spot.  I always feel a little confused after coming here. My belly is full but my taste buds underwhelmed. Eager to be part of a cool neighborly social joint but not feeling the sweet CenPho vibes. The feeling is more like, [head cocked to the side, shoulder shrug] "That was aight."

mlWHv5sTSDQkM630ViUzhA.text: After an insanely long weekend that involved work, diving and catering a baby shower (don't ask) I was in serious need of some downtime.  On a Sunday afternoon there just aren't many options, so I decided to finally try Hula's.  The atmosphere is very relaxed, which is exactly what I needed.  At 3pm the place was mostly empty, but it was obvious that the other patrons were having a great time.  I'm going to sum up my perfect, relaxing meal.  Blackened ahi with a wasabi cream sauce (damn good!), a bevy of island themed beverages and Dramarama playing in the background.  Could it get any better?  Now that I've sampled what Hula's has to offer I see the very real possibility of becoming a regular.  Bonus points for being within biking distance!  Thank you Hula's for giving me a mellow afternoon.  PS- Get the Blood Orange martini on the rocks.  You will swoon.

kHWXs2QzodKiVvTuGMxnLg.text: It was my first time and as soon we went inside very nice friendly hostess and our server very nice and friendly food was great and they have best keylime pie, and good price, I will go for sure again.

LowQM3MkfLBBlGodggHQeA.text: Big fan of Hula's been a bunch of times, but finally was compelled to write a review.  Just came back from a week in Maui, so I was still in "Hawaii-Mode" (which is soooo hard to get out of lol), so I insisted we go to Hula's to get my Hawaii fix.  Mainly....that just means I was dying for a good Mai Tai.  If you go here, you MUST order a Mai Tai.  While most of their drinks are pretty good and tropical tasting, the Mai Tai is the best in town (now that Trader Vic's is donzo).  I'm a Mai tai snob, and cringe when most mai tai's here on the mainland are made way way way too sweet and fruity.  The Mai Tai at Hula's could rival some of the best in Hawaii in my opinion.  Mostly rum (white and dark) and just the right amount of sweet mixed with the right amount of tart/sour.  They go down great and they hit you with quite the kick before ya know it, so be careful ;-)!  As far as the food...its good, but its not Roy's so don't except anything amazing.  I usually get fish here, just to go with the whole Hawaiian thing.  Most of the times I've had Mahi, it can be dry sometimes, but always tastes good.  Ive had both the wasabi crusted and the macadamia nut crusted, both are decent.  The Luau Pork plate is darn good, but my recommendation is get the Luau Pork sandwich instead.  It goes so much better on bread, than just by itself.  All the appetizers are great to munch on while you're enjoying your Mai Tai...all thats missing is Hawaiian music, and the sun setting over the ocean :)

fV4DRu5PKukYf-2TOEz58Q.text: Here this afternoon to try the eggs benedict with spam! That's right SPAM! Oh yeah, it was pretty darn good.  Although my dish was good some minor improvements can be made to make it perfect; toast the muffin more, mine was hardly toasted at all and the hollidase sauce needs a little more pizzaz, it was on the bland side.   Overall, I really like the food here, both brunch and dinner, love the location and atmosphere, great patio, and pretty decent servers.   PS. Dog friendly patio!

vfoz9ic49hFStqgf1gDnUg.text: Since the last writing, the owner has gone out of his way to make everything better.  I've never been treated with such courtesy or respect by a business owner-- truly a changed perception.  We've received a lot and more in the way of makeup cred, and while this is not to encourage others to write bad reviews, I believe Dana, the owner, really cares about his clientele.  The kitchen has gone above and beyond to make everything we have ordered hot, fresh, and delicious.  Congrats on the perfect turnaround, guys, and many thanks for the conversation and remuneration.  Well done.  5/5

f3O5g3z-zztdwWY8dixhjA.text: *This review is based on drinks only*   My sis Jacinthe & I participated in the Cupcake Crawl last night & it was a lot of fun! Hula's was the 2nd stop from 7-8pm. Their happy hour ends at 6pm Mon-Fri, but they let us crawlers have the happy hour prices, nice. There wasn't much room for us so we had to stand at 1st, ugh, but then 2 ladies left early to the next stop & we snagged their seats. We ordered the blood orange & pink bikini martinis (only $5 each, regularly $7). Both were so yummy! We also got to sample lil cupcakes from Nothing Bundt Cakes, white chocolate raspberry FTW! Since it was nearing the time to head to the next stop we only ordered those 2 cocktails, but I wish we had time for another round because they were so delicious & cheap! The only complaint we had was that it was super hot in there & we had to use menus to fan ourselves. I do have to say I love that open patio though, it would be so nice to sit out there & have cocktails in the fall & spring time. I would definitely return for happy hour & maybe sample some food!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blood orange &amp; Pink bikini martinis

jgZCRJ7i5pNdyp16Z1CD9A.text: everything is delish.  go on the weekend for $2 mimosasssss!!!  its very trendy, a great place to just sit each and enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drinks!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The front of the place

jailb40MxHXeAC2RyOeg8Q.text: I've only been here once, but loved it!    It definitely has the urban vibe. I had a hamburger with the hula sauce on the side - delish!  It was cooked perfectly with great flavor and served on yummy bun. Wish I could have eaten the whole thing, but it came with amazing sweet potato fries and I filled up on those.  Probably the best I've ever had!  Seems like a great place for happy hour so I'll definitely be coming back for that.

XNTsuciFSyfQy5HbtMCpmg.text: My friend and I had dinner here on Saturday night.  The weather was great and we were able to score a nice table on the outside patio.  The service was quick and friendly.  I had a beer and my friend had one of their specialty rum drinks that he liked a lot.  I ordered the blackened hapu fish plate that came with wasabi mashed potato and greens.  The fish  fillet was a fairly thin and I think that may have contributed to it being a little overcooked.  Overall it was a good experience.  Probably more due to being out on the patio and the good service rather than the food.

zeOuFuxDMCrl2h2baJ1Djg.text: First time here and the food was amazing, very flavorful with fresh ingredients. Service was good and very fast. Definitely going back soon

InSlNvX_-p87f7zH73FJEg.text: Upon arrival this location appeared to be lively and upbeat. Within minutes we realized that the wait staff however was unorganized and unprepared for a large group. Even with reservations the location was unable to accommodate more customers unless you had the right look then to apparently you could walk right in and get a table for two or six in under five as two other groups did. Requesting to speak with the manager proved to be pointless. He quickly dismissed my concern and made no attempt to rectify the issue. Since half of the party was already seated we continued to wait for additional 22 minutes before being seated. Unless the food is to die for this will be my first and last visit.

JYYXGW17pP89P3npHRvrAA.text: Just sort of happened upon Hulas today and am I glad I did. The Lobster bisque was luscious and tasted great with the house salad (yummy dressing). Cool atmosphere and super friendly staff. I'll be back!

-L7R0oEuMLp9O91hWXbh6Q.text: within seconds of posting my review, the owner messaged me and offered to buy me tacos!! this just made me love hula's even more.  dana, i will be back- a lot, we had such a great time.  you had me at hula.

I1BgIQNE9f8Vfj4cUYn2Rw.text: Pretty good but I get mighty disappointed by jerk that doesn't melt my face off.

lObkHZRrR2Gqri-q5Kolig.text: I have passed this place many a time, mostly when they are closed. So last week after my in-home massage, it was finally the right time. I didn't feel like doing anything but eating and chilling. On our walk over the place looked very inviting. I'm a patio person, so they had me at the entry point. They have so many tables and chairs in their humongous patio! My favorite sitcom, Gilligan's Island, was playing on the tube in the bar area and the Tiki torches were lit. It was a nice ambiance with the big fire pit, kinda felt like I was in Hawaii, except for the metro in the backdrop (oh how I love thee Metro!). It was around 7:30pm and there were a few people sporadically place around the fire pit, so it was sure to be a great night.   I was in the mood for fish tacos and had the Hapu fish tacos (delicate white fish) which was served with black beans, topped with a drizzle of sour cream, both served atop white rice $13. Most of my food was served just lukewarm, but i overlooked it and piled the salt on the rice and beans after my first taste. It tasted much better with salt, even though I'm not really a salt girl anymore.   The fish tacos were kinda pricey but i figured it must be DELICIOUS. The rest of the menu was a little higher than usual, especially when the food is served by a food server with a dirty white kitchen towel slung over his shoulder. I cringed when I noticed my sisters Ceviche chips were touching that nasty towel. He noticed me notice it, then left the chips on the plate and brought out a little dish with fresh chips. That was too much for me, because in a fish restaurant you never know what kind of stuff ends up on them there rags, but it wasn't my plate and she was okay with it, so we moved on. The spring mixed salad was an instant fav, with its shredded daikon root vegetable tasting so deo and the delicious ginger dressing. It was the first time I had been served a spring mix with romaine lettuce thrown in the mix. I didn't let a bit go to waste. The fish tacos were drizzled with a sweet dressing over the slaw of cabbage and it was a little weird for me, as i'm used to having a tasty salsa drizzled over the tacos with some citrus. I cut the fish in halves and made two tacos into four. I guess for the amount of slaw the price was on the money, but I wan't too happy with the rag touching the food. Other than that a touch back when the food is dropped off might not happen so make sure you ask for all you need at the order. I will definitely be back, but next time i'm sitting at the bar.

sb6M3shjUTa9U801GQTMHQ.text: Great ambience, and the Black Scorpion drink is a must!

lDZznPbJodVlv37dN3GlVw.text: Arrived in Phoenix early Friday evening and after I had seen Ina ( The Barefoot Contessa) eat some fish tacos I knew I wanted some too. My cousin had told me about this recently opened place that he had only tried once before and said it should be a great choice for Polynesian food. I got the grilled fish tacos which were good good all except for the sides. They ran out of rice ( at least that was what I was told) so I asked for coleslaw  and then the black beans were still kind of hard. My cousin had the pulled pork with coleslaw and rice on the side and that was  good too. Overall my meal was ok and the atmosphere was nice. I admired the misting system especially because Phoenix is so hot. I may try it again on my next visit just to see if they improve.

s888krrpPXlPQa2i_XcRaA.text: I love this place as a bar.  The tiki decor is fun and I love that the whole building opens up.  Super fun space and the bar staff are great.  It satisfies me when I need a super fruity fru-fru drink.

jmQMxGU4FSceZSqV83gGOQ.text: Nice staff, cool atmosphere, great drinks,,an the jerk chicken was pretty darn good.. if you like drinks try the mai tai

_wgPSiI-3jS0eeIYBC3N8g.text: Most amazing sweet potato fries of my life, though my server was a tad on the rude side.

D_EdEC5tomMl8a9k_PI_sQ.text: So my wife have been here twice now. The first time, we had went close to when they had first opened and decided to sit on the patio. What a great meal with an awesome view. We had the Island Style Poke, Crispy Shrimp Egg Rolls, Johnny Cakes and Seaweed Salad. The Poke is absolutely amazing, I could eat two or three for my meal. The crispy shrimp rolls were pretty good too. I wasn't a HUGE fan of the Johnny Cakes, but that could just be my palate. The Seaweed Salad was very good, very fresh tasting.  We decided to get takeout last night, and again went for the Poke, my wife ordered the Island Style Ceviche and I went for the luau plate. As always, the Poke was phenomenal!  My wife went nuts for the ceviche. It was different than most ceviche's I'd had, it had the acid of a traditional ceviche but the also add in coconut milk to soften the acid, it was good (but I'm not really a ceviche guy). My food could have been totally awesome. The flavor was fantastic, but the menu stated sticky rice (I'm from Seatle and a total teriyaki whore, I know me some sticky rice) and the rice was not the slightest bit sticky, and not quite finished..and room temperature. The flavor in the pork was very very good, but again it was barely room temperature (and mind you, I live only a 3 minute drive from Hula so had it been hot when I picked it up, it would still at least be warm when I got home)  The slaw was very good, very fresh. I ate the entire meal, but would like it executed better next time. Will I order the luau again? hell yeah! I also spotted a luau sandwich with slaw that I may give a shot to next time.  Overall, this is one of our new favorites in the area.

b7Pznfv01enSQKM1MckYfQ.text: I'm very impressed by the appearance of the place.  It has a nice outdoor area.  In the Spring, Fall and Summer, this will be a nice place to hang out.  They also have great drinks here.  I had a pink bikini martini which was quite tasty, while another had the blood orange martini which was delicious.  The mai tai looked good, but I didn't try it.  The food was just okay.  I had a pork sandwich with sweet potato fries.  Not bad, but not great...needed a bit more flavor (could have used a kick to it)...the service was quite good though.

OJ5qSvPdvmvZAi36oiWVTA.text: Came in on a Saturday night just before the rush and got seats. Healthy menu and fun drinks. Loved my fish tacos with black beans and rice.  Only complaint: we were jammed in ( the table are close). Don't expect to have private conversations. Just good food.

N0P6bkUg__ceYY9a7XZcAA.text: My friends from work went to Hula for our team's Xmas gathering. It was out first time for everyone and we were very impressed. We went b/c we heard about the great HH special they do on Wednesday's. HH prices on apps and drinks till 11pm. The patio outfront looks great, cant wait to chill out there once it warms up! We sat inthe main dining area. The decor was great, old retro pics cover the walls and great tiki mugs on another. We all order our drinks and numerous app's to try everything. The food was great, very flavorful, good spice and it came out hot. I would suggest the Hawaiian Ceviche, crispy coconut shrimp rolls and the Fish cakes for apps, they were soooo good. For my cocktail I would highly suggest the Tiki Bastard, has Bourbon, Gin, Ginger Beer, lime and maraschino liquid. Not one complaint on any of it. The HH prices on all app's and drinks was a great deal. I can't wait to go back again!!!

qAfHGIKLCAZp8nB0agAmWg.text: Hula's is a great addition to our neighborhood, and we've never had a disappointing experience. Great drinks, fresh and tasty apps and main courses, and a very cool staff. We usually go on Monday nights and John takes great care of us at the bar. He makes us feel welcome and appreciated. Thanks, John!  Ken

7EulJDyZrq3e3nsasQEoyw.text: This was my second experience with Hula's for brunch. Another big disappointment. I had the big breakfast sandwich. It does look really good. I ordered it specifically from seeing it on a table next to us. My companion had the hangover hash. Both were a big let down. I had the hash before so I was not surprised at that. The hashbrowns that accompanied it was I think probably the worst I have had, quite rubbery and tough. Its apparent that they had been cooked earlier in the day and kept warm until needed and maybe kissed the flattop before serving. The bread of my sandwich received similar treatment. It was toasted some time previous to serving. But by the time the bread hit the table it had lost any hint of being toasted. It looked toasted but it was soft as any plain white bread fresh out of a bag and bland. Maybe a brioche would have been a better choice. The sandwich overall was fairly bland. It could have used a little kick. Some better cheese maybe, or more flavorful bacon. Thankfully a couple slices of tomato saved the day. I will say the mimosas are cheap. Only $2 a glass. Kudos for that. Service was excellent. Very attentive. And the ambiance is great. If I hadn't tried the hashbrowns this time I may have given it 3 stars but I gotta knock em down to 2 stars due to the poor taste.

CXArGFWveVIm-pRBZ338Wg.text: Best happy hour hands down! The pink bikini martini or the pain killer are excellent drink choices and they are definately strong. I had to take the light rail home. Thank goodness the light rail stop is conveniently located a block down. The food was alright, but the drinks (very reasonably priced for happy hour) the ambiance, and the location are what make me crave more!

deVqfw10JFWFCP-uL9A1oA.text: Tasty and cool, this is a welcome differentiated place in Phx.  Not many Hawaiian themed joints around, esp ones that deliver the goods.  We go for lunch often, have never made it for dinner.

xuxHj2fsGis-6_M9hYPUMA.text: stopped by this past weekend for drinks and food. tried the habanero chicken tacos and they were awesome! my wife had some tofu dish with jungle curry sauce and fried plantains. i am a total meat eater but i loved what she ordered. i would tell you what we drank but that stuff was so good and strong i had forgotten what they were called. we will definitely go back sometime soon. fun atmosphere and great service. also a good place for a date or hanging with the friends.

BPpVwjrMD3BzkK0A1N7moQ.text: I have been to Hula's three times now. Third time's the charm I guess, which is why I'm finally taking the time to write this review. Most people feel more inspired to yelp when something in their experience goes terribly wrong, however, I am compelled when something is exceptionally right. (third visit) I'll tell you about the first two so you understand even more why I decided to finally yelp for the first time.  First visit-Met a friend for a drink at the bar. It was kind of early, one bartender was busy cutting fruit but she seemed nice and smiley. The guy bartender that helped us was a dud. No personality, no recommendations and had a great opportunity to up sell our ticket but missed out. We called him Dopey from the 7 dwarfs. Strike one.   Second visit-My spouse and I decided to grab dinner. It was last Tuesday night. The place was pretty slow, we stood up front waiting to be sat....when the hostess finally walked up she seemed clueless and irritated, like we were interrupting her bathroom break or something. (not a great first impression) Our server brought us waters then disappeared for about 20 minutes. By the time he returned we decided to forget the cocktails and just order dinner because we were hungry. We shared two meals, both were ok, but just OK. Spouse wanted dessert but the magician server who kept vanishing appeared with the check after our water glasses were empty and our dirty plates had been sitting in front of us for way too long. (understandable from Denny's or IHop but not a place like this) We paid,left and went to Lux instead of trying to get a dessert menu. Strike two.  Third visit-Finally something good to say. After experiences 1 and 2 I didn't care if I ever returned to Hula's but a coworker tricked me and there I was again. (too polite to refuse my coworker after I realized his choice for dinner) This time it was after a long day, I was slightly grouchy and definitely not expecting much after the last two adventures. We were greeted immediately by a smiling server. (she even opened the door for us) She sat us, showed us the "signature" drink menu and a "Tiki Time" menu. She said if we had any questions she would be happy to assist and she would return with ice water. We noticed she had several other tables that were spread throughout the restaurant but sure enough she quickly returned with water, a smile and her genuine bubbly personality (those of you who have had fake-nice service know what I mean, we can tell the difference between the two) She recommended drinks that were on happy hour so we saved money, not wasted it and told us her favorite appetizers that were sure to please for five bucks. When I asked about the beers she told me about the draft and bottle selection. I've never heard of Longboard or Drifter, she described them and even offered me samples! This chick is awesome. She recommended the Tiki Bastard to my coworker, she asked first if he liked ginger because there is ginger brew in it, he does and he loved the drink. (she is smart for asking because if he didn't like ginger, this drink would not be for him) The apps came out quickly and we had everything we needed to enjoy our time. She never made us feel rushed to decide on entrees and she was attentive but not annoying because we were, of course, talking about work. She provided excellent service throughout the entire experience and because of her we will be back. She made a lasting impression on both of us and turned my sour mood very sweet. By the way, her name is Tia. I was so impressed with the service I wonder why she wastes her customer service talent in food service but I'm sure I'm not the only guy that has tipped her more than 20 percent so it makes sense.   Other notes: The building is awesome, modern mixed with some vintage decor.  Very reasonably priced. Not sure about the music choice.  Old videos play on the wall from a projector. Neat fire pit on the patio. Service sucks unless you ask for Miss Tia.

QsE2hXTzm5LudFc5IyUE5g.text: We went back for dinner. Fun night out!  We tried the Jerk chicken, Jerk pork, black bean burger and fish tacos. Everything was tasty. Loved my Zombie and the hubby had a One-eyed Pirate, delish. Lovely island atmosphere, I love what they have done with this building. Great all over experience. We shall return to our island in the desert again soon.

meo9e2A0lbxCVSuKZWc2LA.text: This is a really neat place. I've only been for small plates but have eaten my face off. Yup. Maybe I shouldn't be bragging about that.   "Grazes. Watch your valuables tho." "Will leave no blade of grass unturned." "Has the mouth of a Hoover."  Er - perhaps I should revise those warning labels. What I'm trying to convey is that the food here is gosh darn good. The service is always with a smile. And this place is super group friendly. This can be dangerous. Watch out! I mean, for your waist lines!  I'm going to start with a SERVER SHOUT OUT.  My most recent adventure was under the tutelage of a bomb diggity server named William G. (#68). This kid was zip zagging seamlessly inside and out to help a number of large tables. I gotta tell you something - come closer - this kid is solid gold. Waiting on groups is not like taking attendance. (Unless that involves herding cats in the dark.)   There's a reason they ask for your party to be present in order to be seated. It's so taking orders is easier. Did we do that? Nope.  Were we consistent in our ordering pace all night? Nope.  Did we have a lot of questions? Uh huh.  Did he ever break his smile? Nope.  Did he have time for me to point out a $0.50 HH hour difference on the menu for a draft beer? Um, NO. The kid was still smiling and super pleasant to boot. Gold! (Probably hates me.)  HAPPY HOUR Dood. They have four beers on tap, generally on the lighter side. (Note: Currently stocking a Koko Brown which is dark, "coconut inspired" which I am a fan of.) $3.50 or $4, not sure. Whatever the price it's a good deal before 6pm.  Late to HH? Can't be here by 6pm?  Follow them on Twitter for their "Word of the Day". You'll want it for super special pricing on drinks. (I heard you can also receive it via email.)  FOOD Holy Smoke! There are very rich foods (watch those waist lines) and delightfully healthy, small portion options. HOH so good! My photos have some of my favorites. Right now what I would give for a HH tofu or pork taco.  (Yeah, I went out last night. Need some replenishing.) $3 provides a taco that can be served into *two* portions. That rules! And it fits with my balanced approach to not exercising.   Hey! I'll get back to the gym.  Someday. Right.  Until then, I'll come drink and be merry. Here.  And, apparently at the new location that is opening in Scottsdale.  TOO MANY CHOICES!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Taco!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu Taco!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beans!

4lN5SEgYANxepKSwpVvBzw.text: I previously went to the Scottsdale location and happened to be closer to home when we chose to visit Hula's on Central, and I honestly prefer it. The decor is a bit more retro than the Scottsdale location, but the layout is just as open and the food just as delicious.  It wasn't nearly as crowded and the wait staff was much more engaged. I had to order the french toast again and another double mimosa for brunch.  I was NOT disappointed.  The toast wasn't a piping hot or crispy as I would have liked but I still managed to slaughter it. My friends also both enjoyed their meals of some sort of omelet and the eggs benedict.  I don't have much to say about it other than that as I was too busy stuffing compote down my gullet.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Even the indoor seating makes you feel like you&#39;re outdoors

sRJY8yr38gVArveT8zyo0w.text: I just went here tonight for the first time with friends and had a great experience. The ambiance was nice and the food taste pretty good and had a nice presentation. It's right off the main road of you're on the patio with cars whizzing by, but besides that I had no complaints.

dj1aR7MNy8inHfy-BaIr0g.text: I love this place. I was craving for some fish tacos and they were amazing! It came with very tasty salsa, I fell in love- my taste buds were so happy.  I know this place is well known for their drinks, I wanted to try but didnt. Although a few people next to me had a volcano bowl that they said was pretty tasty.   The layout was nice, they had their patio but it was wet from all the rain. Inside was nice- cute decor, very trendy design.  Service was quick and friendly. No long waits and they come to check on you often. Overall, very nice place- definitely will be back with others to try the volcano bowl :)

M9UBRo0X9VOkQNmu_xLZGQ.text: Hula's has captured perfectly that hip, urban, midtown Phoenix atmosphere. You'll always find a crowd, their fire pit is pretty interesting, the indoor and outdoor spaces are cool, and they've got posters of old surf movies on the wall in the bathrooms. I was once inspired to try and find one of them, but wasn't able to on Netflix or Amazon. Maybe I just wasn't really that dedicated to the task at hand though.  I've been to Hula's a number of times now and only about half of my visits I was ordering food. Not to say their food isn't appetizing, just that Hulas works well as both bar AND grill, and I'm not always out during lunch or dinner. While a bit on the upper end of my dining out price range, every time I've ordered food, it was either good or delicious, but when ordering a drink, I usually stick with a vodka & soda, their other drinks just aren't for me.  Their signature cocktails are generally made with either rum, tequila, or vodka, or some mixture of two or three of them, but I've found that a lot of them are to sweet for my tastes. I'm not a real fan of super sweet drinks, and they can reach levels of excessive in my opinion. My favorite food item on their menu are the pork taco's and you can order one taco during happy hour for about $3. HH is Monday - Friday until about 6pm. I've also had their sweet potato fries, tofu taco, edamame, a Hula Burger, and their mac-n-cheese. All were tasty, and worth coming back for, but I imagine I'll try something different next time, like their habanero chicken tacos or their house made black bean burger.  Overall Hula's is a fun spot to meet with friends, but I wouldn't go here for more than one or two cocktails unless you're looking to leave with a sugar high.  Happy Yelping Phoenix!

thd5Vpb4QJsONIGUr_2pqQ.text: Being a native of Hawaii, I am delighted to have such a hip spot near me to enjoy fresh seafood, tropical cocktails (don't miss the Pink Bikini Martini!), and some truly Hawaiian specialties like loco moco (ground beef, rice, gravy and egg) and eggs benedict made with Spam (weekend brunch only).  Their space on Central Avenue is unique too, with its huge hexagonal window bookending the beautiful bar; this is a building that has had many incarnations over the years.  But if you want to see it, you'd better hurry, as unfortunately, the building and its surroundings are due to be demolished this summer.  Don't worry though - Hula's isn't going away, just moving to near 7th Street and Camelback.

bOVJIcoVWEz-jn8bhuniQA.text: I have chosen to return here several times and must say each time I am more and more impressed. I have brought hordes of hungry family here as well. I must say I was and am still impressed that the owner made a change to the menu over my health concerns. Further the food here and service are always top notch. I will continue to oatronize this institution and recommend the restaurant to friends and family!

y3GMzQayaip8XVniINc7Yw.text: Best spot for brunch in the valley. We come here every Saturday morning and belly up to the bar where Jenna has our double mimosas ready to go. The Spam and Portuguese sausage Benedicts are where it's at! This place is usually popping at night, but in my opinion weekend brunch is the best!

MchoTcwcCiJ0YUE4g8qGvg.text: I have mixed feelings....  Pros: Surprisingly good food! I assumed the menu would be small and questionable, but the fish tacos were some of the very best I've had! Not soaked in mayo, flavor of fish coming through, spicy salsa, quality tortilla. A+  Cons: Service and atmosphere. On a relatively quiet evening we waited way too long with empty drinks to order another round, including flagging someone down. And as far as the vibes, something about the patio area felt cheap or aged, like it has been a little neglected? Can't quite put my finger on it...  Also, no blended tiki drinks was a major bummer. I asked and this was due to not having a blender. I'd recommend the bar upgrade to elevate the options on tiki drinks.

b4X5lcSI-0xx_DWYewU-nw.text: Hmmm...I'm torn on this one!  We had a group of about six on a Tuesday evening. The service was great until we all started ordering. I had to ask for a water refill and for another drink. No biggie, just something that happened.   The food was pretty good. We ordered a few appetizers. I would recommend the sweet potato fries and the beef sticks. My meal was good (Jerk Chicken Plate) but there were a few small chicken bones which was kind of a turn off.  I would probably return because they have a good happy hour!

JKdVCcQNbzJ9wKYgBX_Mgg.text: It is a novel idea to have an island themed restaurant in Phoenix that serves up your Hawaiian inspired meals! The menu has many options that should suit all dietary preferences including sandwiches/burgers, Hawaiian  style plate lunches and fish creations. I always go for a fish entree, where you choose your fish type and preparation style, and have never been dissatisfied.   This evening I chose the market fish (snapper for $16) in the blackened prep style with wasabi mashed potatoes and seasonal vegetables. The fish was deliciously spicy with a cooling wasabi cream sauce served on top! The wasabi potatoes were good but nothing spectacular and the vegetables did not exceed expectations but at least had a mild soy sauce glaze drizzle. The service was attentive but slightly pushy to move us out.  Overall my experience here continues to consist of great tasty food and forgettable service. It is the menu that brings me back every time and I would recommend Hulas for a casual date night or dinner and drinks with friends.

SaR7o4gJLMb9vokvBpsRsg.text: Good food, great ambiance! Great happy hour but the waiters won't tell you happy hour is almost over and by the time you realize it...it's already over.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Habanero cilantro chicken tacos! Yum!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Painkiller

gkVd6CrNBBRJhfsu1vFELw.text: Went here for happy hour. We were pleasantly surprised the HH goes all night on Wednesday! Great drinks and a large HH menu with good portion sizes. We had the fish bites, potstickers, calamari, and ceviche. All delicious!. I wish I could remember the drink I had - so good! Gin and ginger beer with some other yummy stuff. Very refreshing and tasty! Will be back soon!

KCake1zX5P5pfPKSXQ0e8A.text: This place just never fails to delight!   I have been here a few times now and it is always exceptional.  Today was another wonderful experience.  Meet a friend here for lunch I got the fish tacos.only I got one fish and one tofu. You can mix and match. It was with a very unique rice and bean dish.  My friend got the Tofu Curry salad. I tasted a little of hers and it was also fantastic.  Our waiter was so nice, he even gave me a sample of the Lobster bisque. Although I did not order it, it also was good. The water is filtered ,it does not taste like poison so that was really nice as well.  I had hot tea (they have an assortment). He refilled it continuously.   One thing we noticed while we were sitting in the bar area was how clean the place was . I mean sparkling clean.  I know that may sound strange but, I was right by a corner and I noticed how it sparkled.   The more I come here the more I like it. The bathroom is spotless and beautifully decorated.  The place is so retro ,plus they play the best music on the P.A. Parking was good today, not so packed. But ,sometimes it can be hard to find a spot.

OTYmGQnL3doglblLNrPw9Q.text: Server wrote in an extra $13 tip for himself on a $51 bill that we had already tipped 25% on!  Did not notice till we got the credit card statement.  Challenging with the card company, but very disappointed.   Make sure to check your credit card statements after a meal here!

cbQnoYYcUeJMpvJZxnINOg.text: Great pulled pork (taco, Hawaiian, Jamaican Jerked) dishes and salmon (macadamia nut crust).

-hIEUwwLqItRDBk1OUcrTw.text: Normally, I love this place. Today shit service and the manager didn't even care. My meal was completely consumed before my drink arrived. I saw my drinks sittin on the counter, don't blame the bar staff. And don't blame "everyone can't all at once-we got slammed". That's why you have a wait list! If the manager would have had a different attitude I would have given 5 stars.

6TGHEU_gCu85Ap67adnXaA.text: I enjoyed Hula's Modern Tiki. The restaurant is smaller than one would think (especially from pictures) and parking can be a nightmare during peak dinning hours. Our waitress was very nice and attentive, i'll definitely go back when the weathers a little warmer to enjoy the patio seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Shrimp Salad &amp; Black Bean Burger

WV5vFFC54RS_Aco5ZAQq7A.text: Some of my funnest, most memorable nights have started @ Hula's! Whether I go there for a lil' HH or a nice dinner (...or killer brunch!), I always have a great time. The food styling is very unique in the Midtown area...Hawaiian/Asian fusion. My favorites are the ceviche, the abalone-style calamari, and the Kona French toast for brunch.    My friend B. and I were on a quest for the best sweet potato fries in PHX not too long ago, and Hula's was the clear winner! Love the aioli!   Another of the reasons I keep going back to Hula's is because of the awesome bar experience. John, the bartender, makes some of the best drinks in Midtown. In addition to Hula's mega-luau of tropical drinks, John had made me some killer "experiments" including a Spicy Dark-n-Stormy and an Absolut Cilantro & lime tonic.    Mahalo Hula!

8U4qfvmfGz3eW2QmS0oxNg.text: Came here for brunch and was not disappointed. I had the chicken sandwich which was delicious. The potstickers were yummy. My boyfriend enjoyed the Cajun burger and sweet potato fries. Cute establishment and attentive service. Definitely makes me want to go back.

3khjsDHXvt5mF66tOnhutQ.text: This place is great, especially for late night dining. The new location is way better than before replacing funky with classy atmosphere. Menu is very interesting, prices for drinks and food are very reasonable, service is good. For me the only negative is that the kitchen closes a little before 11pm, an hour before bar closes.

NaKdGSIxA63tBAT5BsUH0w.text: So we made it to the new Hula's last night .... Correction for the last two nights and we are super impressed. Love the new layout and the food and drinks are just as fantastic as they were at the old location. Not sure if we had had them before, but we ordered had the wings and they were fall-off-the-bone tender. The first day we went for happy hour and enjoyed the best Mai Tais on the Mainland and some appetizers.  We had to return last night because the Captain's Cabin doesn't open until 6 p.m. and we had to check that out. They did a great job on the place ( both the restaurant and the cabin)   and it sounds like they are looking to do more.  If I could make a suggestion, I would say look for a Mike Fields print to add to the restaurant. Like how they used all the pictures from the old place!  Hula's did a great job coming up with a new updated look, yet retaining the friendly ambience and Polynesian flair of the old Hula's. Glad the long awaited opening has passed!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahalo Hula&#39;s
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mat tai and calamari...happy hour on.

uZMtJaFKFVGS5cPZT9N4gA.text: Love the Mongolian beef bowl, one of my go too meals when eating at the restaurant. The atmosphere was nice and a great place for friends to eat and have a few drinks. I like this location better because there is more seating, and a more appealing view especially of the city than the one in old Scottsdale but both locations are nice. Will be back to the central location soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z6GmfRtN_CfhpWFWV44VKw.text: I've been dying to try this place and I finally got my opportunity. I was meeting my cousins for brunch when we decided on this place. First of all, service was great. Our server was on top of the refills and making sure we received anything we needed to fully enjoy our experience. I ordered the eggs Benedict with the Portuguese sausage along with a mimosa. The Portuguese sausage was extremely tasty. The mimosa was really good as well, I almost wanted to stay there and just drink mimosas afternoon. It would have been possible with how inexpensive everything was. The only negative was that the eggs weren't on par with everything else. I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cxrS_nLa0F2zHxY7eW1xRA.text: Ordered just about everything on the happy hour menu and everything was quite disappointing. Was craving Hawaiian terribly and thought the decor of the place was very cute. Sadly the food and drinks are disappointing.

MhC9rcHchgpxUa56OhQUbA.text: One of my favorite places to go eat! Love the drinks and food is always savory. I've been here many times and have enjoyed myself I feel like I can overlook the order of burnt edamame.

J4iHdHhg661bJh_3FZ8PYA.text: Last night I met some friends at Hula's for dinner and drinks.It is conveniently located just off Central and Camelback right in front of the light rail.Very convenient. I loved the atmosphere of this place, it was very relaxing and laid back. Our servers name was Kyle and he was super friendly and helpful with any questions we had about drinks and food.  I ordered the pork tacos that were delicious! So full of flavor and the portion size was just right. It came with a side of white rice topped with black beans and a drizzle of sour creme.  I live very close, within walking distance, so I will definitely be returning! Great place to enjoy cocktails and food with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

35Vl40oTAjDP4u4uBpruiQ.text: Great food and service and drinks. Brunch was great and prices are solid. Can't say enough about it. One of the only exotic food spots in town as far as island food. Sides are really great and the apps are good. Poke app, seaweed salad, ahi Benedict, and any burger w Pineapple was how we ate. We left with a smile.   Will come back for dinner and have more fish

sllpAZ_FA_0jHlMg238nWA.text: My friend and I have been wanting to try this place and finally made it.  Of all nights to come, we timed it just perfectly to enjoy their Happy Hour Menu that was available "all night."  They offer many tropical themed drinks and we sampled their Hurricane, Mai Tai, Tropical Itch & a Zombie.  All were very good.  We also sampled pork tacos, surfrider chicken, pot stickers, spicy edamame and kona wings.  It was all great and our server, Cherise was very friendly and quick to deliver everything we ordered.  Would definitely come again to enjoy the same as well as other items.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Edamame
