Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Potsticker

tw0IUmg6dk2Dsgxcjcgu6Q.text: Thank you for hosting our Holiday Happy hour - from all of us at Trellis, home ownership center.

6812pT6Jg2XUAGias8r0Gg.text: I absolutely love this place.  From Scotty to Matt to the drinks to the food.   You will not be disappointed.  Love the Zombi and the wasabi mashed potatoes.  Any and all fish dishes are excellent. Hands up to everyone.  My birthday girls were super impressed.  Thank you everything was a TEN!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Check out the Zombi!

aVjs75bWrNwyC-RvNF2hew.text: Ambience: When I went to Hula's Modern Tiki, the weather was nice out and I loved how the restaurant was open to the outdoors. I could feel the breeze, and it was just good vibes all around. Unfortunately, partway through the meal, some additional guests were placed right next to us, and because the sliding table wasn't set up very well, we ended up bumping elbows a few times, which was a bit awkward. The service was attentive and kind, and the waitress suggested some kind of tea that was absolutely scrumptious.   Food: The samurai beef sticks appetizer was DELICIOUS. A little expensive, but we loved the dipping sauce, and the beef was also well marinated. My s/o got the luau pork plate, and weirdly enough, he said it was the best pulled pork he's had in Arizona. Mushrooms and eggs are my favorite food items in the whole world, so I was beyond ecstatic when I saw the description for the Loco Moco. Unfortunately, I found the burger patty dry and the mushroom gravy excessively goopy, but then again, I've never been to Hawaii. The fried plantains were nothing special, but still very yummy.

69iCxl9LmYKSLPJLX1K8iQ.text: I love this new location. The decor is great, they certainly went all out to keep with the theme. The food and cocktails also keep with the atmosphere. They have a full bar, and, a great selection of tropical drinks. They have a nice patio for outside dining. Their taco are great. We love their spicy edaname are wonderful. There servers are friendly a nd knowledgeable. It is a fun restaurant/lounge, we really enjoy.

TLVZIbHvqnNgJijPdrI_WQ.text: Drinks were great, apps were awesome, and dinner was excellent - can't be beat! Great service and a great atmosphere. We went on a Friday night and there was no wait

eUoStGokfU6VoHOtXIsJfA.text: My wife and I love this place. The drinks are delicious and strong. The food has always been amazing and the atmosphere is fantastic. Our wait staff has always been attentive to us. This truly feels like a local spot without being pretentious. We come back time and time again especially for the Wednesday all day happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hula&#39;s wings with Asian bbq sauce.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy coconut shrimp rolls with a pineapple horseradish dipping sauce
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The post stickers with a peanut sauce and a soy sauce type dipping

T0rNO4CSbIJtY0s5BBfQ5Q.text: This place has great ambience. It is a fun bar! The bartender is awesome. Ask for Roberta when you get here she is a goddess!  She goes out of her way to help you. I feel this is hands- down the best bar in phoenix.

zktT9GUQ8GPwhG2pcE7KVQ.text: My goodness am I in love with this place! My boyfriend and myself came in here after seeing a movie, because we wanted to try something "new," and I am SO glad we did! I have a severe dairy allergy, so I was asking our server lots of questions about the menu, but she remained incredibly sweet and hospitable (I wish I could remember her name). We will 100% be back!

itrzlhrF7E3jgcE6s-aLNg.text: Went there on Labor Day. So I understand the slow service and being I under staffed. But I got the rib eye and it looked cooked perfect. Until I took a bite and it was super chewy and no flavor what so ever. I asked for spice to add to the steak and the waiter went and got me some not even wondering why I asked. So I told him and nothing was done . Very disappointed even the Johnny cakes were over cooked . Just all and all a bad experience.

ste3FXWF0wjR8CV6atp7cA.text: We love it here.  The atmosphere is great, it's friendly and fair priced.  The drinks are strong and the service fast.  Close to The Lex and Elevation apts for a short walk.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great food, Strong Drinks, fun!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eat here every time we can :)

_UDUtQmqFTZzeub3hNg77Q.text: Haven't been back to Phoenix for 3 years and this was the first place I went for dinner.  Flavors just explode all over your mouth!  The Hawaiian Poke is so fresh and crisp!  I tried the lemongrass Hapu with coconut rice and was so impressed!  Wish I could figure out all of the ingredients so I can make it at home!

px099UFoDHCvrc1A9nt2rw.text: Spotless! Service. Dining room. Restrooms. Patio. Spotless!!  Next time I shall forgo table seating and plop my butt on the floor to eat. Yep. That's how clean Hula's is!  Service was polished and friendly. Dana was working the brunch crowd and attending to everyone's needs. Most importantly everyone enjoyed their brunch.  I say Bula Bula to Hula's!!

9M_2lThq-1C4OZOHD6e0Fw.text: I was there twice last week if that's any indication. I've had the Polynesian chicken sandwich and the peek tacos and both were tasty. The ceviche is also delicious. Or had coconut milk in our which makes it that much better. Also, their mac and cheese is delicious. More than the food though, the reason i like it is that it is so laid back. It's great to sit in the patio and enjoy the amazing weather. The staff is very friendly and fast and efficient. Also Wednesday they have their happy hour prices all day.

LPQVnWbdQKvxklo71F2hGA.text: Food is good but service is poor, spoke directly to the server and he flat out ignored me and my friends.

Zo-S1YQRnpnaapZkVJvjwA.text: PATIO-PATIO-PATIO!  It was a little tricky to get seated, but we got it done and were happy how fast the service was once seated.   Food is good to really good. SPICY EDAMAME for a starter. Hella good! I kept it real and had the HULA BURGER. Basic burger, but I have to really be more excited about the Volcano Bowl! Careful, do not drink too fast and share with 6 people or you will be tore up!   Can't wait to go back!

Z0Svx-Bf3Ra0_lmtQJp26A.text: It's the bees knee's man!   We ducked into this spot on a rainy day for lunch and I'm so glad we did. My husband and I were sat right in front of the window and watch the cars splash by. I was going to order a Red Stripe (yes! they have Red Stripe) and the bartender suggested Longboard which they have on tap. This malty beer was a joy to drink, so refreshing, it hit the spot. For lunch I had the Hula's Island Cobb, very delicious. I was skeptical about the spam but it ended up being a great substitute for bacon. My only gripe is the chicken was described as "marinated" on the menu which sold me on the salad but when I had it the meat was plain. My hubs had the Luau Pork Sandwich and it's truly heaven on a bun, served with yummy sweet potato fries. Both meals were large portions and we finished every bite.   We had a really good time at Hula's, great service, delish food & beer. We will be going back fo sho! Oh, and I should also mention that the silverware is now wrapped in cloth napkins. If I would have read these reviews before my visit Amy's "fork door holder" story would have kept me away.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cobb

PPXINqLiHzSc8dfu3F7IEA.text: This was our last stop on the Urban Wine Walk yesterday, and it was a great place to end the day.  Because this was our last stop, we were too late to get the wine special, however we decided to stay and grab a table on the gorgeous patio and get a (full) glass of wine.  We also ordered some sweet potato fries to munch on.  The patio was awesome and I love how the "inside" opened up to become an extension of the patio, or vice versa.  We were lucky enough to be experiencing one of those perfect Arizona days and I felt like I was sitting in a good friend's cute, cozy backyard . . . with table service.  Speaking of the service, no complaints from me!  The original plan was to get dinner, but the wine, fries, and good conversation were enough to fill us up and take us to the end of the night.  I can't wait to go back (soon, to enjoy the patio) and try all of the delicious food I was reading about on the menu and now in everyones reviews!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seaweed Salad

BYF-CdGc2eC40-5KvZhePA.text: Great patio!   Came with a group of friends and had the pork plate with yummy little Johnny cakes and the wasabi mashed potatoes, both were excellent.

H68SVEmLj6dPWdCJoTYdjA.text: Hula's is definitely one of my favorite places to eat. The food is always delicious and the drinks are great too. The vibe is super chill, making it a cool place to hang out and grab some grub. The servers are always on top of their game and the prices aren't too shabby.  I recommend the chicken tacos!

NupKE_Cf0hcZbwPhl4a5lw.text: Love the unique menu  Great fun atmosphere  Tiki drinks are bomb Go for lunch also it's less crowded

fvpBVzeqr4JbOQbd1iRytA.text: People are not usually impressed by coleslaw. But I love coleslaw and was happy to see it as an option. And it's fantastic! Plus a whole bowl of it with plenty to throw onto my blackened fish sandwich, which also was spicy delicious! I'll be back soon!

l2ELTob576jEMQMbAaFVDg.text: I think I've been putting of writing a Hula review. DON'T GO HERE!! It's wonderful, and I like that there's almost always somewhere to sit without waiting!!  Expect to see someone you know, or someone you want to know at Hula. Watch whatever craziness they have projected on the wall without apology. Order the second drink you want, you can always sit and while away a little more time.  Brunch on the patio! Black bean burger! Sweet potato fries! Moscow Mule (sub Hendricks and say yes to the bitters)! Dark and Stormies! Yum! Yum! Yum!  Tiki paraphenalia, vintage LA photos, consistently good service, modern touches in the decor, a gutted and re-purposed central Phoenix landmark building, a chic firepit, umbrellas and mist, high seats, low seats, group seats, booth seats, open kitchen, electric car charging, bike rack, lightrail access, I mean really, what's not to like?  A word of caution: if you are not in the mood for an epic night, if you must get something done afterward, if you have any reason to drive posthaste, then DON'T ORDER THE SCORPION BOWL. It tastes so good when it hits your lips. If you're not careful, we'll be calling you Mr. Toad (the morning after your wild ride)!

LjZs693La0RLTs_a-jha0w.text: This is a great place, the volcano I amazing. But do you know this place this got a Grade D from the health department inspection? This is the lowest grade you can get. The have found dead roaches in the bar the last 3 inspections, food not labeled with proper dates, and not at proper temperatures.  I will avoid this place now.

sb3eGJ9B7zQF0Vg2ifLwWQ.text: I sat at the bar and was ignored by 3 bartenders, who really weren't doing anything. Finally got a beer, Didnt get asked it I wanted anything else. Cute place, customer service seriously lacking.  UPDATE:  Went again, same problem. After forever, ordered a beer upon which I was told was $4 -so gave the bartender a five -  bartender never came back and asked if we wanted anything else, even another beer AND kept my change!!! Talked to manager  (he asked if I wanted my dollar back) told him no - keep it - bartender obviously needed it more than I did. So we left. No I wont go back . . or even suggest anyone go there.

mECcTcI6QdXGYO4yZKzC_Q.text: A friend of mine suggested we meet at Hula's for drinks and dinner and from the description it sounded great, I had just hoped it would hold up to everything she said and it totally did!   The atmosphere is great, staff is super friendly and made some great suggestions and the food was really good too. The banana coconut cream pie is freaking amazing!   We will absolutely be back to this place and bring friends.

PuGR0Y_T0qttrL2rPHcI1A.text: Always a great place to stop in with a really cool ambiance. Hula's made room for our larger party outside on the patio, and they weren't kidding when they said the heaters would warm us up. Thanks! The drinks are really nice here and the food is good. Not my very favorite food, mind you, but good. Everybody loves the spiciness of their dishes. We'll be back for sure.

t_4rEbZJRMZVfznCSL6cPw.text: So I reviewed Hula's a couple months back with a not-so-satisfied tale of my first visit. And it's True, the first time I went our waitress did not appear very happy when we said we were skipping dinner and only doing drinks... and proceeded to ignore us most of time... but perhaps it was an off night for the poor girl. Despite that night, I did not give up on Hula's and have since been back numerous times (is it bad that it's pretty much weekly?).  Why I frequent:  - Best bean burger known to man. - Literally every cocktail on the menu is delicious...    and served in a funky tiki glass. - Any dish with fish can be replaced with tofu.  ...all at a very reasonable price.

CgWRSDepnsNf8NdFYGLqsQ.text: Great mix of eclectic food. I had the jerk pork plate. The seasoning was fantastic in the rice that we came with was great to mix with the pork. Only deducting one star because the restaurant is very dark making it hard to read the menu, the parking is not great, and we waited over an hour to get a table for four. But after eating at this restaurant I can understand why they were so busy. Great restaurant in the heart of Phoenix. Worth the drive.

2JNy8uhv5ah9j6mlxBuXxw.text: We go to Hula's in a big group of about 30 people after our dodgeball league downtown on Tuesdays.  We let them know we are coming and they are always very accommodating.  All of the young 20 something servers do a good job and never have any sort of bad attitude, even though we are slamming them with a rush close to close.   This place is not to expensive, but the outdoor area and general atmosphere is pretty cool.  Not to trendy, but enough to notice.  The Asian style chicken kabobs ( I think the menu name is something like Surfrider chicken sticks???) are to die for.  I have been here 3 times and have not gotten anything else.  A lot of others in our group seemed to have LOVED them as well.  There really are beyond delicious and very affordable.  Great Service, great food.

Z41Ke_BuU0FTsKAAiKGGXg.text: Staff is amazing and food is never disappointing. Fills up fast but they still find a way to get you in fast.

oUXazA2ntlXv7REsfK_2QQ.text: Cool vibe.. Went for apps and beverages! I highly recommend the Abalone Style Calamari.. I'd come back for that plate alone!!

6rzg2TgGb6fqdqa804CpWw.text: Hula's is a pretty chill place. It's a nice setting and atmosphere for Phoenix. Cool outdoor/indoor area, you can bring the pups along if you want. This was my first time here and will be back starting out the celebration for my birthday in a few weeks. Drinks have fun names, some come in fun cups and drinks are strong. Now the few downsides are...this place is pretty pricey for drinks and food especially for its location...and happy hour is only from 330pm-6pm during the week, pretty short amount of time compared to other places. Best time to come is for happy hour because the prices are amazing!

dktvx8Rxbqb-uF_UO4rLTQ.text: What a wonderful first time! The server was very nice and he was attentive an very suggestive with orders! The spicy chicken thai bowl and the chicken tacos were great!! The food is of great quality, fresh, nice presentation, and portioned nicely. I will definitely be back with some friends and what an awesome happy hour menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy thai chicken bowl! Delicious!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet potato frys, fried chicken tacos!!

wxPDUDUIPYPW9nqpS2xdmQ.text: Pretty cool space with pretty delicious food. They have a fun tropical cocktail list and a decent selection of wines and beers. There are a few vegetarian options that are more tofu based than veg based, but I was happy with the flavors of my tacos. I would recommend it!

HMucqRkXrlLgOx6V28ZIqg.text: Delicious drinks. One of the few joints in town to carry kruzan black strap rum (do try with coke!). Friendly staff and diverse city crowd. == fun. The food is good but sometimes a bit undercooked during their rushes. Go- drink... But don't eat during the rush.

7yNm4p5L4L1zcRuOAaLjEw.text: As it says right in the name, this is a MODERN spin on tiki. So don't expect palm fronds on the walls and Hawaiian shirts on the staff. Instead, you have what looks to be a converted service station with lots of concrete and clean lines, and a staff that's all tatted up and vaguely punk.  I like this place. The patio is very nice on a hot day, with misters and a cold air blowing. The interior space is nice and open, with big tables and a clean, simple decor. Again, MODERN.  The food and drink menu was great. They are all about Happy Hour here, on Sunday it runs for something like 9 hours. Do yourself a favor, and stop in here for drinks: they have all your tiki staples (Scorpion Bowl, Mai Tai, etc.). The food is good, too. I like the tacos, and their salads are huge. Also, great prices on everything.  My one issue was that service was a little "meh". Our hostess didn't really seem to care when we arrived, and the waiter was a little spotty on getting us our drinks. It wasn't that busy, so I don't know how they dropped that ball.  Overall, as a connoisseur of all things tiki, I thought this place was a fun twist on the theme. It does not scream "tropical" or "exotic" but they're taking the idea and giving it a new look. I think that a lot of people will appreciate the blending of island themes with the more clean modern aesthetic. Well done.

pOMSc5FEOOMfMwisB1q2QA.text: After some recommendations for places to eat while we're in town, I decided to venture out and see what else Phoenix has to offer. Apple Maps pointed out Hula's and after looking at some Yelp reviews, we hopped in the car and made a beeline for dinner.   We were sat right away and we poured over the drink menu and agonized about what to try. I went with a Mai tai (it is a tiki bar after all) and my wife had the Pink Bikini Martini. The drinks flew out of the bar and were in our hands in minutes. And they were GREAT! We also tried out the Hawaiian Ceviche, made with white fish, coconut milk, onions and other deliciousness served on wonton chips. Whoa! The fish was tender, the marinade of citrus and onions all married together into something truly outstanding.   I ordered the Luau Pork Plate and my wife had the Hapu fish, jerk style. The kitchen was on point with the pork. A generous helping of sweet pulled pork in an amazingly sticky bbq sauce with pineapple chunks filled a third of my plate. The remainder of the plate was filled with steamed white rice and Cole slaw. The slaw was a little bland, but the combination of the rice and pork was Hawaiian bliss.   The fish my wife tried was smothered in a wonderfully spicy jerk sauce and served with fried plantains, Johnny cakes and white rice topped with a mango salsa.   Our server was super bubbly and helpful in making recommendations on the menu and also asked the staff for things a "tourist" should do while we're in town.   Check this place out if you get a chance. Great service, wonderful drinks and tasty food. Do it!

JL91Gfvq4r_7YUOgZlzacQ.text: We got the fish cooked with coconut coated and the macadamia coated Hupi  fish both were excellent!!  The fried banana were all good, very casual dinner area, server was very good. Filling our water glass as soon as it was empty as it is always hot here in the summer. I am just here to move my daughter for school but will want to return the next time I am back in town

UdKSzx1qhcPYBZikEZOkBw.text: We always love our Hula's and so does Cali. Always spot on we enjoy it every time we go!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bring on the Mai Tai by the fire!

zv-kmBS9UQ-MGO4Rr7nj6Q.text: We love coming here on special occasions. The food is really good and the drinks are really fun!

xFwnU-gMFGlUq2-T8csXOw.text: Found this place by happy accident! The parking is sparse but it is also right off the light rail. The decor is retro Hawaiian feel.  Quick service. Quality and quantity of food for price is excellent. Pineapple mimosa was refreshing and just right - a bit sweet and a bit fizzy Husband ordered the Hula burger with bacon with a side of Hawaiian mac salad. The mac salad is not your typical hawaii mac salad but it is tasty and I enjoyed it. - Raised in Hawaii, I am a picky mac salad person.  I ordered the Luau Pork sandwich topped with Asian slaw and a side of sweet potato fries. Pork was sweet but not too sweet and a the slaw had a nice hint of ginger. The orders came quickly.   I would like to have tried the coconut creme pie but the lunches were large and had no room for dessert.  A good excuse to go back! Bathroom are roomy, decorated in the same hipster retro style and CLEAN! Definitely will go back again!

38PwD7H4g3xrCWWU5spycg.text: Came here on a Friday night around 6:30, did not have to wait long for a table.  Service was great,  the layout of the place is really amazing and the food was so good. You do get your money's worth and portion. Can't wait to come back for more!

WS4j8T18tNFZIIJYHnGkhA.text: Loved the mai tai and the French fries. Do not... I repeat... do not get the poke or seaweed salad. Big disappointments. Cool place to hang out and eclectic crowd. I would go back and try something different.

wVBAkEagMmbHVXY4NLyhAQ.text: I've been in Phoenix for 5 nights and have had dinner here every night so far. The atmosphere is so perfect and the people both employees and patrons are always so friendly. I can't even begin to explain how good the food is. Everything is spiced so well and so different. Even something as plain as coleslaw is made awesome here.   I've always been seated fast and had my order quick, even when it's busy.   I would recommend this to anyone and will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AZg9qW-_zuGZLjeKdNSBZQ.text: I incentivize my co-workers with food and drinks. If we get through this training ahead of schedule drinks are on me or at least the first few rounds. I purposely looked up Hula's knowing they have a good HH and good food. It happens most of my Phoenix office co-workers are foodies and were stoked to hear my plan. Well under time allowed me to get kidnapped to the range, grab drinks and apps, before my flight home. Hell yeah. Enough about the reason and more about the business.  The weather was hot, but the outdoor seating still looked promising and inviting, but I was in business attire so we sat inside. It feels like a retro modern Tropical, not so much Hawaiian to me. Lunch is the happs, apparently still packed until the later afternoon, early evening.   Prices were excellent considering I bought a few rounds and the food was inexpensive, high quality. Poke was a little pricey, but it was MP. Good, but could do without the macadamia nuts.. Coconut shrimp rolls had a great pineapple horseradish sauce. Calamari had a lime ginger cream sauce which I will be emulating at home soon. Spicy seaweed salar was a pleasant offering. Perfect balance and something I think is an ingenious upgrade to the standard wakame that most places don't offer. Nice.  I wasn't a fan of the pork, but loved the sundried pesto aioli used, fresh black beans and corn tortillas. Habanero lime chicken use a taco slaw which I could have used less of. Really liked the south seas grilled hapu, and spicy tofu. Clean classic flavors most modern taco trucks don't' think is adventurous enough.   I split the Jawaiian jerk Pork plate. Yes that's pork they also offer. Also split the calamari sandwich. Yup I brought my appetite. Loved the plantains which were bright and not overfried. I'm not a fan of most amngo salsa's, but the johnny cakes were excellent, more to my liking than overly authentic kinds. I wasn't a fan of the calamari and preferred the style and sauce of the app.  Key Lime pie to round out the meal. I thought it was bland. Couldn't quite tell if they use kahfir limes, but after about a half dozen D.r. Funk's I was ready to get my funk on.   In an area most known for their Pizza, Italian this places stands out like nothing else and Arizona seems to be the new breeding ground for upstarts. Many of San Diego's chef's have opened up shop in AZ because they are ready for this sort of ingenuity. Glad I came. A few mediocre things don't take away from an overall good experience. Really the 1 star deduction was the service. It was slow, unattentive and just understaffed. Sure my drinks came like clockwork, but that's more the drunk vibe I give off.

LWM9FPHp1QWjLWVdH_V5tg.text: Great looking location.  Good atmosphere, bar is a nice size, outdoor and indoor seating areas.  Get there early as they get packed in a hurry.  Service was excellent.  Nice mix of cocktails.  Food selection (there were six of us and no complaints) is pretty diverse and quality is excellent.  Prices I thought were very reasonable.  Definitely worth a return visit.

7anKX2lV4FQsDt-dqfOKIQ.text: Came for dinner.   The volcano drink is a must, perfect for a couple. I loved the presentation of 151 burning in the middle. Overall the drink is great you can taste a bit of sweetness as well as a kick of alcohol.  They didn't have the jawaiian jerk chicken plate so I was disappointed with that. I ended up going with a chicken sandwich it was good. Soft bread with tender/juicy chicken.   The atmosphere location decor is really chill. Ill definitely come back to try more items.

tdPyD5lEfnp-mjlhMWFaTQ.text: Went to Hulas Modern Tiki because I had a craving for some good Hawaiian. I tried the Kalbi ribs dish and they are amazing!! It came with rice and mac salad. I love it and we will definitely be coming back. Service was great too!

fBk8x867DiI-CBIpc5YFGw.text: Hulas Modern Tiki, is Arizonas modern twist to a Hawaiian fusion American themed restaurant. I dined at the Scottsdale location at first. This will be my 2nd time here at the restaurant but it was my first time at the Phoenix location! Much different but I do love the original I believe which is the Phoenix one. Located in the heart of mid-town of lovely local restaurants. Prices are decent your wallet will appreciate you, specially if you come thru happy hour! Drinks are awesome food is fantastic! I personally tried and will recommend the ceviche, the hula's original burger is fantastic, I recently tried the Yummy Polynesian Chicken Burger which is delicious I paired it with sweet potato fries and their draft IPA! Service was consistent specially since I had a big group for a birthday! Definitely looking for that new twist guys? Well stop by Hulas, fun filled adventure into the islands is a door away! Stay cool, and stay hungry Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Polynesian Chicken Burger w/ Sweet Potato fries

eW4ScQQXNI3LrxaXicyllw.text: Wednesday's here rock it out!  Happy hour prices all night on cocktails and appetizers.  My favorite drink here is their margaritas.  Strong and good.  2 of these for $10 gets your happy on!  The ceviche is perfect with the line notes leaving it my favorite ceviche.  The hapu and Mahi are great macadamia crusted fish entrees.  My go to regular is the Thai chicken bowl.  Staff is friendly and atmosphere is open.  Diversity is welcome here.

aTqfqPuQT4Wo7pp-uZqnCA.text: This is still one of our favorite restaurants.  Thus far I have taken my parents, friends from out of town, book club, my husband/son and just last night I took my brother and his friend from out of town who was able to just pop up to our neck of the woods by taking light rail!  I am always impressed with the professional way this bar is run and the fabulous food and the open air environment.  I love the poke, the fish cakes, the french fries, and I nearly always get the spicy shrimp caesar.  I highly recommend this restaurant STILL and I am delighted to say they are still open and doing a brisk business every time we go in.

RroCletUcPLOu5i2uqZKEg.text: This place is a great place to go with a bunch of people or just two.  The crowd is pretty hip and "yuppyish."  The menu is pretty unique and the kitchen produces some very distinct and savory tasting dishes.  Have been there a few times and always been very happy with both the food and the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their sweet potato fries are fabulous.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut shrimp rolls, fabulous.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Z2XLkefqxu8axMkrVLDbmQ.text: Fun place to hang out on the patio and imbibe. Enjoyed the inventive cocktails- both the mai tai and tiki  bastard were winners. So was the poke. The latter had a generous crumble of macadamia nuts which was a nice touch.   The crowd was a mix.  Glad we tried it while in the neighborhood. Not sure we would go back as a destination. Good day drinking joint.

fhq6vacBlOYtnJjHWwnmIA.text: After coming here a couple of more times I can honestly say that it's a pretty decent spot on central, the drink I get is the scorpion bowl (4 two people) which is incredible!! Must try!!  This is more of a drinking spot because of the awesome atmosphere & location but as far as food I like the appetizers, but I think the entrees could be better!  I really rate this spot a 3.5 but I give it a 4 because of the amazing atmosphere!!!!  Try the ceviche appetizer & coconut shrimp roll appetizer...I am also looking forward to trying the new Scottsdale location!

CoVDYlxGgJduJQ7aWBvD5A.text: SOOOO Happy we stopped in!!!  My family and I were driving around this Saturday looking for a nice place to eat lunch. We happen do drive by Hula's and thought it looked like a fun place. We were so glad we stopped.   First off, the design and decor of the space is amazing.  Very welcoming, modern and an overall cool vibe. My husband and I both noted we would love to come back again when the weather has cooled off and sit on the patio.   For lunch I had the Fish Taco, my husband had the Pulled Pork Sandwich and my three-year-old had the Macaroni-and-Cheese.  Everything was delicious! The fish was well seasoned. I only wished I had ordered two instead of one!  The pulled pork was sweet and juicy. We will be back!!

E-xTI5I0g2_mPqBdrcXZAA.text: Because I woke up this morning with a message from the owner of Hula apologizing and explaining the yelp check in offer ...I will up my star rating and say that even with the harshness of a curt waitress... All deserve second chances. I appreciate a heart felt explanation. I do not love or even LIKE negativity nor many negative reviews. This is a cool place in a up and coming area. SO I will Hula back in at a later time and see if the service is friendlier.. Maybe I will splurge and grab some of those sweet apps I saw passing my table.. Thanks Dana for your comment and message. :-)   LOVE the location and I have had brunch here with my friends who fav this place several times. Tonight before heading down to Bliss to our Dinner Club we stopped off for some pre-dinner-club happy hour. He had a martini and I had a red wine. No apps. He ordered another drink of some concoction and inquired about the app menu then opted not. We sat out on the patio. Staff was nice and Hulas was hopping. I had a yelp check in offer and the waitress refused to honor it and stated I could get Hula Bucks for next time since it was happy hour. I did point out that at no place on the yelp offer did it say that. Her attitude changed and our bill came. None of these 'Hula Bucks' were in our bill, so I asked her for them. She said at that point, "Well can you not just use the yelp offer next time?" Ummmmm.... ???? " That isn't what you offered before.." I said. She huffily gave the bucks she offered. We were on our way. Dang girl.. its a mere 10% off...Maybe it comes off her salary? Def changed my opinion. I don't want her bucks because with that... I doubt I would go back unless my friends insisted.... Hula that.

8wRoiaDl4D9M0mtLqpBudw.text: Very enjoyable atmosphere and staff. Had the ribs with very good sauce while not swamped on it. Great taste and seasoning. Beans and rice where pretty decent will go back in the future. The muay Thais are great with just the right combination

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Muay Thai
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribs with white rice and pinto beans

ryP5VVOZTPaMbqJ9FAOUIQ.text: I went to Hula's Modern Tiki about a year ago and I've been feigning to return.  I got that chance again today when a friend and I stopped by for lunch.  I like the laid back atmosphere and the always-friendly staff.  Makes the food taste even better.  We had the coconut shrimp, sweet fried plaintains with salad.  Um, um, good! We both ordered the same thing.  Even the same drink, Painkiller! Awesome.  Try it.

sOaEnNBGYK_BpPElrZbMKw.text: I now understand why it's called Hula's MODERN Tiki. It definitely has a trendy air to it. I enjoyed the atmosphere, and the large lunch portions. I got a fish sandwich with a side salad. The salad was surprisingly delicious, basically greens and sesame seeds with a citrus dressing. The fish sandwich was good, as expected. The bread was fantastic! I'd definitely like to come back for a happy hour experience :)

ayEak_X-wxX00M_C8KqKqA.text: Love the place...it has got great cocktails that you can share like the volcano. The outside seating is great as long as its not July. I have a lot of Vegan buddies,so they love it for the different Tofu variations,but my favorite remains the Jerk chicken

rZi2-7XATmTlESHFN3x9Sg.text: My daughters chicken fingers were better than our meal. The Hulas in CA is FAR superior. Underwhelmed by the pork sandwich.

4muGRR3qnhrPAMTCJUu-Hw.text: A Gluten Free review.  The waitress didn't have a good idea what was gluten free and after saying "oh, its not breaded, its covered in Panko so its ok" I was hesitant to trust anything she suggested (panko is wheat...in case you were wondering). Then she said something had modified food starch and I was confused as to what kind of "food starch" it was...corn starch? wheat starch? what? so, that was out. So, I was just left with a menu with a bunch of sauces that if I kept asking questions would have sent her back to the kitchen 10 times with questions for busy cooks and half answers when she returned.   I settled on the burger with no bun, which, unfortunately I often have to settle for with this annoying allergy. At least it was one of the best burgers I've had in a really long time.  Still, I didn't go to Hula's for a burger...I wanted something different...something Hawaiian (and the burger doesn't have anything Hawaiian about it, except Maui onions.)   The burger is ground in-house and the fries are hand cut in house...delicious, but again...a burger and fries.  I really wish they had some more options or some clarity as to what ingredients are so I could have tried something else. Hula sauce, just so you know, is ketchup & mayo.   She was nice and attentive and didn't get annoyed by my questions or multiple apologies for being difficult (due to the allergy questions). Our glasses were kept full and we were served promptly.

zHaF8DF3NTFyb8MAWDjycw.text: This place is 3 stars in the best sense.  It's really super cute and 50s tiki-themed.  The inside is really nice but a little cramped, with a beautiful patio, tiki-themed decor, and even tiki mugs.    There are lots of fun, rummy, sugary drink options, some served in tiki mugs.  The food is pretty good, and pretty reasonably priced - definitely better than average bar food.  It tends to be loud and crowded and the service is a little spotty.    Mid-summer visits can be iffy.  The misters can't be on outside after the sun goes down...apparently this makes the patio slippery, but, frankly, it also makes the patio really, really hot, especially if the misters are on when you're seated and then turned off a few minutes later.  They also sometimes list items on the menu long after they've actually discontinued them (the ground ahi burger is an example - the server said: oh, we haven't carried that for ages).  Over all, a fun place to meet friends and hang out, if you don't mind waiting a bit for service, bumping into people, and gettting pretty hot on summer nights.

orCPoc2PhlABdaXNyihPzQ.text: Thank god the tiki bar is open!  Love this place as it is the ONLY tiki bar in Phoenix.  It is excellent though.  Happy Hour is a terrific deal filled with urban hipsters on the patio with the light rail buzzing by.  Eat there or venture in to the restaurant and enjoy delicious tropical drinks with fare such as jerk pork, fresh spring rolls or my favorite the Caribbean Mango Chicken Caesar salad.  Did I say the drinks are AMAZING?  Well, they are.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A Hula&#39;s inspired tiki print dress from #PinupGirlClothing.  Worn to #HulasModernTiki on our 34th Anniversary 8/30/14.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dr. Funk.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The hubby,  Dr. Funk and coconut cream pie on our 35th Anniversary.

2L68mPtmtSRmtP6Pvh4hbA.text: So, my most recent visit to my newly favorite lunch place was da bomb. Instead of my usual calamari sandwich and sweet potato fries I got the Mongolian beef with lime curry sauce. Now, usually Jamaican's don't fancy lime in their curry. But I had my grandmother turning over in her grave on Thursday because I really enjoyed the taste of the lime curry sauce, beef, beans and rice. I especially liked that the dish had cilantro in it, but not too much. One thing I noticed about Hula's while I was there is the music. It was loud enough for me to hear it but not too loud to hold a conversation. Our server was great. She kept our glasses filled and checked on us regularly but was not a bug-a-boo. I ate inside this time instead of outside and it made me realize how much I prefer eating outside here. I got to meet the owner, Dana, who is a cool down to earth guy. Until next time!

kgv5AmEW5RK1hPi2XjE-1A.text: This last sunday, one of my best friends was having his birthday dinner at Hulus. And since I have never been to a tiki bar outside out Japan or Hawaii (the one in Japan was just a Hawaiiian islands bar but same thing) so I was ready to see what Hulus had to offer.   The atmosphere is not over the top tiki but it could use a few more statues. They have a nice patio area which would be nice but it was too cold to use. But lets jump to the heart of the matter, that is the drinks. Oh my. Rum is one of my strong vices. Add fruit juice and I would mostly likly drink it out of a shoe. But besides the fact that sentence shows some crippling alcoholicsm, I dont get to indulge in rum beverages very often. But they had my favorite "Dark and Stormy" which had Ginger Beer as the main mixer instead of juice. And this was mixed perfectly, so much so that it gave off a Dark and Tan floating illusion. I would go back just for that.   How about the food? Man can not survive on rum alone. But dammit we try,   The food was very good. Three people I was sitting next to got the Tofu bowl and raved about it. The one guy who got the chicken was also pleased. I got the Calamari burger just because I never seen a Calamari burger before. And it was to be expected. It needed to be bit more spicy and a lot more crunchy but still good, since I ate it all.   Basically....they do a great Dark and Stormy. And if that doesnt get you go then nothing wil.

m3MIN3_jgl6vls6iOLV5cw.text: Haven't tried their food yet, But their drinks are pretty good! The atmosphere is chill the employees I wouldn't say are the nicest but whatever my server last night was attentive and would check up often to make sure we were good on drinks. I'd recommend this place if you are looking for a chill place to drink with friends.

agm_YEd8BjxzR9XI66XQfQ.text: Always love this place. However today was miss informed about brunch and happy hour prices from one server to another during shift change and was given attitude about it when given the bill. So sad about this because I have always had excellent service here before. Especially with a large group of us.

OMfERW3-Ob2SWnU0tbvkHw.text: This restaurant allows your pup on the patio and has some of the greatest martinis in town! The staff is also super friendly and attentive. ((: .

u0cQ81rlnMqY8qGmZTLy9A.text: I don't give 5 stars lightly but this restaurant deserves it. Not only was the food fabulous but the waitress was Wonderful. The restaurant was busy and we had a large group but you would never have known that from our waitress. We were contemplating a seaweed salad and with out being asked she brought over a sample (It was amazing by the way) Our glasses were never empty everyone's food was great tasting and great quality.   What a fun place! The decor was funky and fun the wait staff was professional  and efficient and very casual and it was Clean. Loved it and will be going back next time I am in town and telling everyone about it.    Great Job Hula's!!!

0HRlnscuIG8ux3_DaLPcuQ.text: This place is really nice. We enjoyed many menu item and they were all delicious. The cocktails are out of this world.

q4mPwUL9dGV--bULS0GtrA.text: Decent enough eatery. Although the atmosphere was nice, I wish the food hadn't been so over-cooked. It was my first time, maybe a second visit will change my mind.

wYwnyYwJVGo1wWKlBEho7w.text: I love how vegan friendly this place is! From tofu tacos to sweet potato fries, they clearly label what anyone with a dietary restriction can have.   Their scottsdale location used to be my go-to tinder date spot. The menu has something for everyone: picky eaters, gluten-free, keto, paleo...you name it! The happy hour pricing is nothing short of incredible. If you want a cheap happy hour meal, it's a perfect place. If you want a date night, that works too.   Don't forget to order a mai tai. You're at a tiki bar, after-all.

pC3RPTJGNRE3lXHt0r-TXQ.text: sunday brunch service was good but the pulled pork hash was horrible! The mimosa was ok. The pork was so bnad our stomachs were upset all day

kJ6LQhAziBCVMEqzTW8vlA.text: Very impressed with the experience here start to finish. We showed up it was super busy they were on a 45 minute wait so they sent us next door to the speakeasy for drinks. Inside we had some really good craft cocktails, one of them came in a tiki head, it was the punch I believe. Very good! Once our table was ready we went inside and began the amazing experience with TIA, our server, she was incredible knowledgeable on the menu, happy to be there, and all around created great vibes for everyone there. We ordered the beef sticks, fried plantains, pork sliders, ceviche and a few other items that are slipping my mind. Over dinner we enjoyed more drinks including the scorpion bowl which served 3 of us and came out with flaming 151 rum in the center. Truly a treat to dine here and even better, the prices were exceptional. I genuinely TRIED to get the tab over $100 and it wasn't even close!!! Thank you Tia again you were amazing and we will ABSOLUTELY be back soon!

bp92XSqPLS1Pr0dviN9vdg.text: My husband and I sat outside. The food was delicious. Fish tacos were seasoned to perfection. The sauce with the fish tacos took it to good...TO GREAT!  The only thing that kept me from giving the extra star, was the service. The wait staff was not that attentive, but the bees were.  Overall, a pleasant experience and would recommend...

CvKvicEQ6fYWNcjYBWjWZg.text: SPLENDID!!!   I LOVE this place!!!   Cool retro design, sweet attentive attractive staff, delicious  wings and Mai Tai!   Every Wednesday is all-day happy hour  prices on appetizers and drinks!  I never miss a Wednesday

RY804nKqRVeJ_kOkee59-w.text: Love the new space! The staff is wonderful and friendly and the drinks and food are just as great as I remember on Central!   I happened to be at the bar on Wednesday night enjoying a Painkiller and some happy hour food with Corrie and George behind the bar. I witnessed Nurit F. disrespect a few employees, mainly Corrie. She was very intoxicated and insanely rude. She was using foul language and yelling at Corrie calling her names that I will not mention. Before she moved to the bar, she was at a big table with a bunch of women who were screaming and disrupting other guests for hours. To attack a person for doing their job by refusing to serve you more alcohol because you were clearly intoxicated, slurring your words, yelling and getting aggressive, is pathetic.  ***Think of David Hasselhoff eating a burger on YouTube drunk, but sloppier.   Nurit F., I suggest if you want to be treated like a "friend" at bars and restaurants, you should learn how to act like a respectable human. Your behavior is embarrassing and I'm sad to learn that you are a teacher. I hope you set a better example for the children in your classroom. Lastly, why don't you educate yourself on the Arizona liquor laws? You are lucky the cops weren't called on you. Hula's is lucky to have Corrie, I'm not sure many other bartenders would've handled your shameful behavior with such grace.   I was planning on reviewing the new Hula's anyway but I decided to do it immediately after seeing Nurit's shady review. While she was yelling at Corrie last night, she mentioned giving Hula's a one star Yelp review. We all laughed about it because she was so drunk, we figured she wouldn't remember.  I hope Yelp does the right thing and removes her review!

98p1u2X9up1fCI5ycR5dUQ.text: A rare find on the flourishing 7th Street restaurant corridor.  Dana Mule has captured the essence of the Hawaiian Islands in this "Modern" take on this unique cuisine.  The menu provides offerings that allow you to sample several different varieties of seafood, beef, and of course - spam.  Yep, spam!  Stop right here if you don't understand.  My date and I started out with some, uhm.... Starters.  The Hawaiian Ceviche (BEST I've ever had) and the Crispy Coconut Shrimp Rolls.  Both were pure deliciousness!  DAY-Uhm!    On to the entrees.  She had the Teriyaki Ribeye Steak with wasabi mashed potatoes and slaw - yummy!  Me?  Remember the spam?  That's where I landed - the Hunkin Samoa Burger... a HUGE beef burger with jack cheese, fried spam, and a sunny side up egg on top - YES!    Cocktails?  Of course... we both had the Hawaii 5-O!    Near perfection.  GO HERE!

NpmVAcmim29BuiimTIUuZw.text: This place has been on my bookmarks and I was excited to go for a lunch meeting. Love the indoor/outdoor seating. Perfect for the beautiful weather. Their menu was extensive so you may want to prep before you go by taking a look at it prior.  The food was tasty, the service decent and I loved the decor. I ended up taking food home because the serving was huge. It was just okay though, not an experience that blew my mind or was memorable, but I think definitely worth a visit if you've never been.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WZA1s2jIWEkdFldG70Dtrw.text: Great space close to home! Not quite the party vibe of the previous location or the Old Town  location. But still the great drinks, food and service! Recommended for the best Weekend Happy Hour in town!

z5GvUnl7z4LHKvdVPOGZ0w.text: I never really do reviews just not my thing. But tonight my wife and I stopped in for drinks and some food. Drinks great food great service SUCKED!!!  We sat at the bar like always and it was not busy but talk about the worst bartenders the worst service never. No refill on water or drinks no one ever checked in on us. The other side of the bar hands down better service the  bartender checking on them refilling drinks. This is not the service I except from this place we love this place but today really makes me question the people they have working there. I can say we will not be back anytime soon.

TC094SygqosMgA65nEpchQ.text: Good times!  I really enjoyed my time here during their opening day (night) and I look forward for returning often!    Their previous location was great and it is bittersweet that they had to relocate, however, with the same concept and service this one is sure to be a success.    During my visit the barstaff was extremely attentive and helpful, and was able to quickly and satisfactorily correct a mix up with the order which was most likely my own fault (miscommunication about regular vs sweet potato fries).  Speaking of which, their sweet potato fries are excellent, and so are the regular fries, too.  But do yourself and your friends a favor and get the sweets because they are always just right.    The beverage menu was varied and fun, the barstaff quickly made on and off menu requests that were also just right.  The lead bartender suggested a very excellent IPA from the Beer Research Institute (BRI) that I enjoyed very much.  As an aside, that is the most clever beer or brewery name I've ever heard of.   Looking forward to returning and enjoying good vibes, good service, good eats and drinks again soon.

Qb7ELUOP1P4n1DC3z-01rw.text: Went to the new location on 7th Street wife ordered Ahi tuna tacos and I had the the baja fish tacos  both were very good nice patio seating we enjoyed it very much.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loco moco action!

aXctm7dIDw_wZ1ptODEBqw.text: We've been to Hula's several times and have always had great service, amazing drinks, and delicious food. The most recent time we went to Hula's was the most incredible experience we've had yet. We came on a Wednesday night when they do all day happy hour. As such, it was an incredibly busy evening. We were seated outside, but weren't brought water for 20 minutes. A sever named Kieth arrived outside, inquired as to our situation, and stated that this was simply unacceptable. This gentleman was clearly not our assigned server, but took it upon himself to ensure we had a positive dining experience. Keith immediately brought us our drinks and took our dinner order. Later upon asking for our check, Keith informed us that our meal and dessert were on the house and that he hoped we would come again for a more positive experience. We thanked Keith and tipped him generously for such exemplary customer service. We will without a doubt be returning for dinner! Someone please give this man a raise or a promotion!

oYCi6aM21g-ZFj5Nf_9SDQ.text: This review is long overdue.   We have been to Hulu's numerous times both at the old Central Avenue location and this new location.  Sometimes a place just has a good vibe and Hulu's is such a place.  Between the decor, the layout, and really good food and service, our experience has been top-notch every single time.  It's one of my favorite places in Phoenix for drinks and dinner.

Lm33DkhMxBbItyVIeab32g.text: It's been three years since I wrote about our long time standby Hula's, and not since their move over to 7th street. We've been to the new location 4 times and are now sure that we like the feel better than the Central spot. Same great menu, and superb mixology. My wife explores the rum concoctions while I stick to the Mai Tai which is the best in Phoenix. Our waiter remembers us and what we like to order. That's the kind of place you're looking for even if you don't know it at the time. The food is sublime especially the fish cakes and the calamari, which indeed reminds of abalone

vlU8ylKnserkwVDEVUXzDA.text: Hulas moved form their previous location which was a little closer to downtown to where it is now. The downside is the plaza they're in gets PACKED! So parking can be a hassle especially during HH. This location does have an outside patio but no where as big as the 1st location. And it can literally be standing room ONLY during busy times.   There is a speakeasy next door which is also a part of Hulas (different name) however if you get a cocktail there you won't be able to take it outside to go into Hulas. Drinks must be drank there.   All day HH on Wednesday's (after 4p)  are great as you have many appetizer and drink options to enjoy.  Not the healthiest food but definitely enjoyable with a group of friends. Will def be back on Wednesday's.

aVIkbJrgpGMURwwdY3MEEQ.text: Great restaurant and atmosphere. Waitress was great and attentive. Half the group had tastings of different rums. Appetizers and dinners was all very tasty and cooked just right. We didn't have a bad and will definitely come back when I come visit from LA.

tRgqj_YQOZUxyH_SPqIw3g.text: Came here for a birthday bar crawl and glad that this was the dinner stop. We were greeted right away as we had a reserved  room not sure what the wait would have been but they were not super busy at the time. I ordered the loco moco simple ingredients that come together for a great taste. With just rice a burger patty and egg with a beautiful brown gravy that brought it all together.  I will definitely be back to try more of the menu  out.

X7wmna-l1vu3WB9GSXl5mA.text: Oh boy. Had dinner here this evening.  The kindest thing to report is that the servers are super nice.   But the food? The super-sweet drinks?  So many better options.

ks28jTDb5t-C2j-b1GQV-w.text: Great spot to bring friends as you can start here with dinner and a "painkiller" rum drink. Make sure you get it loaded up with a Kraken floater for the full effect.   Then just stumble across the street to Patties!  If you are really going for it and have another to share with get the Scorpion Bowl!  Also a fan of this place when they open up the whole front of the building when the weather is nice. It makes it feel liek every seat in the place is in a covered patio.

IvvaAgFhBT9gAQgNxQXTKw.text: YUM!   I've been recommended to go here several time and finally got a chance to. The decor is fun and modern. We went on a Friday night around  6pm and there was no wait. The table we were seated at was a little too close to our neighboring table. We could hear their entire conversation and they could hear ours. We has fun trying to figure out if they were on tinder date 1, 2 or 3.  We had trouble picking from the menu because everything sounded so good. I love the hawaiian and jamaican spices so every single thing on the menu was right up my alley.  We ordered the poke as an appetizer and it was the best outside of Hawaii that I've had.   I finally decided on the Jawaiian Jerk pork plate and my boyfriend got the fish tacos. We were both satisfied with the meal. He just wished there was more fish and less "stuff" in the tacos.  Side note: The jerk pork tasted EVEN BETTER the next day as a leftover :)  The reason why I am giving Hulas a 4 star rather than 5 star rating is that I think its a bit overpriced. My meal was $14 it should have been $10-$12. Don't go here if you are looking for a cheap, good meal. Was an expensive dinner for 2 after drinks.   Will return as a treat every now and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6R5gkbMOdsDCZeaMYQhSMA.text: Review based on service only, would have given 0 stars if I had the chance. We had Kaitlyn helping us tonight and I've never been so disappointed. It took her over 10 minutes to come greet the table. After that it took another 10 minutes until I had to go to the bar and ask the bartender to make me a drink since she failed to bring it to me. Our food came out correctly, yet she didn't bring the food out to us and only asked if we needed anything after we had already eaten everything. She took forever to pick up our tab and overall just wasn't a good server. Not once did she apologize for how incredibly slow she was working and didn't have an ounce of personality.   I love Hulas and come often, but if I ever have this server again I will most likely walk out. The food is amazing but it's not worth spending money here if I have to wait forever to receive it.   Overall food is 5/5 stars, but your service needs work...

AnZ--sKG8VP3D7SeSQe6OQ.text: Deliciousness: 4/5 Happiness: 5/5  Hula's is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix. Who would have known that I would have discovered an affinity for Hawaiian (Polynesian) food in the desert?  This is definitely a place to eat outside. They have a big central fire-pit and a bar area that opens to their dining patio. Yes, it overlooks the light rail and busy central street, but the food, drink and atmosphere make you practically forget you are in the middle of a crowded city. The crowd is usually bustling with people of all ages. Very kid friendly too despite a decently heavy drinking atmosphere.  The food is great - easily some of the freshest and tastiest fish in town (made more impressive given how far we are from the ocean). I can NEVER get enough of the tuna sandwich. Johnny Cakes are a fun spin on cornbread, and I highly recommend ordering some to the table, along with fish bites. If you are a pork fan, the options are numerous. The sides (typically rice and beans or fries) are always a bit bland, but the sandwiches and main dishes are top notch. I know they have a brunch menu too, but I don't really remember it well from the one time I attended.  The drinks are the True star of the show. This is the only place I have been to where I have enjoyed a rum-based drink. They also have some tasty vodka creations. But my favorite is the Scorpion Bowl! 2-4 can share right out of the tiki-styled receptacle with fun neon-covered straws. The drink acts as a moat around a flame in the center. And people, nothing is more fun than drinking around an open flame.  Tiki's is a really fun and unique restaurant. I love it to pieces. Make sure it's on your list, especially if you enjoy a fruity and well-made mixed drink.

LEO1URGZY8cyavHBXLGiwg.text: Placed a big order for lunch today and everything was perfect. Some of my coworkers complained that the steak and ahi was not cooked properly. If you don't like pink then I suggest you specifically ask when ordering. Had the chicken bowl it was delicious. Also took a bite of the steak sandwich and it was perfect!  I have also been there for happy hour and they have great specials, even on weekends

vv_cqsuoIqxY9ZHQPFSgMg.text: Amazing food. Very reasonable prices. The atmosphere is amazing, great service. Will recomend to my friends and will definitely come back again. Thanks!!

CMvF4KTExakdT0rLkOzTIQ.text: Nothing special about this place. Most things are not so good and seem like previously frozen items. The service was decent.

VnjAH4_aHG39iLvi2pOgLQ.text: Surprisingly good! Stumbled upon this restaurant through a Yelp suggestion. My husband and I dined inside on a Saturday night. The atmosphere is amazing. Loved the modern decor. The service was fantastic! Our waitress made sure my water glass never got empty. She must have refilled my glass 6 times! Our food came out extremely fast! Everything we ordered was SO delicious! The grilled chicken sandwich was so unique and flavorful. Highly recommend this restaurant. We will definitely be back!

fTK1u5R5ry8K8Ee-wXVyjQ.text: I came here because it was a dog friendly restaurant. The patio is quite inviting on a hot summer night. Got the macadamia encrusted hapu -- It was the most delicious fish dish I've ever had.  If there is a heaven, surely that's what they serve there. Perfectly matched with sides of cole slaw and coconut milky rice. They make a kick ass mai tai, too. I'm a connoisseur of key lime pie, and so I got it. They make it in house. It, too, was simply divine.

Ty-fHeEdJPeLSmR25OTRqQ.text: Food and service are great! Cool atmosphere also! I'll be back for sure!  The fish tacos are delicious!

7Gv7dAPLC5Tfst1RIxyXjA.text: After a chaotic and disappointing experience last month, I left a critical review and was subsequently contacted by the owner. He was genuinely interested in my concerns and committed to address my feedback.   So we gave Hula's another chance last night and it was an entirely different and a much improved and very pleasant experience. I wanted to change things up and asked our server for a suggestion and she offered up the Kalbi ribs. Well, they were spectacular! Kudos to Dana and his team!

is01hzswiyvTlCetM7G8-Q.text: LOVED our experience. I wish I had 10 stars to give. I hosted a surprise 40th birthday party for my boyfriend which was 2 months in the planning. We had a party of 36... yes 36 people. From the very first email to last call (yes we closed down the bar), EVERYONE at Hula's was absolutely amazing and accommodating. Kyle the manager, was ever patient with my obsessive emails and questions, Cherise was a rock star making sure everyone had what they needed without missing a beat. She was sweet and smiling all night even though I know that we had her running. The food came out exactly as requested and got rave reviews (ordered a little of everything off the appetizer menu.  The atmosphere on the patio was the perfect mix and mingle place for our party. We cannot wait to come back and have dinner and explore the menu. My boyfriend was thrilled and everyone had a great time. Thank you for making the night complete!

pnJ0x11OY3gaS-OcrIQk3Q.text: Great atmosphere and great food. Extensive drink menu all reasonably priced.   Good sized patio for dining outside.  Had Duke's pork plate: Excellent

kN-AlToCrk0hyDMQSpgdxg.text: came here for my bday dinner and sat outside under the burners. super cool and chill place. the waitress was super nice. the food was good and the music was cool. hippie vibes.

W39Puz80wndNX1CziBkk6w.text: This is a gay friendly venue... great atmosphere and the servers were fun and friendly. Sadly there is no healthy choice menu and the drinks where beyond disappointing. Wouldn't rush back. The attached picture is my health salad smothered with dressing!!

I7euh0s_xio445Nnc1aWtw.text: Walked into a  cozy atmosphere .  For starters I tried the shrimp rolls those were really awesome along with the pineapple sauce . For  $6 not worth for only 4 pieces.  I had one of there burgers that was suppose to be spicy.  Was hoping there would be more flavor to the the burger but couldint taste the signature sauce that was suppose to be included with it . Overall staff were friendly food was ok .

2MnPlaY7AaaKqVmtTykIcA.text: (Lyrics - Mr Big - To Be With You)  Hula's Modern Tiki Show me what you got to eat Drinks up, Luau Pork A Longboard Lager can't be that bad When it's brewed, it's brewed Hula's will make you breakfast too So come on, foodies, come on over Let Bo Bites be the one to show you  I'm the one who wants to eat with you  Deep inside I hope you'll taste it too  Waiting in a line for drinks and food Just to be the next to eat with you  Hula's Modern Tiki is fast becoming one of Phoenix's downtown staple.  Always open and always on the trend of making this happen.  Seasonal and daily specials so this is definitely one of those places that is worth the visit.  Hula's, like the name says, is a modern tiki restaurant.  The displays and decor are not as tacky though.  Actually well maintained and a lovely spot to to hang with friends or bring a drink date.  I love coming here for brunch!  $2 mimosas and the menu is a knockout!    We started with some spicy edamame and crispy shrimp eggrolls.  The spicy edamame made me want to drink more haha cause it was SPICY!  Loved it! While the eggrolls were crispy and crunchy from the shell. the shrimp texture mellowed it out.  I ordered the Luau Pork for my main; thought it was okay, I didn't care for the porky taste I guess, but my friend ordered their jerk fish.  Hands down I was so jealous cause it was damn good! The jerk was nice and creamy and with a kicking spice as it should be.    Overall, service was very good and food was excellent as usual.  You can't ask for anything more from a restaurant.  Thanks Hula!  - Enjoy!

anWO8u3h7Vh5p9KyRRVyxQ.text: Phoenix Tiki-ish Bar  I may or may not remember correctly, but I think back when it was "in" & computers and smart phones weren't ubiquitous...that this location used to be one of those fancy cutting edge cyber-cafes.  All that fresh e-mail and a little SPAM ... a harbinger of what was to come...HULA's & spam spam spam spam spammity spam! ... Benedict.  These days, the only SPAM you'll find here is on the menu!   Throw out the junk e-mail and order that SPAM benedict. For an official cleanse of your hard drive...upload a "tiki bastard!" or two. They have a wide selection of tropical tonics.    The patio here is very spacious, dog-friendly and the restaurant is casual and open air. The mai-tais are the straightforward option and tasty. I think my favorite item on the food menu is the Poke. Other offerings were good, but just not as memorable (thank goodness for photos ;)    Our service has been hit and miss, otherwise I'd have made this a four star review.   I also think this place is a wee bit island-priced if it ain't happy hour. Aloha to then: the "Hula Bucks" that are good any time it isn't Happy Hour (or some other promo) but it always seems to be HH or something else, so I've never gotten to cash in a hula buck.    I'd go again.
