Food still good drinks they do in batches now.  I guess that's progress.  I'm happy for them they have an upscale crowd its buisness. I and my friends all miss the old school vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5rPnEWZE90L9bPLT2ltQlg.text: First place we are for dinner! Loco loco and ribeye with the fish bites! Perfect. The bartenders were super nice and the  portions were big. We will def come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loco Moco
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Bites
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Teriyaki Ribeye Steak

Wm-XNFFNqOggdLMtwdvScg.text: Hula's Modern Tiki is 100% the place to go for Hawaiian styled food and drinks!  The food makes my tongue dance, the drinks make me want to limbo, and the atmosphere is just cool enough that I could chill here all day.  Here are some of my favorites:  Drink: Mai Tai. All day everyday.  The first sip reminds me why I love ocean side drinks. They're just so fun, fruity with a nice bite to it  Appetizer: Hawaiian Ceviche. This white fish "cooked" (not cooked) in all that citrus and coconut milk is divine! My mouth waters thinking about how light and flaky the whole thing is.  Main: Spicy Thai Chicken bowl. The spicy thai sauce is to die for, and the addition of the plantains is magnificent.  Runner Up: Spicy Thai Fish Cakes appetizer. Kinda like a crab cake but with cilantro, chili, and ginger - it's awesome.  Pro Tip: they do Happy Hour all day on Wednesday's......you're welcome ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio with large fire pit
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour all day on Wednesday
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mai tais

t4EkjyZaRDCetMhLEKSi_Q.text: Came looking for refreshing drinks on a hot summer day and this place delivered! We had decided to use this place as a launch point for an afternoon of cruising downtown/midtown but ended up staying the majority of the afternoon. Happy hour is an all day affair, on the weekends, so you can imbibe without clearing out your wallet. Friendly service and our drinks never went dry!

d9DdmP2HboXU13yKvMdBfg.text: First time eating at Hula's !  The decor is very inviting and you feel like you might be on vacation! The menu has many great items and even peering over at plates on other tables had me triple checking my decision. I had the burger with a sausage, egg and slab of spam on it. Sweet potato fries... The burger was very good but it was "extra". Ha ha..... crazy meat lovers burger so be ready!!  The fries were very good and you can tell they care about their food!

qocosN8ooiLWJVegMfh8zA.text: First, let's start with the fact that they do all-day HH on Wednesday's. The drinks are delicious. The appetizers are plentiful and tasty. I highly recommend the fish bites.   Outside patio is dog-friendly. At this point in time, I wouldn't recommend that you take a dog there in the summer. The ground can be pretty warm. However, not knowing that, the servers came out with cold towels for puppy feet and lots of ice cold water. Love and have always loved this place.

NqY3KqcB8Q75NnezNjtiwg.text: Yum! I love the Mongolian beef bowl w/ curry. It is a little spicy yet very flavorful. The only downfall of the dish is I loathe cilantro and it was sprinkled throughout the dish. Had I known that ahead of time I would have asked to make it without.  The mixed drink menu is pretty good as well, especially the painkiller.  Let me just say that they have the best coconut cream pie I have ever eaten. This little gem is worth the trip alone!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mongolian beef bowl and cheese burger.

Y9DBhImUi8p7azxqmlpHGQ.text: LOVED the potstickers and steak kabobs. Have been thinking about them since we had them on my birthday earlier this year... need to make time to go back!   Have been back many times and each time is delicious and comes with great service!

s8fQMpJyoyGVKogNmPpQ2g.text: My husband and I would go here at least twice a month for happy hour.  It was always great, staff were super attentive and the manager was always on site greeting customers.  We went last Saturday for the first time on a weekend and the place completely changed.  Bartenders ignored us and an entire side of the bar.  Couldn't get their attention.  We ending up leaving and went to a different bar.  What happened hulas?

BbBG9yG2WQLs7DXHGoFr2w.text: Hula's was made made JUST for me. Strong fruity drinks and fried plantains? I feel like I should be in a bikini and dancing. I'm not sure what Jamaican jerk chicken is supposed to taste like but five stars due to mango being there. All the flavors just melded together. It was so good, I can't wait to come back.   Date Rating: 2 out of 5. Myles has this chubby lumberjack look going on. Sue me, it's cold and I wanna cuddle. The WHOLE date he questioned why I was there. "You look like a model, why are you paying me any attention?" "Are you sure you're interested in me?" "We're complete opposites." Nothing is more of a turn off than low self esteem. I was on the date wasn't I? I liked how he was smart and we had great conversations. He also ended up talking about politics and I'm pretty sure his were completely opposite of mine. It was all enough to make me roll my eyes and agree with him that yes I was out of his league.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jerk chicken

bZYFC4DclRVwIRXmO78GmQ.text: Awesome restaurant & bar in Scottsdale; service and staff were nice and friendly. The food was awesome ... Spicy tofu tacos, tofu/rice/plantain/black beans w/shredded cabbage & sauce.  "Mr. Funk" cocktail was very refreshing and purchasing the souvenir glass was a plus

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6Yu_j3B3eMr4ioqOwuJn5Q.text: This place is awesome! Not only is it a really cool vibe (great for winter because the walls slide up), but the food is excellent. We had the French fries for an app with the dipping sauces (which they originally forgot the dipping sauces but we asked for them an they brought them out).  The hubs had the fish sandwich, which was a great size and flavor. I had the spicy Thai chicken bowl! It was huge! Brought more than half home so I'm excited I get to have more of it later! The sauce was I credible. Im a sauce girl if you can't tell. We will be back!

GW6tYTMwLWkowCVGw_NF6g.text: Loco moco and single mimosa made my Sunday the best day. The big plate of medium burger patty on top of rice with mushroom gravy and sunny side up eggs is so so delicious. The combinations went well  and I could not stop enjoying it. A small glass of single mimosa is good for me, especially I only drink a little bit.  Wings are also good with asian inspired sauce. The fried plantains are juicy sweet delicious. We ended our meal with Hula's sundae, vanilla ice cream with macadamia nuts on top.   The restaurant has a good vibe and cool decor. Parking might be hard but if you go the right time you will get the good spot.

jS98KHVGzO9wLS3ylwP6Mg.text: What a gorgeous building and ambiance, and thankfully they have their own parking lot! We ordered their Sweet Potato Fries, the Hapu (Hawaiian Sea Bass) Macadamia encrusted with Mango-Papaya sauce which came with rice and coleslaw, Dr. Funk (coconut rum, vodka, creme de banana and a splash of orange and pineapple juices), and the Coconut Cream Pie. And the pie is not just cream on a crust, it's layered and there's a lot of actual coconut. It was incredible!  Service was great too! We just mentioned sharing an entree when we ordered it and it came out pre-split for us, fish, rice and coleslaw! I rarely have that happen unless I specifically request dividing it. Was pleasantly surprised that they just went ahead and did it.  Everything was delicious! And reasonably priced! I was delighted even surprised by the check. Very affordable for the quality of food and location. And I love the retro theme, apparently it was inspiried by the popular tiki bars of the 50's and 60's. I especially love the classic songs they play here.  An excellent, and a very well put together place. Great for a date, or for a family dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The theme. Very 60&#39;s.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Dr. Funk cocktail.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Coconut Cream Pie!

KtKgY68hwz7LwaOJocZCeQ.text: Cute ambiance. Tiki themed without being overkill. Fun drinks with a very Tiki feel and fun glasses. We went during Happy Hour and the drinks seemed to be a bit watered down, still good, but definitely not strong. We tried the Mr Funk and the Tropical Itch.   For appetizers we had the Coconut Shrimp Rolls. They were a bit disappointing. Maybe a bit too sweet? The sauce really did not complement the flavor - something a bit more tart with a bite would have helped.   I had the Macadamia Encrusted Mahi with Wasbi Mashed potatoes. The food was dry dry dry. The salsa topping didn't help with how dry the fish and macadamia crust was. The Wasbi Potatoes were interesting, but very dry.   For dessert we shared the coconut cream pie - which was great! I love coconut and this pie was much more coconut than it was cream, and the crust was thick. I would order again.   I don't think I will be rushing back anytime soon, but it was a nice place to check out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Shrimp Rolls and Tofu Taco
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Cream Pie - share this! It&#39;s big!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aLFOclwDt4i_1au4mXTgpA.text: Yikes. This place isn't like a tiki at all. I came excited for the drinks (guilty), but left with the realization that the drinks are the only thing worth getting here. Which is pretty sad. And the drinks don't really have a tiki feel to them--they merely serve as alcoholic beverages. This all ruins the purpose of a tiki, at least for me.  For food, our table ordered a wide variety, including ceviche, the hula burger, shrimp tacos, and a salad. While I try to be nice about my reviews, this place had zero good food.   This was all made intolerable by the fact that a woman bringing out the food kept leaning over my friend to serve and hand things to one of my other friends seated right next to him. This was all very awkward to look at and we were all confused as to whether she was intentionally ruining group conversation. All she had to do was walk past that friend and hand the food to the specific person, but she kept--literally--leaning over another person. There was nothing in the way, folks, just a mere three steps would have done the job. Wack.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceviche

pX28ZMlJrCH7BUGJy-X0ww.text: I am updating my review and giving an earned 5 stars for multiple reasons. First and foremost, Dana one of the owners, reached out to me and showed he clearly values their customer's experience!. He gave me an opportunity to explain why we felt the way we did, took our critique into perspective as a learning experience, without making excuses, and offered a way to make it better. It's not every day you meet an owner who takes pride in and values their customer's opinions, let alone do what it takes to have you return for a second chance. We came back tonight and without the expectation of getting special treatment had a completely different experience than before. Our server, Keith, was perfect on all levels along with having a warm smile and personality, which in my opinion shouldn't be all too difficult with serving. The drinks and food from start to finish were perfect! For an appetizer we had the Samurai Beef Sticks, with the lime-curry dipping sauce which was probably my favorite part of the whole entire meal! I even held onto it to use with the main course lol. For our meal I had the Cajun Ahi Caesar but with a lighter dressing (I cant remember the kind I had) that had a kick of spice but was was delicious and exactly what I was in the mood for! My friend had the Kalbi Ribs and it was very tasty. All in all between the service and the food everything was FANTASTIC! I am so glad we gave this place another try because if this is what the norm is I would highly recommend and do plan on coming back or visiting while I'm in CA ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kalbi Ribs, delicious!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Samurai Beef App, sooo good! Curry sauce
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cajun Ahi Caesar, fantastic!

5Jnis5AqiCvLiPvkOELPdQ.text: I've been going to Hula's Modern Tiki for about a year now and I have to say I haven't been disappointed. Being a big fan of Trader Vic's and Smuggler's Cove in San Francisco, I'm also pretty impressed.  The Polynesian style menu is creative and quite good (the pork tacos and the spicy seaweed salad are two of my favorites). The cocktails are outstanding. You'll find not only the traditional (really good Mai Tai's) but also drinks with a "twist" (try the Juan Ho)!   With a diverse clientele, the atmosphere is very "hip" and stylish (a la modern tiki). Seating includes the main dining area, the bar lounge, or outside on the large central patio. One of the best attributes of Hula's is the staff. Just about everyone working there is thoughtful, fun and attentive. Even the owner's a really a nice guy (he's often around). Did I mention they have one of best Happy Hours in Phoenix?

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio and fire pit.

OvoaRs2GlJgGbHSj1T1R-Q.text: Update: I was contacted by Dana about my review and he encouraged us to give it another shot. The service this time was significantly better and the food was very good. We will definitely go back again.

8c406lE7nX_VeenYdzoMvw.text: Great food !!!! We had super fast service ! :))) I would definitely recommended !!!! I had some chicken bowl that was recommended by the server .... It was delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gxQemtjt9KuhcE1xNHRiJw.text: We popped in for a quick drink. I have celiac disease, so I needed to have a gluten free vodka. Our server, Ariel, said they were out of Titos, but would come up with a good replacement. Our drinks were soooo yummy!  And Ariel was such a sweetheart! We'll definitely be back! :)

ONOFpdsd3gGxmL9OeXzIsA.text: Absolutely wonderful. Fun place and the food rocks. Here celebrating a good friend's birthday. All the food was over the top. If you're visiting Phoenix,  you must eat here.

YXH4-HB6TeOk27UAmJPmNA.text: Good drinks and good food- Garlic Edamame was delicious  Chicken bowl was amazing Chicken tacos were good Beef bowl has a lot a yellow curry flavor but still good

1-nzOh8zgm82uR219WR5dA.text: My favorite day drinking place.  Great patio, friendly staff, tasty drink options, and well lit clean environment.  Make sure you order the Dr. Funk if you are undecided; it will not disappoint.

s1VqwJsqcAixZ0FCEXXLNA.text: I wanted to update this review because I received a very prompt, thoughtful, and kind email from the owner, demonstrating the care and passion he has for his restaurant.  It is clear that he really does care, and wants patrons to enjoy their time at Hula's.  I really respect his reaching out to me.  The three stars reflect this.  My group will give Hula's another shot, and hopefully, we can make it a 5 star visit.

2X4yJK_lM-Ztb6vj5qEekQ.text: We were looking for a late lunch stop after shopping and before checking in I our hotel. If we lived in Phoenix, this would be a regular stop. Service, food, ambiance, and drinks were perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ph5Laviz7FfxSXQKurcHnw.text: The jerk chicken was pretty for this not be resturant dedicated to jamacian cusine. I would order again. Also the drink I had was very tasty and smooth.  My waitress was great! They comped our drinks for keeping us waiting and I didnt feel like we were waiting long at all so I felt much obliged to compensate her with a tip. She had a nice personality and made my friend feel at home for her 23 birthday with a nice ice cream concoction.  I will definitely be visiting again! I want to try more of their food gems and explore the drink menu

v1UE7UuIIOJoo7KC42TSHg.text: Hula's you've won me over.  My second visit was brimming with warm friendly service, reasonable drinks and tasty food.  The indoor/outdoor blended space here is awesome on a gorgeous Phoenix evening in February!  Until next time Hula's!

3K5vEjTNfug9t3G6Gt_zUQ.text: You can't go wrong here! There is something for everyone! The menu and atmosphere is very eclectic. You'll find business groups, old people, young people and some people that you can't quite figure out. One thing is for certain- you'll always get good service! I've been here for brunch, lunch, happy hour and dinner and have never once been disappointed.  As for what to order I highly recommend the spicy thai chicken bowl! If you are on a budget I recommend the pork taco only $3 on the happy hour menu. The amount of meat is easily 2 tacos. My favorite part of the menu... DRINKS! The blood orange martini on the rocks is a must try!

DgxKtp1vOjoUo-qhur2ruw.text: Hula's Modern Tiki is a cute little gem in the middle of Phoenix. What's not to love about a modern-with-a-touch-of-retro tiki bar? I have yet to try their food, but the drinks are delicious.The staff is friendly and the patio is a great place to kick back on a nice night.   Overall, I would recommend Hula's Modern Tiki to couples, friends, or groups looking for a chill place to kick back under the stars.

XiO9kLGtBQYDx79gV13pyQ.text: I've only had the spicy shrimp salad.  It's pretty good, so I order it whenever I go to Hula's.  Parking is a nightmare during peak times.

iBtieTOlkl3OD3wPkZ0M1Q.text: (Update to my last review.) Service wasn't the best but you know what the owner rectified the situation within a day of my review on yelp honestly who does that? The dish I ordered wasn't to my liking but that's probably because I ordered the wrong item. I loved the Shrimp wantons. If you like the spicier side of food you will have to ask them to make it spicier I am not sure if they can do that. But the tastes are a mix of sweet and spicy. It's worth a try if you like trying fusion cuisine. I would go again to try something else on the menu.

t0V2kEyHbqbMWqazMDR3mQ.text: Great food and amazing service. The restaurant was a bit loud, the drinks are mostly comprised of rum.

7bGVlUgEN2chawi2M4g1ng.text: Love this place! Great food & drinks. Sweet Potato fries, shrimp rolls and the Hawaiian chicken are all my faves!

NNLiPoXhD1JfLhj-VicDrA.text: We tried twice but ugh, they can't get it right. Food and drinks are just not good. Just go to Hawaii for Hawaiian food.

aTCWB2GHmrVppbfgEqXYUw.text: One of my favorite stops!!! The atmosphere is awesome!!! The food is amazing!! We always get the coconut shrimp spring rolls, and the spicy edamame. Very good. And I usually choose from any of the fish. I like that you can pick what you want and how you want it cooked etc. The burgers are amazing if you don't like fish and so is the salads!!

Izi_SkhBK_-oBNKpPGPySA.text: Hula's is one of my favorite places to eat, get a drink, or do both It has such a cool modern tiki design and layout that is sort of makes you feel like you're not in Phoenix It is very well known for its lush patio but inside dining is just as great because it is so earthy and trendy You have to try the Mai Tai's, they are fabulous If you're feeling a bit daring, you and a friend or date should try the Scorpion Bowl Might take a group of 3+ PS: It has Bacardi 151 I have always had pleasant encounters with the servers and waitstaff All of them are very friendly and knowledgable on both food & drink menus Two of my favorite foods here are 1) The Hangover Hash, it is excellent If you are there for brunch please try the H.H, you wont regret it 2) The Polynesian Chicken Sandwich, again, it is scrumptious Their tacos are yummy as well   Their happy hour specials are really great too

1iOyk6Wu3hLM8ApVt_y_mw.text: SOUTH SEAS FISH TACOS!!!  Yep, I said it.  And to wash it down Dr. Funk (if you're by yourself.  If you have a friend or two, Volcano Bowl (its worth it)

RAZYe8Sgt_D9sDxzDUoBQQ.text: Good god, after two trips I can say there is maybe two things on the menu if we were to return i would order. One is an appetizer and the other is a side.  The ahi poke salad and the plantain bananas.  Everything else I have tried as far as the bowls go were absolutely gross in my opinion. I couldn't even stomach the ahi bowl and I LOVE ahi! So i pushed aside my bowl not wanting to tell our waiter i was absolutely disgusted with it since i think thats just rude to say that and omg my poor sister who is a vegetarian wasn't very hungry ordered a side of mac and cheese and said it was the WORST mac and cheese she has ever ate.  I would have easily said something to the waiters about her food since shes my baby sister and as skinny as they come i would tell her to stop playing with it and to let me say something but she just picked up maybe a noodle every  5 min and put it back down.  I would have thought the waiter would have picked up on our lack of interest in our food with completely full bowls but obviously no S**t's were given.  Nice to know hula Nice to know.

t0Z-DkUpKaDsCK74KhEIVw.text: I met some friends out for dinner and drinks.  The service was pretty good. Our waiter was nice but we had to flag him down a lot.  We were able to sit for over 3 hours without feeling rushed at all.  Plus the prices were quite reasonable.  We started with the chicken sticks which were great.  I had the Ahi Tacos that were messy but super delicious.  My friend had the ribs and another friend had a chicken dish, both of which I would also recommend.  They have a long list of cocktails which were all delicious, but it is hard to find something without pineapple.  They have a nice outdoor patio but we couldn't enjoy that because it was one of those weird experiences of rain in the desert.  Overall I'm glad I went and I would recommend again.

e6V-rWh1pBDtncTIHhFylQ.text: If you're looking for a fabulous patio, you have found the place.  Tiki has a full bar and a great indoor/outdoor atmosphere, this is a great happy hour or group kind of place.    I agree with most on here that the food was ok.  I had the tofu with a lemon sauce and it was good, but not nearly as flavorful as others I have had at other restaurants.    I could see this as being a place to meet for happy hour, informal meeting or just day drinking, but I wouldn't stay for dinner.  Neither my guest or I were blown away by the favors of the food, but the drink menu and atmosphere were wonderful.

l5zJckfzNccE8dS2guI6jw.text: You take the good, you take the bad,  you take them both and there you have... Hula's Modern Tiki.  The rare moments I'm craving a strong, fruity, Rum fueled cocktail this is the spot to hit. The drinks are well crafted but the food and service is hit or miss. The patio is one of my favorite in the valley, but a nice patio does not make for a 4+ star experience. They're packed all the time so they must be doing something right, though it certainly isn't the Ahi Sashimi. I know, I know... don't even ask why we would attempt sashimi at Hulas. I'm embarrassed enough as it is. This 'starter' was literally two bites of food. Two bites of mediocre food for $9 mind you. I was told by my orthodontist years ago that I have a very small mouth (go ahead, there's a punch line in there somewhere) so it's not like I have some Real Housewives of The Underworld hoover mouth and no idea what a starter portion should look like. We both actually looked at each other and laughed when it was placed in front of us. I'm a tapas girl, I love small plate dining, this was just a bit extreme. The pork tacos on the other hand were excellent. Filling, well seasoned and tender; the comedy of the sashimi became a distant memory.   We will definitely return. As I stated the patio is beautiful and weather permitting, worth a trip on it's own for Happy Hour. Play it safe with you're dining decisions and you'll walk out with a buzz and a full belly.  Post script:  In response to the owner comment, I should clarify that my hesitation in ordering ahi sashimi at this establishment is not at ALL in reference to grade or quality of product but more of a 'hindsight' situation, meaning in retrospect, it's doubtful that it would be a good representation of Hula's as a whole.

DjeTQomnSg-mnc-TNG_mnw.text: Having met some of the owners before it opened, I really wanted to love this place. The location is perfect, the concept is fun, the atmosphere is exciting, and the decor is wonderful.  But now that the head chef has gone back to the originals back in California, the place is a train wreck.  They started off on the wrong foot by sending out the worst $12 hurricane I've ever had. For a signature drink, I expected... something. Not a glass of ice. With a little juice and the most unbalanced, disgusting mix of rum I've ever tasted.  The blackened fish sandwich they sent out had raw spots. Pink, squishy, a little cold. Whoever made it had no idea how to sear a fish.  The pulled pork was perfectly caramelized, really just amazing. But it was buried under a slaw that may have come from an inspired recipe, but was atrociously executed. It was completely inedible, and it ruined the pork as well.  The sweet potato fries were nice to munch on, but they were served with "Hula sauce," which our waiter accurately compared to In-n-Out's special sauce: Ketchup and mayonnaise.   After spending $40, we sent back most of our food and left hungry.

JylIPUfFeJXpFGf7s2rdlQ.text: Great beer, excellent food, nice wait staff.  Had the shrimp tacos and they were amazing.  Unique place...I was a fan!

cUGg7Z2ZYgi6ir4r9pmDaw.text: I love discovering the great places downtown and now Hula's will be added to the list.   Had lunch there today with the fam...enjoyed every delicious bite of the Thai chicken bowl. Mom had the flank steak sandwich and shared a bite...that will definately be the next item to fully ingest.  The atmosphere is charming and eclectic...looking forward to the temperature cooling to enjoy the fire pit outside along with the great happy hour prices.

ZpaC73-U7O-5ozrnMsBy3Q.text: Very cool building and great spot to go when its nice out. They open it up and looks really cool. Pretty good bar food too if you are just getting a drink a good place for just a drink and appetizers too. Portions are big on most items.

hxDTVmdbIi_diiYhdI_reg.text: 'Meh...I've Experienced Better'  That is the perfect way to describe my experience at Hula. After reading the other reviews, I had the distinct impression that Hula was the kind of place that screws stuff up but is very nice about apologizing for it. That is exactly what happened to us.  I went to Hula after work on Friday with a couple of friends. I wasn't feeling too adventurous or particularly hungry, so I ordered the green salad. What I got was a soaked bowl of lettuce mix peppered with chinese buffet-style wontons. Yuck. My friend pointed out that he has an egg allergy, but the server brought out a dish with cole slaw, then took it back after he pointed out that cole slaw contains egg. The server then brought out the same dish without cole slaw, but with aioli. After pointing out that aioli contains eggs as well, the server finally brought out the dish without eggs. She was very apologetic, but it just validated the experiences of everyone else on Yelp....they work hard to correct things, but they should just get it right in the first place.  I do give them full props for the remodel of the space though, the building is beautiful.

srgFRJueBe8ou3os9gu5VA.text: Came back to Hula's for dinner this time.  Ran into the owner who remembered me from the City Circles Light Rail Wine Walk.    My girlfriends and I all ordered the butterfish, based off the recommendation from our friendly waitress.  It was delicious!  Try the LemonGrass or Macadamia Nut Crusted preparation.  Both are yummy!  We all licked our plates clean and couldn't stop raving about how fresh the fish was.  It practically melted in your mouth.    Minus one star because it was freezing inside!  Bring a sweater!  A response from the owner:  "Velika,  Great to see you! I appreciate your taking the time to give us a review, and for your business! We embrace all criticism, both good and bad, since it helps us in our constant struggle to be better. I'm glad you came back! Sorry about the temperature, but here's the problem we have: if we turn off the A/C when it's humid, the moisture in the air settles on the cold concrete floor and makes it slick as ice. I'm afraid someone will fall and really hurt themselves, so that's our dilemma. I'm so sorry that it marred your experience, and hope to make it up to you sometime soon.  Take care, Velika!  Dana GM/Managing Partner"

CqUyWuOUVJ93Ar3l4bOS3g.text: I really do not know why it took so long for me to find this place!! It has such a great, relaxed vibe and oh man the mai tais are incredible! [I highly recommend the Dr. Funk!]

C3m3H-5jLzffs9JKZe-Qkg.text: My friends Steve and Liz live on the light rail route and introduced us to Hula's earlier this year and my hubby and I are hooked!    Get there before 6pm Mon - Friday and enjoy their nummy happy hour specials.  I order 2 pork or tofu tacos for $3.00 each and I am stuffed!  We were there again this past Saturday and I tried their Johnny Cakes for the very first time, which is a Jamaican corn bread and it's the best corn bread I have ever eaten.  I am suppose to be on a diet, but when someone mentions Hula's I make sure to make exceptions for this place, even if it's the only meal I eat all day.  Also, all the waiters, waitresses, and I think the owner Dana are always so friendly and welcoming that it makes you just want to stay there longer than intended.

aZSrlrGYvMy5d0mNk_I9iw.text: I stopped by Hula's for dinner last evening after finding that the Breadfruit, Lola, and Pizzeria Bianco are closed on Sundays. wtf. Damn it.  My waitress was attentive. My drink was stiff like last time. And my fish again was so so... This time I ordered the macadamia fish served with a white fish (you choose). I also had the sweet potato french fries.   The food simply is not good. I hope the owner reads these reviews and adjusts accordingly.  I will continue to come back as this is a local neighborhood restaurant for me. However, I'm going to lower its rating from 4 to 3 stars.  Note: This restaurant  definitely is worth a try. It's got a good vibe, and service is excellent. However, for 20-30 bucks, I expect better tasting food. I am convinced the management still is ironing out the kinks.

3KLq_m8_PrfT2_xnIg9xcg.text: This is one of my boyfriend and I's favorite spots. We live super far from here but we still travel from North Phoenix to come eat. We always start with a Poke bowl mixed with the ahi tuna (trust me it's delicious). Very very good quality fish. The sweet potatoes make a great side to any meal and don't even get me started on the dipping sauce OMG! I always get the ahi tuna sandwich it has all of the right flavors! Our favorite brewery is Kona and they serve it. My only wish is that they would have Big Wave more often :] I am VERY VERY pleased with Hula's. It's like being in Hawaii without the beach. Great atmosphere and even better service! Our food is always out fast and every server we have had always makes sure we are taken care of regardless how busy it is.

fbFAdsz2tbcZUxf1KI2odg.text: Well we were standing outside the doors 10mins before they first opened...that's how excited we were for this place. After watching for months, we finally have a new restaurant in town with a little more attitude than Parlor or StFrancis. Hula's is aiming at the kick back & relax crowd which fits me specifically. Good food is only good if I can pair it with a great drink & Hula's doesn't disappoint. Really, this place is great. To begin, the renovation is wonderful. On par with the other CenPho restoration projects of the past year - this one stands out by creating a period piece instead of going for a more modern style. There's a fire pit & plenty of outdoor seating along with a wonderfully decorated interior - all separated by some moving glass garage doors (like Postino). The best piece is their sliding table bench. It's hard to describe but a wonderful feat of engineering. The appetizers were pretty great. The sweet potato fries will give Delux a run for their money & are savory & crispy. The cevice is served with some oversized wonton chips that have a great flavor. The cevice itself has a bit of spice to it thanks to the peppers. The main dishes are a bit limited right now but the coconut chicken is simply delicious. With a sweet & spicy sauce over a perfectly cooked coconut-crusted chicken, this dish comes with rice & black beans. Really one of the better dishes I've had...plus, there was a lot of it. I had originally ordered the pork but had to steal the chicken from my wife. It was just too good. For dessert we just had to try the key lime pie. Not only was it NOT some frozen green brick (like most places) but it was a whole mess of complex flavors that made it the best key lime pie I've ever had. The servers were friendly & attentive. The owner came by & was receptive to input. The chefs were quick & the bar tender was heavy handed with a bomb Trader Vic MaiTai. Everything was great. Add to all of this the fact that it is on the LRT & I can't help but think I'll be spending a lot of time here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiki gods
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork plate
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dining room

rN0IMhGMQrh8su5FP4Fm6w.text: This place is rockin! It's really easy to make tiki seem really lame, but Hula's does a great job of creating a cool, modern tiki environment. On top of that, the food is very tasty.   I had the steak sandwich. The ingredients and seasoning mixed very well together. The steak was perfectly cook and was really great quality. Good prices for what you get.

5SAsfIhijmG_eMndtBEosA.text: With the unfortunate number of terrible experiences I've been having that have led to recent 1 and 2 star reviews, I'm glad Hula's provided a decent experience.  I've been here twice and had a crappy experience (the 4th day they were open, so I was willing to forgive) and a pretty good experience a week and a half later.  I've had just about everything they offer, so to sum up:  - Cool atmosphere, as noted by everyone else.  Open late, serves food late, and is relatively cheap  - There is nothing authentically Hawaiian about anything they serve here.  It's as authentic Hawaiian as Fez is authentic Middle Eastern.  That's not a bad thing, lord knows I love Fez and have enjoyed Hula's, it's just a fact you need to know in order to have a proper expectation of the food.  You're not going to get a fine Hawaiian culinary experience here.  I like Roy's for that ;-)  - The food in general is good-not-great.      - Favorite dishes - shrimp roll and poke apps, macadamia crusted mahi and teriyaki ono (or is it teriyaki hapu?).      - Decent dishes - The ceviche is ok, it's a fish ceviche which I'm normally not crazy about.  The pulled pork dishes are underwhelming but ok.  The sweet potato fries were mushy on the first visit (bleck) but nice and crispy the second, so it's going in the "decent" category    - Least favorite dishes - the steak was a 9oz piece of gristle, bleck!  The fried plantains were also pretty gross, I was really hoping for plantain chips but these were just mushy burnt blobs of plantain.  - The specialty drinks are all VERY SWEET...but VERY STRONG.  I forget the names of the ones I preferred.  We also had a volcano bowl which is, as previously noted, very sweet and strong.  The best drink they offer isn't even on the menu though - they stock Absolut Boston which is a black tea infused vodka.  My friends and I always order it with lemonade and have a delicious, strong Arnold Palmer.  - The service is hit and miss.  The food generally comes out of the kitchen very quickly.  But some of the servers are flakes.  Feh, not a big deal.  All in all, I'm glad to have this new edition to the CenPho light rail area.  Adds another good option to my regular haunts of Fez, Maizies, Postino, and Cheuvront.

DZdADCfauhy26dTfQY7P7A.text: I'm a sucker for nostalgia so I really dig the tiki theme. I have been here several times and the food is consistently good. A place like this should have good Mai Tais...and they do! Parking is rough.

nwy-9zYBTEKnctuSY1r1JQ.text: We went last Friday for the first time since last fall and holy crap, when did it become such a cool place to be?! We used to get a table on the awesome patio but this time had to squeeze into a tiny table inside. Oh well. Good for them!  Parking is a bitch so I found the gravel lot and hoofed it. It's ok--you don't have to wear hooker heels here to fit in.  Happy hour is a decent deal--$2 off drinks. But when the full price is just $7-9 for a mixed drink, don't feel bad if you miss the 6pm cut off! My fave is the ahi tuna burger. It's not ground up--it's a giant hunk 'o fish, cooked perfectly. I paired it with the sweet potato fries. If they're from a frozen bag, I'd be shocked. Or maybe I don't care; they at least look homemade! My girlfriend got the tacos and raved--two (plus the rice, etc.) made for a filling dinner. Portions are perfect.  Drinks are clever and super strong, so, please, get a cab. Love the mixed crowd here--everyone is welcome!

NIp4x6Wc5mM_k7kEPKHkTA.text: One of my new favorite places for Sunday brunch! Their drink specials are awesome, food's always great, service is also above expectations, overall a definite recommendation. Can't go wrong with what you order, whether its a burger, breakfast brunch, huge salads, all of it worth the money without breaking bank.

9kfXa7m5IgkvH1hdK7yV4Q.text: Well Dang I guess I wont be first to review haha.....  Apparently Hula's reputation precedes it.  The fun vintage atmosphere combined with an excellent wait staff, good mix of cocktails, and a great fairly diverse menu makes this place a 5 star in my books.....  Fun Vintage converted Garage (I think?) a nice older notstalgia with a modern twist the name says it all.....  I ordered a Griled Mahi Sandwich, Court ordered a Cheeseburger (we are creatures of habit)......let me tell you it may have been one of the best meals I have ever had.....literally.  The drinks were very well mixed (yes it was the middle of the day but were no drunks...) Just strong enough but you could taste the layers....and they knew how to make a fogcutter which is a staple of 1950's Tiki bars.  Sweet potato fries with Wasabi Ranch Dipping sauce gets extra point for being unique (as if 5 stars wasn't enough).  I do think the food has quite a sophisticated taste for being pretty much Burgers and Fries....it was a great lunch although I have heard this place gets elbow to elbow at night and on weekends.......best to hit it up when its not so bust IMHO.  Great Value, Great Food, Great Service = Zero Complaints....

ncnl61cRsgxjb5DAuuGMqQ.text: I am from Santa Cruz, CA and this place is a taste of home. When my cousin, who used to be a bartender at the Santa Cruz local, told me they were opening a place in Phoenix, I was SO HAPPY!!!  My favorite things are the Poke appetizer (seriously the BEST EVER), sweet potato friends, fish cakes, and DR FUNK! I could drink Dr. Funks all day long - nothing but coconut pineapple cocktail goodness! I could swim in that stuff it tastes so good. In fact, that's what I want for my birthday - a kiddie pool filled with Dr. Funk!  On the Santa Cruz menu, they have beef satay and ahi rice bowls that are amazing - I wish they were on this menu as well.  The ambiance is more "posh" than the Santa Cruz restaurant. I love the outdoor patio -it may be one of the prettiest I've seen in town.   I will go back to this place every time I miss home.

IIh3_IBxz5zTX3yFMdvbeQ.text: Went for a lunch meeting this past week.  The burger was cooked perfectly and was quite moist.  The salad on the side was presented very nicely.  Our server was attentive without being pushy.  We took a bit before we actually ordered and he was very patient.

XQpdaHZf30aViXyRLdZB4Q.text: So good. Came here during a business trip and the food was delicious. I had the Cajun burger. It was juicy and spicy. Ronnie was my server and he gave us great service. When I come back I will definitely go back to Hulas

TiXyK3_yzT-PmOPs6mWrHw.text: Hula's is a cool, not too cheesy, tiki bar in central Phoenix. I like it because it's right off the light rail, only a short ride from my house. Usually sit on the outside patio, which faces Central. Haven't really tried much of the food, calamari was pretty good and been told that their burgers are delish. The best part of Hula's is their Tiki Time happy hour, weekdays 330-6 and all day on the weekends! I'm not usually a Mai tai fan, but theirs are reeeally good.  They have brunch specials on the weekends, haven't tried that out yet but need to soon...  I'm always on the prowl for a mimosa!! Overall, I really dig this place. Chill and a great happy hour!

-c_lIdzaj48aKomZG0X9gA.text: This place has gone downhill. At least at night it goes down hill. Where are these people coming from? Geeze, I feel like I walked in to an episode of Jersey Shore. Blegh. The food is still pretty good, the volcano bowl is disgusting but worth the try. Hubs and I went one night just to hang out. It's so cramped. You are sitting on top of everyone around you. The good part of that is we had some good laughs at some RIDICULOUS conversations that were happening around us. I won't be visiting this place at night ever again. I may hit up Hula for some mimosas though. This place is much better for a nice brunch than it is for a night out.

pGLSk3A-Os4QZ7tuy32svQ.text: Pretty decent HH or "tiki time" prices.  I have been there 3x and had great service once.    Thankfully the place is so great that the lackluster service by the same waiter still had me coming back.  Much better this last time.  The Mac n Cheese is awesome!

Q69oI2l4KWbrAEzzDiMCsw.text: Love Hula's!  Best Mai Tai in town.  Staff is always nice and great atmosphere.  Check in on Yelp for specials.

MxczHp384LI88vBbR2HaBg.text: Just tried Hulas for the first time.  We are staying in Scottsdale but thought we would try something different in Phoenix, had our 2 teenage sons with us, ages 14and 17.  I had the Hula's Hurricane and my husband the Mai tai. And both were really good.  For dinner I had the luau pork platter, my husband had jerk chicken, my younger son had the teriyaki chicken sandwich, and my older son, a very picky eater, actually ate and enjoyed the Mac and cheese,  oh, and our starter was the coconut shrimp rolls.  We had a young man named William as our server, and he did a great job.  We were still in time for happy hour, which was great.  Liked the casual vib and decor.  They had heaters out in the Plato, but we chose to sit inside.    We will definitely return for another meal the next time we are in town.  There is nothing like this in Albuquerque!

wbdkvg2NMY25RSfDqa0m7Q.text: One of my new favorite places in the valley.  Absolutely the finest fish sandwich I've ever tasted.  I was millimeters away from ordering a second one, until I successfully resisted.    Go for the regular fries, not the pretentious sweet potato fries.  They may be good, but the original ones are better.  Besides, everyone does the sweet potato fries nowadays! The truly unique joints do the regular cut traditional french fry well.  Yum!  Our friends got some other entrees which looked just as fantastic.  Moderately priced with good scenery.  Not to mention great service (table of 6, waitress memorized our order without error), and we kept adding more people on and she couldn't have been happier.  Splitting checks was not painful at all.  Go here and get the fish sandwich, it is something to marvel.

7sJ7ZHHYu2N1X1Eq156mfQ.text: This is my new favorite place!  I have been 4 times now, and just simply love it. I mean I went on a Saturday and always myself there the very next day, its just addicting. Three out of the 4 times I've been I've sat at the bar, and the bartender, is great.  He's always got suggestions, tells what he likes, his fav's what he's had and hasn't had and why.  He's even got suggestions on the very cool all day (10:30-7pm) happy hour drinks on the Saturday/Sunday menu.  What a deal!!  The food I've had is outstanding.  One thing I'll never forget is the butterfish, that was melt in your mouth delicious!  The wasabi mashed potatoes was not what I thought they would be so at first I was disappointed.  I expected them to be spicy and creamy, but then I sat and thought about it again, and said wait, these are exactly what they should be, Mashed potatoes infused with wasabi, kind of like cucumber water.  I believe I just had the wrong idea to begin with.  The seaweed salad is a great starter, a huge portion and tastes like seaweed salad.  This was my pre-Brunch visit.  So this past weekend I tried the Brunch.  Saturday's visit was later in the day and I'm not much of a breakfast person, so I went with the Fish taco.  Another fish done well, perfectly done and seasoned.  Much to my surprise they give a little bit of what appears to be homemade salsa, that goes with it and is yummy, i found myself trying to figure out exactly what was in it so I could go home and duplicate.  My boyfriend had the pork taco's, and I really enjoyed the pork flavor.  I was expecting greenchilli ish type flavor, but it was very sweet barbequey.  The black beans and rice aren't anything special, but not gross either.  Then Sunday I tried the Ahi Eggs benedict.  I was so scared, as I said I'm not a huge breakfast fan.  It was awesome.  Very very good flavor.  It got cold real fast, but that's my experience with eggs..  Recommended Drinks: I think I've tried at least 2 other drinks from their menu, but I can't remember what they were called...but these are the ones that are normally at my table: Hurricane, Tiki Bastard if you like Gin, Blood Orange Martini, Mai Tai, and you must at least once try the Bloody Mary.  I believe they make their own mix, it's got a bunch of horseradish bits in it, and is very different.  Its definitely missing the worchestire, but was actually not bad with out it.  I agree it isn't for everyone, but I had two.

MHARP4mKWbVC3aHHBxNCuA.text: we had a coupon to try this place out for brunch. must have been a popular coupon because they were sold out of breakfast items and mimosa's.   the place is so cool and tiki-ish. i love the old tiki mugs. the brunch-lunch was not overwhelming and yet tasty. i had the fish taco's, she the tofu taco's. i thought mine were pretty good and loved the sweet potato fries (as usual). the rest of their meat and non-meat food looked also delicious and we hope to hit this place up again soon. since we had the coupon, we only paid 2 bucks!

0jo3jCzTYvl9M_pxYFIUGQ.text: Went here for Brunch this past Sunday and it was fantastic!  The restaurant is very open and airy and the food was great - We had the the Ahi Eggs Benedict and Habanero Lime Chicken Tacos and both were delicious.  $2 Mimosas were awesome and we also tried the Scorpion Bowl (which packs quite a punch).  Looking forward to dinner here soon!

9tk9nPqrWNCl89G2qF9cdw.text: I'm really happy that Hula's is within walking distance of my apartment.  This is because the tropical themed drinks pack a punch!  Me and my ladyfriend shared a "Scorpion Bowl" that was deceptively sweet.  We both stumbled home.    Make sure to eat plenty while drinking at Hula's - there is some excellent food to help keep one's blood alcohol level in check.  The last time I was there I had Duke's Lua plate, with slow pulled pork, cole slaw (which had a subtle wasabi flavor) and sticky rice which was amazing.  The fish is of high quality as well, though the blackened Ahi Tuna burger was a bit dry .  The burgers are excellent, with the Hula Burger being exceptional.  If you want to get drunk and pretend that you are in a tropical paradise - this is the place to go.

hp2kJVDWyCCvURp_HO4ICQ.text: Drink...don't eat.   The environment, with the light rail shooting by, is definately a great place to enjoy an adult beverage. Regrettably, the only thing cooler than the environment is the food...as in the serving temperature.  Speaking of cold - I have a natural tendency to dislike any non-ice cream item served with an ice scoop (like a grade school cafeteria - sides are scooped onto your plate).

wGqHYLZrBYNxSF4tvibFHg.text: Solid cocktails here and happy hour eats are quite tasty. I had the Mai Tai and the Orange Martini which were both fantastic. We had the shrimp rolls, pork tacos, and fries. The shrimps rolls were a "stop what you are doing and get you some" kind of dish... complete with air quotes if I saw you in person. They were phenomenal. I will be back... soon. Hold on to your butts.

NsveBO7NWU6--pZvsf5adw.text: The husband and I had driven by Hula's multiple times, saying it looked interesting but we were always on our way to another destination. We finally stopped in on their 3rd Anniversary and boy, are we glad we did. The wait for a table was probably 45 minutes, but the place was packed and in all consideration, it wasn't as long as other places we've been. Plus, we wanted to sit outside, since a band was going to be playing. (Who were awesome, btw.) Drinks were $3 all night, special anniversary prices, and we tried the Dr. Funk and the Painkiller. The Dr. Funk was delicious! The Painkiller is similar, but had cinnamon or another spice in it that I didn't care for.  I ordered the coconut shrimp egg rolls to get us started and they were fantastic! For dinner, I had the coconut encrusted butterfish and the husband had a pork plate. (Mine was delicious but the pork was just okay.) Our friends had steak tacos and a salad. The steak tacos looked so good, we had to come back a second time. The second time here, I had the steak tacos and the husband had the steak dinner. Mmmm, the steak tacos were totally worth it. (We also ordered the coconut shrimp rolls again - definitely a favorite.) For dessert, we got the brownie with macadamia nut ice cream. The brownie wasn't anything special but the ice cream was good. When we checked in on Yelp, we received $5 off our bill. This was a nice surprise! Totally check this place out - we'll definitely be back!

8jp52Z6m21TmUk89EM-egQ.text: The black bean veggie burger is probably the most heart un-healthy veggie burger i've ever had, but it was really good. it comes smothered in carmelized onions, sauteed mushrooms, cheese and is apparently cooked on a greasy griddle. i added avocado at my server's recommendation. avocado makes everything better.   i didn't order my own sweet potato fries, but scammed a few from a friend. the garlic aioli served with the fries was divine. i'll be back.

-mu9ZJRUXqlT42_eXtNrxQ.text: DEELLISH and EXCELLENT SERVICE!  I would even say this place has a view b/c you can sit inside/outside.  I bet this place would be great for a weekday happy hour.  I took my mom and sister there for brunch on Saturday and they loved everything.  I ordered the delicious french toast, mom ordered the polynesian chicken sandwich which was a really large well cooked chicken and my sis ordered the cajun burger which was only just ok.  But the sweet potato fries were great!

JFNiJKN2XVhEAQ8sWoPUVQ.text: We always have a great experience at Hula's. Can't wait to check out their home on 7th Street.

iAmlpdwgnxfnwqvKZ6_cMw.text: Great ambiance! A tucked away gem with great appetizers.  Overall  loved my experience.  Didn't  enjoy my overly sweet cocktail or the wine I switched to.  My salmon was way overcooked but so darn hungry at that point ate it and munched on my friends bowl which was very good.  Willing to try it again.

SPTl1AD6tI0glYP3UXX_bw.text: Great atmosphere and food. We had a very nice server who's name is Suong. I will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lovely ladies at Hulas

Rc9JIin6WBDMiWXL7LmnJQ.text: Ugh. Two days in a row of failure. The menu sounds incredible. Fresh. Fun. Tropical. Not heavy. Perfect for this hot weather... But alas the flavor burst I was expecting from the described flavors was not there. I ordered the macadamia crusted red snapper. Snake is a pretty mild fish, firm, and not too risky. Well. The macadamias were burned. The fish was suuuper fishy tasting. The coleslaw is perfect in texture and consistency, but literally tastes like nothing. And my rice, albeit good plain rice was actually the highlight of my meal. The mango salsa was mushy and not vibrant like it needed to be. The service was good. No empty cups waiting refills. Just nothing to get excited about and while I love the concept both mine and my husbands dishes were lacking. Fortunately, we have a dog so my 20 dollar fish wasn't wasted.

14R7L2sJ3r7ASziQA3fGHg.text: The hosts suck ! Have no common sense ! Owner or manager should learn how to train properly

rUAe7il08aEvC8e1qsvNyA.text: I was pretty decent. I expected a little more around the Tiki theme. The place is out of the way for me so I don't think I will be making the trip again but I'm glad I checked it out once.

aA-r1QRBdK0PrPlWwTufug.text: This place has a nice ambience. I went on a Friday evening, so it was pretty packed. There's an option to dine inside or outside. Since it's around 100 degrees right now, they have an outdoor misting system. Diners can also sit inside at the bar.   For appetizers, we ordered the Crispy Coconut Shrimp Rolls. It comes in 4 rolls for the price of $7, which is pricey for something that tastes just like eggrolls. My boyfriend had the Jerk Chicken Plate. Be prepared for a fairly generous portion of chicken. The jerk sauce was good, but became overwhelming. It was easier to finish the chicken by intermittently eating other items on the plate. My favorite was the fried sweet plantains. I ordered the Blackened Wasabi Fish Special. The fish did not taste fresh to me - it was just a satisfactory dish. Based on what I ordered, it was a little pricey for mediocre food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy Coconut Shrimp Rolls
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened Wasabi Fish
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jamaican Jerk Chicken

aZ3iplnWcs9dM3nt5wMRow.text: Trendy restaurant with Polynesian themed drinks and food. I tried a few bites of various dishes and had the hapu with lemongrass sauce. The hapu itself was tender, flaky, and perfectly cooked. Unfortunately the breading on it was charred in some areas, causing it to taste bitter. The breading was also very hard texture-wise, making it difficult to eat without giving your jaw a workout. The actual lemongrass sauce was broken when it arrived, creating an unappetizing mixture of runny liquid and coagulated yellow mass. The taste of the sauce, while initially pleasing on the first bite, became harder to eat after successive bites due to the sour flavor of it. The sides for the dish included some slightly undercooked rice and very generic, bland coleslaw.  I also tried some mahi-mahi, which also came with the same rock hard breading, and a similarly sour sauce. The actual fish was delicious though and we peeled apart the breading and pushed aside the sauce to savor the pure taste of the fish.  I also tried some ceviche, which had way too much lime juice in it, overpowering the whole dish.   The one True highlight of the meal was trying some of the jerk chicken. It was tender, with bold, spicy flavors.   Service was good for a busy Saturday night. Drinks were refilled as needed.  Overall, the fish dishes need more simplicity in their preparation for the True taste of the fresh, good quality fish gets muddled when it is breaded and doused in a powerfully flavored sauce. While the atmosphere is great, if you dine here just be careful of what to get since the dishes tend to be hit and miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jerk chicken
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hapu with lemongrass sauce

03Owo8mce0c2GDrIAGvFnw.text: This place is great! Awesome staff amazing food and a very hip place. Menu is terrific ceviche is the best and the mai tais are fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceviche and may tai

oPq0MeC7MUZDPx1khEr7BQ.text: The food was delicious, drinks great price and most of all, great service. Will return here when I return to Phoneix.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Painkiller, soooooo good

0JsGLU_n3x4wxvtEE-ZlqQ.text: I was there Monday.  My partner and I sat at the bar. The bartender was slow understandably so because of a busy happy hour.  We waited for a long time for our check that my partner told me he'll be in the car so she can get a hint.  Nothing happened.  I went to the restroom to give her a hint nothing happened and my credit was still there.  So I went to the hostess and asked if there's a manager so I can pay.  The hostess took my card to process me all the while the manager heard me complain right behind me and just ignored me and took off the other direction.  That was really unprofessional.   I work in a fine dining restaurant and never saw that level of unprofessionalism before.  I won't be coming back.  My partner is a police capt and will be spreading this experience as I will in the restaurant industry.

1tAqn7OTrW7Zsc0dpcpwuA.text: All day happy hour on Wednesday with the whole drink menu and some of the food at happy hour prices.   The fries, coconut shrimp spring rolls, vegan jungle curry, dr.funk, and the blood orange martini on the rocks are all really good!   It's a nice place to be able to be able to hang out with a small group and catch up over cocktails. Everyone loved their drinks and food. The service was great.

66wR_YVB1gHbi5M_ePV_nA.text: My husband and I come here alot. I love having this place in the neighborhood because we're new to Phoenix and were fans of a particular tiki bar in Chicago. So to find a place like this nearby was pretty exciting. It's not like our Chicago place, but I love that Hula's has food.  We tend to come on Friday afternoons for happy hour, really can't beat the prices for tiki drinks, apps and a chill atmosphere. The employees are always nice and I've never had a bad time.  My favorite drinks are the Painkiller and the Dr Funk. I usually get one of each and leave happy and ready to start my weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_JkRBfuFp_nBHLGa0DOYDw.text: I was recommended this place I surprised my bestie with a date night as he is very picky also that he is Jamaican and to my surprise the food was on point service was quick and nice.. One of my new favorite spot as ill be moving closer to dental in a couple of months!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vGN8XXlmfvlAhu9AYCaByw.text: If you're unsure about your feelings of seafood, Hula's will change your life. It wasn't until I tried the Ahi Tacos that I decided fish are friends AND food. All their tacos  are one of a kind but my fave dish is their Bean Burger with regular fries and a side of Cajun aioli. Dang I'm hungry now. Also, the service is A1.

_qHolma1zCkHtaWo2ZfWxg.text: New Hula's is just as awesome as the original! Different location but same great tiki energy, amazing staff, excellent food and drinks! Congratulations to Dana and team for creating a new uptown icon!

czHgAhzxhINDb6oLxygnmg.text: First time here and WOW, everything was delicious and the service awesome too.  I had the crispy chicken tacos, side of cole slaw, side of beans and rice and the amazing key lime pie!!  I'll be back for sure.

8W4utEm_Nz3bdFS9StPXcg.text: This was my first time here. What a great experience. I felt like I was on vacation somewhere in the islands.  Great atmosphere, food and service.  You could tell the people that worked there, liked being there.   I wanted a sample of a few items so i ordered the plantain, Johnny cakes and fish bites. Oh, and I had a mai tai that was amazing (strong and not for the faint of heart).   The prices are very reasonable and the portions and large.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio dining with misters on so it felt really nice though it was a warmer day.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their signature Mai Tai. You won&#39;t need more than one ;-). It&#39;s strong!

f_ZHj6KzgSW2Un1eSEzyyw.text: I went to this restaurant for happy hour after it was so highly recommended.  My cousin was celebrating her birthday.  It was a nice day out and we sat in the patio. There was a couple at the next table it was a high top bar. They had their dog in hand which was no big deal. I began eating and the dog was dropping poop in a napkin. From the arms of the owner which was 3ft up  into a napkin on the floor.  It was disgusting.  I spoke to the manager Ronnie and he said the restaurant is dog friendly, which I don't mind but it is a human restaurant where people are eating. He didn't refund me or offer me any compensation which was very rude and inappropriate.    I will never go to this place again! I will advise my friends never to return. EVER!

XtAAQ8ZQ2R11tw_FYNMA7Q.text: So after my ridiculously horrid service at Snooze, I came here.   They are always a reliable go to.  I love that they actually listen to your order.  I like my hash browns super crispy and this place makes the BEST ONES!  I have never been disappointed by the food here.  The eggs have a wonderful fluffy, buttery texture - everything is delicious.   I used to go to this place when it was over on Central but now it's even closer to me, yay!  The service has always been outstanding and they also make great tacos.  I usually get a mixture and they never disappoint.  Their cocktails are really good too.  10 yums up!

dEUhne03i26K9fdPDIShlQ.text: This is not your typical Tiki Bar.  It's a Tiki Bar within a restaurant.  The food here is the highlight, the drinks were all good, but not as good as the food.  The decor inside isn't what I'd consider Tiki, but as it says in the name it Modern Tiki.    The staff were all very helpful and friendly, food service and quality was top notch.  The menu is vast with a good variety, everything we ordered was very good.   The only "concern" I had was seeing some of the typical restaurant bar mixers being carried out.  To me Tiki drinks mean fresh fruit and juices.  I was careful to order drinks that wouldn't have used those cheap premixed sugar syrups.

yR_jYck1IA6GX_CqhcbISA.text: Hula continues the same menu of both food and drinks at this new location as the old. Not a typical tiki bar, but has the classic carribean drinks.   We had the painkiller with a rum float and this is my favorite here. My wife likes the blood orange martini. The zombie is a good drink too.  For food, we had the beef sticks, chicken sticks and coconut shrimp. Wings on the table next to us looked good. The beef was little chewy, chicken was on the sweeter side. Coconut shrimp was good, as expected. The curry dipping sauce is right on   Ambiance: 3.5 Food: 3.5 Drinks: 4 Service: 4

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RwvgGLzeXGl6geH96uq2Qw.text: This is an update to my rating a couple or so years ago.   Since that review, they have moved to a new location and probably changed managers.  I've been to their new locations a few times for happy hour, and always enjoy their cute drinks and appetizers.  We sat at the bar.   I had the blood orange martini, which I've had a few times in the past.  My friend saw someone across the bar having a drink in a martini glass, and went over to taste it.   She liked it and decided to order it herself.  Since I tend to like drinks that are not too sweet, she said she'd have me try hers, and if I liked it, I could order it for myself.   It is a new drink they are trying out, not quite on the menu.   I think it was called a saturn or something like that.  David was our initial bartender.  He made my blood orange martini a tad bit tooooo tart.   I asked for something to lessen the tartness, and the other bartender -- sorry.  I didn't get her name -- went ahead and made a new one.   Much, much better!!  I tried my friend's drink, and we both agreed it was delicious!   In fact, we proceeded to have a few before the night was out.   That drink is very good; no taste of alcohol at all, which could be dangerous.  We ordered from the happy hour menu the coconut shrimp rolls, fried calamari, spicy edamame, the pork tacos.   My favorite was the shrimp rolls.   YUMMM!  The calamari was kind of weird in appearance and shape.   I have to remember not to order that again.   The tacos weren't bad.   I just ate the topping and skipped the corn tortilla.   The edamame was good as well, but I was soooo full!!  Every single person working behind the bar is professional, friendly, and helpful.  I will need to get the name of the other bartender as well as the man who bears a striking resemblance to Pharrell.   He probably gets that a lot.   Till next time.   I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. spicy edamame
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pork taco
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. happy hour fried calamari

ch7vqXJasBDrSjph2Cc0WA.text: Had the steak sandwitch tonight.. Been here lots of time's and just wanted to try something different. So far everything we have ordered has been good.  We had the steak sandwitch tonight and was great. Made with tenderloin and a spicy sauce.... It's nice to have a place to go to that stays open late and serves good food.  One star off for having the AC way too cold.

bJKnIjsTjKZcWnaFDqm67A.text: This place had a really cute vibe. I have been wanting to try out Hulas for a long time. We were a little early for dinner and were promptly seated in a booth for two. They have a tropical cocktail menu with choices that you would want to find at a modern tiki bar. Our server was pretty efficient and we ordered quickly.  I went with the Baja fish tacos and my girlfriend ordered the chicken sticks and a side of Mac n cheese. The tacos were pretty awesome and came with a side of rice and beans. Good sized portions and tasty flavor. The chicken sticks were pretty good and the Mac n cheese was okay. There are many other options on the menu that I would like to return and try.   The bathrooms were clean and cute, matching the vibe.   Overall it was a fun atmosphere, good food and promising drinks. We enjoyed our meal and I would return!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Surf Rider Chicken Sticks and mac n cheese
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baja Fish Tacos

SNa48aFet-dC9AHqGO1_QQ.text: After rekindling my patronage of Hula's, I've fully bought into the hype! This restaurant is stylish, modern, and most importantly as laid back as the big island. Sit at the bar. Or the patio. Or the cozy little room in the back. It's all adorned with a modest Tiki decor that sets the mood but isn't overbearing or tacky.   After your first visit, you'll dream of rushing in with your colleagues after a busy day at work. Hula's Happy Hour, which famously runs all night long on Wednesdays, features small bites and fun rum-based cocktails. The Hawaiian Ceviche is a welcome twist on a Mexican fave. With its marinated, raw fish served over a generous plate of wonton chips, you'll order one to share, and another to keep to yourself! If you're a vegetarian, get the tofu tacos! But even at your hungriest, you may want to save room for the wings, grilled chicken skewers (and delectable Thai peanut sauce!), or the cocktails you won't be able to get enough of.   At just six or seven bucks a pop during HH, their cocktails are simple but refreshing classics. The Painkiller is a must-have. The One-Eyed Pyrat, featuring rum and ginger beer, comes in a comical ceramic pirate cup. It is incredibly on brand, always. Don't be afraid to venture to other parts of the menu, however, as there's lots of other fun to be had! If you don't have anywhere to be, and you're not driving, split a Scorpion Bowl with your friend. It's a formidably-sized punch bowl with a flaming shot of 151 in the middle. You're going to feel this one, and you're going to have fun.   If you want something heavier, the entrees are fantastic. There is a plethora of seafood for the picking, but what I can't stray away from lately is the pulled pork sandwich. It is seriously my favorite pulled pork I have had anywhere, ever. It's got a soy glaze, and is a little sweet, but packed with flavor nonetheless. Whatever you order, just know it's going to stay True to the Polynesian motif--expect fruity flavors and lots of spices.   Overall, Hula's is your daytime chill spot. It's your date night. It's your business lunch, and your Saturday night out. Take a bit, take a sip, and you just might forget you're in the middle of the desert.

Der2gcBVJE_jgljl5AH2lw.text: I live close by and a lot of my friends have been and I finally ventured myself on over to check it out! What a cute, little hide away! It was busy, but not loud, which I liked, and I truly enjoyed my whole experience here. The staff was friendly and we were seated quickly! My friend and I ordered a cocktail and we each got a bowl (if you're hungry, get it, if you want something light reconsider, it was a lovely and generous portion of amazingness!).  The decor literally takes you to a far off island, and you feel like you're on vacation. The cocktails were beautifully crafted and the food fresh (wasabi mashed potatoes anyone!?)

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner and drinks!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi bowl!

oCZtDCzjIjdWhe_tIx7Q0Q.text: To be honest, I didn't care for the prior iteration of this restaurant/bar. But this new location and reboot has changed my opinion. Hula's Modern Tiki is no longer a pick up joint (that smells like last nights sour alcohol and vomit - as the Central Avenue location had distinguished itself).  This new establishment is for adults who like decent food in a lively atmosphere.  Again, I didn't care for the menu at the old Hula's, but this menu is much improved, has a wide variety And is interesting and eclectic. Check it out for yourself. On the menu you'll find: tropical and Caribbean bowls, Mexican tacos, and good old American dinner plates.  They're so cool here even let our family bring in a big cake for someone's birthday And they were kind enough to provide plates and silverware.  The decor is a little bit Polynesian and a lot more modern throwback to mid century but more modern than anything.  We were honored to sit underneath the velvet painting of Elvis, which was not lost on us.  We'd come back here but, perhaps not frequently but we'd come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EsW5-fbR20ICn-1XwCnw7g.text: Really cute Tiki bar if you are lucky enough to sit in the Tiki room! Lucky for us we were! I wish they had done the whole restaurant in the theme. Be sure to check out the bathroom doors! They are adorable. Valet parking is free but be sure to tip!  Happy hour till 6pm. My drink was great in the tiki cup. Sliders of pork were good. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The sliders, I think they are pork. So good!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of their fantastic drinks!

kOyMnP1Womdsg7Xe_Rn_hg.text: This place is so good! They have a great happy hour and I highly recommend EVERYTHING on their happy hour menu. We were seated right away even during a busy Friday evening and it was as if the food had came out within just a few short minutes. Food was hot and fresh and was so yummy. Service was great as well. Sad to see that they left their old super unique building over on central, but it is the same great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Appetizers

r_ON3oQ8J0sY-MIz2UpTww.text: I had the fish tacos and husband had the Loco Moco.  They were both good.  I spent a while looking at photos on Yelp to get an idea of what I wanted (love those photos) :).  The drinks were quite good - very tropical with a modern twist.  My husband loves the sweet drinks - I'm more about a good martini.  But the food was good, plentiful, very Hawaiian, the atmosphere is nice, and the prices were very reasonable too! We will definitely go back.

1VkBEjWRQxwS2Yv90PIPDQ.text: My spot for that moco loco craving! They're good any time but I especially love coming for brunch & getting a cup of coffee with my meal. The food is always delicious & service is good!

QwyAvmujCok5mZJiJ_zAVw.text: Hula's is the best brunch spot! Me and friends love it! They have $2 mimosas on the weekend. The staff is really nice, and the environment is fun tiki style! I love their seaweed salad and their tofu jungle bowl. Fun place to check out if you haven't! They also have a little hidden bar next door.

liKsdmFxaXQmcavvRCKXJg.text: Definitely my new favorite weekend spot! Stopped in on Sunday for some drinks and ended up having a really good time! We had some double mimosas and a painkiller and split the Mongolian beef bowl. It was all sooooooo good! The bartenders were awesome and we definitely want to get back there ASAP! Really good weekend specials and the mimosas were just how I like em...mostly champagne. Great experience!

Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mimosas!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Painkiller

J4EdYLEDbYic8LoAVts8bQ.text: Hula's is a fun tiki bar with great service, delicious food, strong drinks and absolutely no cheesy tiki decor. The happy hour drink menu has a ton of choices and the prices are very reasonable. I had the burger my during last visit but this time I shared a Mongolian beef bowl with my bf. (Yes, the picture is only half of the bowl!) Portion size, temperature and meat tenderness was all on point.   We sat at the bar and received friendly service the entire time. I love the atmosphere here. Great spot for a boozy brunch!

Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jk9X4dSMS13y1l8JtAQyyQ.text: I have been wanting to try this place for awhile. We went on a Tuesday night and it was surprisingly packed. The parking situation here is a little rough which is always a bummer to me. They have daily specials, on Tuesday you get two drinks and two appetizers for $25 which is a great deal! We took advantage of this deal. For the apps we got the wings which were alright and the shrimp rolls which were amazing. I ordered to kalbi which came with rice and Mac salad. Everything was delicious and the portion was large! Besides the great food the decor was very cozy and chic. The bathrooms were clean. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fruity drinks make Tuesday&#39;s better
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kalbi

eOTdt2RaxSBn1Xb1Obqm1Q.text: Good vibes, good food, and good drinks. The happy hour drink prices all afternoon on Saturday doesn't hurt either. Definitely recommend the burgers to go with your drinks. The fries are well made and crispy, just the way I like it! The parking can be a little difficult and you can easily pass the restaurant as you're driving... so be on the lookout!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i_q1S6HximNpuLDURGZHoA.text: Wow this place is awesome! The drinks are yummy especially if you like rum drinks; they are not too sweet and well balanced. The food is also really good with huge portions! Our bartender, Sherice (sorry if I misspelled your name) was really great and even though at times the bar seemed very busy and our bartender may not have had time for us, it was really easy to grab her attention if we did need anything. All in all can't wait to do again. Sherice is the bomb.com!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mai Tai &amp; blue Martini (not sure actual name)

cre2DGeKVU7bw5pQQWsa1w.text: Went in on a weekday for lunch. There were 3 of us and we each had Ahi prepared in a different way (bowl, tacos, and salad). Food was really good and fresh. Drinks were a little pricey but the Dr. Funk was really good

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thirsty...Tuesday? Dr. Funk!!!

vFgcR09D96ns3n72-heBRQ.text: If you've been to that OTHER tiki bar, Hula's is a lot different but in a good way in my opinion! First of all, there's elbow room. Second, the prices are MUCH more reasonable. Third, they offer a good selection of food. All of it was delicious.   If the restaurant side is too crowded, consider going to the bar. You won't be disappointed!  We came here for drinks & apps. We ordered spicy edamame and samurai beef sticks. Both were delicious. The beef sticks were tender and flavorful, and a generous size. Served like a kabob with bits of peppers and pineapple, it hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drink menu

_B7Z61BZstpQSTVjhqCLhQ.text: Looking for a dtphx spot for lunch? Do not pass this place up! Great break outta the mold! This place has a laid back atmosphere, great prices on happy hour, and some of the most delicious island style grub I've found anywhere. Shoot, I've been to a number of restaurants in Hawaii that can't match Hula's teriyaki chicken sammich! The sweet potato fries too.. mmm. If you're a Phoenix native, a college student, or just passing thru, this shop is a must-eat!

_buumG_W4n5532iEQ3uIhw.text: I came here once for a work event and after a few hours my boss said he had to leave before I "drank everything on the menu." I always have fun when I come to Hula's and I love their cocktails.
