L_BD_g7cFub_ZYbR42N2nQ.text: Third time's still a charm!  This time I got the Luau pork sandwich which is sweet, shredded pork on a bun with coleslaw. I'm usually not a fan of slaws but this one was not too sweet and really complimented the pork. And, as before, the sweet potato fries were awesome with Hula's dressing dip.  Super friendly server on the patio, too. Also used Yelp to get $5 off when I checked in - so without a drink, it was just over $6! Awesome deal. I'll finally give it that 5th star for service, taste, environment and prices.

maAQf9HNspePWO240R6-aw.text: I really didn't want to like this place because with it walking distance from my apartment I was worried I would spend my whole paycheck there each week. driving by the HUGE window, and great lighting caught my attention right away. Living in Arizona I am always looking for a great new patio spot. Hulas is one of my favorite on Central, the noise of the train and the light foot traffic makes for fun people watching and the gas fire pit in the middle gives it a great feel. Being a big fan of Sweet Potato fries I naturally ordered a basket while waiting for my burger, which comes without a side. which was OK because my friend and I just split the fries anyway. they are great, he is not a big fan of aoili, me on the other hand loved the ginger aoili dipping sauce it came with.   I have been back to Hulas a few times and have found that ALL the appetizers are enjoyable and when purchased in a group of 4 it makes for a great place to get your night started. A scorpion or Volcano Bowl never hurts either for that "pregame" buzzzzz. the appetizers seem to all compliment each other perfectly.  my favorite thing to get here is the Pork sandwich....  it is a great blend of sweet and savory and the slaw adds the perfect cruch to it. I will for sure be back, not just because it is so close, but the patio.... I cant get over this patio!!!

mRj9GHkPp9OspeBOPgsDZw.text: Mai-Tai was great Max was awesome Kool modern tiki bar

3RMG9WoVYEGEryez3eVExg.text: Brunch! Scorpion Bowl! MIMOSAS.  Service has always been stellar, and you can't go wrong with any of their cocktails!

j-ekSNa8xwzOO_f87XVwlg.text: I was looking for good late night food and found this amazing place! Great cevivhe, tacos, authentic Hawaiian food til midnight. I'm prescatarian and this is great fish. Yum!!

ka8QpDGvYQdySyKeeo4_Iw.text: Outside of Hawaii, they make the best Mai Tai's ever. We had 4 each and after that I don't remember much at all.

NQJk6iOrx2YpykwFl55TtA.text: I was out in Phoenix for a conference and came here for a happy hour. It's a cute little restaurant with great outdoor seating around a firepit with plenty of heaters around. They even had old episodes of Gilligan's Island playing at the bar.   The drinks are good, and the appetizers are fantastic. I'd recommend the ceviche, the sweet potato fries, and the crab cakes. The waitress was very friendly and felt comfortable joking around with us.   Great location too, it's just right off of the Light Rail, so if you're staying at a hotel by the airport like I was it's very easy to get back from.

WrMyior7Q20AfygEHlrEvw.text: Excellent Happy Hour!!! We had the chicken skewers, pork potstickers, coconut shrimp, pork taco, and house salad. Everything was incredibly tasty and well priced. Our bartender Matt handled a full bar and restaurant like a champion and provided us with excellent service. We will definitely be back, thank you for a great date night!!!

9Pm_Tha1iwWpqG8N04Tuyg.text: I had not been to Hula's in a very long time so when some friends wanted to meet for happy hour last night I suggested we go.  How can you beat fun cocktails and all day happy hour?  We each had one drink and apps.  I had the Painkiller, my friends had a glass of wine and the Mai Tai.  For the apps we each had a pork taco, and shared the crispy coconut shrimp rolls, and hawaiian ceviche.  Service was good, we enjoyed our food and drink and went on our way.  That brings me to 1:00 am.  I woke up with the most aggressive intestinal pain I have ever experienced.  To go along with the pain I also had hot and cold flashes followed by sweats.  This morning I texted my friends to see if they had the same experience.  Both said they woke up this morning nauseous.  Was it the food or my drink, (my friends each had a sip)?  Either way, we will NOT be returning.

43RE3rsDCcaMLkb6-XqdEw.text: My how time flies.  I remember all the buzz when this building was being remodeled.  Now almost a year and a half after it opened, and a bunch of reviews, I finally had the opportunity to dine here.  I was amongst a Smunch group that met for brunch on a Saturday.    I love the space. A combination of indoor, outdoor and part of both.    The service for our party of about 20 was really great.  Our group consisted of folks from 1 to over 60 and all our needs were well attended to.  Their brunch menu consists of items from their regular corporate menu and some special items designed locally.  I chose the Island Eggs Benedict and enjoyed it and the hash browns it came with.  I ordered the decaf and it is the first decaf I have had in a long time that tasted like a real cup of coffee!  At least at our table I heard no big complaints about the food.  A couple of things that kept my rating at 3.5 instead of 4:  Parking sucks, this is more important to those like myself not used to uptown/downtown venues. One of my poached eggs was hard cooked in the middle.  I would certainly not complain about going here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Island eggs Benedict w/Spam

bciyg4c8rXOCTq3LhZB3Qw.text: My friends and I decided to celebrate my birthday at Hula's a few nights ago and we had a fantastic time. It was on a Wednesday night, so they happened to have an all night happy hour on that day. We surely lucked out, so we enjoyed  $5 appetizers and discounted beverages all night.  I love the spicy edename, but I didn't really care for the black bean burger. My friends also ordered food which they deemed satisfactory. I can't decide if it's overpriced or not though. I could barely finish my burger and mash (that doesn't happen very often),but paying $7 to $8 for your signature drinks seems kinda steep. Happy Hour is definitely the time to come here in order to get the discounted price.   I do love the delightful modern kitschy decor and the friendly atmosphere. I'd definitely come back here again and give them another try. Perhaps meet up with friends on a weekend to enjoy a brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My buddies
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Pain Killer

FTC0PPp5uIeR_fm9zJtfGA.text: Love, love, love the fish bites! Oh, the Mai Tai's! I love this place. Outside is nice in good weather. The pulled pork benedict is delicious. I'll be back.

qKWKsSDdGwIlOokZjI0GzQ.text: This place is awesome.  Super comfortable for locals. Definitely drop in if you get a chance!

PHA_wUwmSK9XJtO6JXcYrA.text: Matt once drank 5 Amstel Lights and told me a story that really didn't have a climax. I'll never forget that Tuesday, such a beautiful Valentine's Day!

rF_1-Mr5mG2taC-n8amvCw.text: Nice place, bar is open, cool and has a really cool vibe to it. It was a great way to spend the afternoon working on my stuff while having a little lunch & a beer at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Poke and a Kona Longboard draft beer, really good together. Oh and WOW! The Poke was Amazing! I should of ordered two!!

JRVgG1_oADJvsLrpfFFvDQ.text: Service was only ok. We waited for drinks and to order. And it wasn't even a busy night.  Food was good but we were over charged. (They said they would honor the Yelp check-in discount and then failed to do so - even after I reminded them.)  With so many fresh, hip places to eat in the area - you would think they would try to woo folks more. Perhaps it was simply a bad night. Unfortunately I'll never know.

MF318KQLgeY0BBtQLlNKmw.text: I want to LOVE this place as much as my colleagues do.. The place is just okay for me. For starters, we've tried the lobster bisque, calamari, fish cakes, ceviche (a favorite), and the ahi wontons (another favorite). For the main entree, which is where the needle continued to point a neutral to below neutral, was the "jerk" chicken and the one of the fishes with the jamaican jerk sauce. Welp.. I've never had shredded, marinated of sorts, jerk chicken.. the outcome was unfortunate. The fish was better than the chicken, but still left me hoping for something.  I'd go back for starters or even exploring their pretty cool happy hour specials, but not in a hurry for a seated dinner.  Recommendation: Always make a reservation if you can. Also note, they do not take same day reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HAuK-wsopE3YRFC4SNaVvg.text: Excellent Happy Hour! Food and drinks were great. Open air! Bartenders were really nice, fun. Seemed to like their jobs-a rarity these days!

BvrGDM-SI7F5p3P_v8MkHA.text: I like this place a lot. A modern Trader Vics. I would give Hula's a 5 star if parking was a bit easier and there was a misting system on the patio. That being said, everything else was awesome. It has a very cool vibe inside. The layout of the tables and the patio works. We were there kind of early on a Saturday night, around 6. There were plenty of open tables on the patio (because it's Arizona, June, 6pm, HOT) but since we were meeting a large group later we found a couple of seats at the bar. I did notice the dining room was full. Our group was going to be there around 7, so we had an hour to kill. After we were seated at the bar, our We first sat at the bar and had some appetizers and drinks. The food was all incredible and the drinks were quite tasty. Around 7:30 we decided to join our group so we moved out to the patio. There were 15 of us in all on the patio and we were never left wanting. Our server kept our water glasses filled as well as our drinks. As I said, the only thing I wish they had was a misting system or some way to cool off the patio. It was a bit sticky out there. Arizonan's, we get it. This is my new favorite down town spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Taco &amp; a Painkiller
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Thai Fish Cakes
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hawaiian Ceviche

Je1dcJrcjYbHBZdsP7qQPw.text: Fantastic food and drinks and very "gluten free friendly" for those of us that must avoid it. If possible, definitely try to hit up the happy hour; it REALLY helps when the tab comes around!

ed_9MKDOO1vA5AUaeUVRdA.text: Great ambiance! Yummy food! Very convenient on central just south of camelback.  Love the ceviche. This place has great Polynesian food. The happy hour is the very best with appetizers snd specialty drinks for 5 dollars each.  Wednesday is best night togo as its all night happy hour.

0I8ZTGfsPf6vt35x5VCeIA.text: Came here on a date. It was casual enough to not feel the pressure of having to dress up but nice enough for a first date. Food was great! Definitely will be coming back

EXlD6wL2U-9SCJ2fK4Ruqg.text: So since my very first experience here a while back I am going to update my opinion. It still does not get the coveted 5 star award but it gets a 3.5 now.. not so much a 4 just yet. But it is growing on me. I enjoy their happy hour and I have now tried most all of their signature cocktails. I must say, i am quite happy with what they have to offer. Also, it is pretty interesting and curious that they carry every single Absolut flavor. there are so many more than I knew even existed to be perfectly honest. But then again, a lot of their drinks are fruity so you need the different flavors to diversify your cocktail list. i get it.  As for the food, I tried the shrimp things again and this time they were delicious. I have also since tried their tacos, ceviche and a few others that are not necessarily note worthy but still tasty none the less. I do appreciate the company I keep every time I come here, whether it be friend, colleague or date. The bartenders are also decent conversationalists so thanks to you above average intelligent bartenders. Kudos to you! :)  I will keep coming here on and off so you have nothing to worry about... you most likely made me a lifer!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coolest light fixture!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yjwy8hUicbGqHzCKFzLvvA.text: So let me start by saying we are from LA and we are moving down here. Keith was our server and he was absolutely amazing. He made our first visit so pleasant. The food here was great. The drinks are tasty. We will be returning and when we do it will be with our family. Thanks so much Keith.

ny-s1rrp58EO_6ztNt-I-w.text: Visited Hula's for the first time today. Had no real expectations, but was pleasantly surprised by the quality of service, the ambiance, the menu, and the portion sizes.  The interior is very mid-century modern, which I love, and the service was outstanding. Everything was clean and dishes were removed from the table almost as quickly as I could clear them.  Ordered the Potstickers (which were delicious!!) and the Mongolian Beef Bowl, which was yummy. Nothing to write home about, but good enough that I intend to go back and explore more of the menu.  They've got a fun list of cocktails, too, if you're into that sort of thing. I'd recommend this place for sure, and I do plan to visit again in the near future.

k7L3y8jKHZH8v_uV2n4sfw.text: Great ambiance. Ahi Tuna appetizer was fresh and wontons crispy.   Had the pork sandwich. Cole slaw was delicious and the meat was even better! I had the macaroni salad as the aide, a bit too bland for my taste.   Friendly service.

1rt881wHkdjzcAgX1UPsNw.text: Great food, great drinks, great bartender, cute place....what more could you ask for?  Went on a Saturday around 4 and they had happy hour for drinks only.  I had the Zombie, which was great!  It was very tropical and pineapply tasting and very large.  Not like a typical cocktail where you take 4 sips and all that's left is ice.  It lasted me forever!  I ordered the South Seas Fish Tacos and they were amazing!  The fish was perfectly seasoned and cooked up tender and juicy.  The rice and beans were super yummy too.  My only complaint is there could have been more beans on top of the rice.  The BF had the Crispy Spicy Chicken Tacos and loved them too!  Their margarita was great too, which I had for dessert.  :-)  Can't wait to go back and try something else.

J6dhSVd2IcniGqTrX6m1QQ.text: Great place to eat at when the weather is nice outside.... Great open air relaxed atmosphere

KpmQnd8bmZtZA23aBTVjJg.text: I just disovered Hula's a few weeks ago.  The fish tacos were the absolute best that I've ever had.  I've been back twice and ordered double portions because they are so delicious.  The service was impeccable.  This restaurant is indeed "as good as it gets."

sV-guR-gA28oXYkyTLuYsQ.text: We decided to try Hula's one Sunday afternoon after having a horrible experience waiting over a half an hour for a table at a near empty Oregano's.  I'm glad we ditched Oregano's with their lousy service for the accommodating staff at Hula's, as it has now become a regular hangout for us.    The atmosphere is modern and very relaxing.  Can be a great place for drinks or dinner.  Nicely situated along the light rail and across the street from a large cathedral, it's probably one of the few restaurant patios in Phoenix that offers more than just a view of exhaust fumes from passing cars.  Love the gas fire pit in the center of the patio.  A lot of great options on the menu, especially the seafood centered appetizers.  My personal favorites are the pork tacos and the Teriyaki New York Strip.  Their tropical drink menu may be their real highlight and seems to attract a lot of local hipsters.  I always stick with their Mai Tai, which isn't overly sweet and packs a good punch.  The owner seems to care a lot about his restaurant and is very welcoming to his customer's.  It's nice to go to a place where you're recognized and appreciated as a regular.

ZCa-Nh-qlDfKT1YVqP-EvA.text: Saturday & Sunday all day (11ish-7) funday?? What could be better? Well on this past Sunday nothing! Went for a friend's birthday celebration...was my first time going Tiki and I have to say the sweet potato fries and Hawaii 5-0 were a perfect addition to an already awesome day...Let's just say I am ready to Tiki it up again!

MaLcJ6wPzmvELTCrh8M26w.text: This place is just really adorable.  It has a tiki-theme and they have indoor and outdoor seating just about year round.  When it is a bit chilly there are heaters on the patio and an open firepit.  It's kind of a trendy little spot, and very popular.  I have had really great service all but one time I was there (everyone has an off night).  I love spicy food and the edamame is something I always get here, but they are not for everyone - apparently non-New Mexico natives find it too hot.  Whatever, wimps.  I am addicted to the fish tacos, and a friend of mind swears by the pork tacos.  You can get a couple of good drinks and a decent dinner here for $25 bucks easily, especially if you get there during happy hour.  There are even some semi-healthy options, although that is not their strong suit - with jerk pork you have to pay in calories for what you get in yumminess.  They have another location in Monterey and it is divier and beachier, but the same great food.  Go!  Eat!

LwYAYohaLqn8xkiZhq0PQw.text: I ate here two years ago and loved it. The service is terrible. We were billed for things we didn't order. The chicken tacos were good...if ordered at Baja Fresh. The kitchen ran out of desert 5 hours before closing on a Saturday. Do not go for anything other than happy hour.

NBdrENnBaRinLS4VRV9Asw.text: My husband and I have collected tikis for years. When we moved to Phoenix and found this place we knew we were in for a treat. It is now our favorite restaurant! I love that they have vegetarian options. Spicy Tofu Tacos and a Mai Tai, yum!

BEU7Tx4hVnV8RGiTSyaBSg.text: This was a great place. The food was great and the drinks. I liked the outdoor seating next to the fireplace.

JnTe_WFUt8II_H1IcWQGQQ.text: I can not say enough about this fabolus spot! From the patio, to the long board bar (and the long board on tap!) I've been several times, and every person ive brought, or come with, loves it. Great date spot, great pre funk bar, or after hours wind down location. Everything on the menu is bomb! From the Shrimp spring rolls, the ahi tuna, the fries (sweet potato or regualr) the hula burger.... OMG... im craving Hula now! thank's yelp, for making me think of this moth watering spot!

X-o0Khy1I9HvYgtB3ftdwg.text: Great food and great cocktails. Be careful on how many of the cocktails you have.. they may be fruity but they do pack a punch! (no pun intended)

eEjl_TpH2F3ozzlwjiyUrA.text: If you are looking for great atmosphere and really good food with unexpected flavors this is the place for you. The ahi burger rocks!

OT-cSSMsKb8Q4sTGD7eBFA.text: This place could be 5 stars if it changed a few things.  The menu is ok and my food came out tasteing pretty good.  The ambiance is awsome.  Love the indoor out door set up.  You can even bring your dog onto the patio.  The bartenders all seem really pretentious.  The owner should send them over to Ve Bene in Ahwatukee to see how a good bartender interacts with their patrons. They don't offer any drink specials at night and drinking there can get pricey.  I guess that's why they are always pretty slow when I drive by.  Maybe they think they are keeping out the riff raff. ;o)

2I81fHeqajISX4_s_M4eKQ.text: Tiki Time! I highly recommend Hula's. The patio is fantastic with a firepit right in the middle. Happy hour (Tiki Time) features most of their drinks for only $5. The food was fabulous as well. Very casual environment, and great place to spend an afternoon on the patio.

1q4Ppv2_WSjFYR0yJklX2g.text: I have been here quite a few times and it is either a hit or miss. Happy hour is about the only reason I would go here anymore. Fish cakes and pork tacos are delicious. But I have had more things that I have been disappointed in with this restaurant. Also, their service is hit or miss; I have had some of the worst service of my entire life at this restaurant.

MUFq_BraUrIShCqnVIKloQ.text: Hula's Modern Tiki is awesome! We went there for brunch on Sunday morning and we have zero complaints. Lets start with the all day happy hour on Saturday and Sunday.... who can be disappointed with $2.00 mimosas? They were in a small flute which went down quite quick and easy, then we went for the house made bloody mary - simply delicious!! The food was great... ahi eggs benedict & the hula hangover was what we finally decided on, but can't wait to go back to try the next thing on the menu! We were also excited to see it was on the metro-lightrail route. The architecture was cool and it was a beautiful day to sit out on the patio. We couldn't stop talking about it the rest of the day... it was yummy and a delightful experience! We highly recommend it :)

lyKUV32IGmfekTp3eMRWdA.text: i'm a fan. the Hurricanes did a good job of putting a smile on my face, and during happy hour, 4 hurricanes and the shrimp spring roll was only 25$  so happy hour yes. dinner probably not.   i have loved this building since i was a child. so i'm happy it's still around and not returned to the ground, in rubble.

8476O9W8dVhDacQnU8cwEg.text: Unapologetically kitschy and undeniably wonderful.  The staff is very friendly and cool.  Their deals are great.  The menu is delicious-- especially the appetizers (hello, crispy coconut shrimp rolls and sweet potato fries with aioli.) The Lilikoi margarita is my go-to drink. It's just an all around fun place to go, especially when it's not too hot and you can enjoy the patio.

NPyp1sFIT-XhoRCDcPpc1g.text: Went here for lunch on a Saturday. Had the pulled pork sandwich and it was delicious. The enviorment was decorated in reto hawaiian stuff. With a very open air feel. The server was very nice. We enjoyed our time her very much.

wCaNSOuq_50LM-p3Rsxxrw.text: Really wanted to love this place, as I'm drawn to tiki themed establishments like a moth to light.  We went in the early evening (maybe 5:30 or 6) to partake in some happy hour specials and ordered ceviche, one of the house specials.  The ceviche we received had obviously been sitting for awhile, as the fish was mushy to the point that you would've been better off eating it with a spoon - gross.  Luckily, the waitress agreed that the batch was way off and removed it from the bill.  Coconut shrimp rolls were crispy and tasty, and we loved our mai tai and dark and stormy.  We were planning on splitting the macadamia encrusted butterfish with mango sauce, but when we tried it, my boyfriend gagged and refused to eat another bite.  I thought the flavors were a bit strange/overly sweet but would've given it more of a chance.  However, at that time, friends of ours called and invited us to join them at Pita Jungle, so we just paid and left.    Waste of money, but now we know: come here for drinks and cooked apps and beware of the fish!

kHdUAQvEmT13-qAPJh-8Pg.text: I absolutely love this place. Atmosphere, good food, good drinks, friendly staff. I have been there twice now and have had no issues.

1cZ_SXCTqd2KA00hoiuOvw.text: OMG! This place rocks!!!  The food is amazing and the atmosphere is perfect.  I would recommend the  Hawaiian Ceviche, Shrimp Rolls and Lobster Bisque - all were fantastic.  Bring a date, I'm sure they would be impressed.

B9y1O5NQyzanDK3Tf7e7uw.text: On a mission to find all the pet friendly restaurants in town...and hope we like their food. Hula's Modern Tiki makes the list. Great patio, nice ambient lighting, moderate traffic passing by, relaxed feel. I really like the "in the city" feel the restaurant has w/ Central traffic passing by. Started with the Samurai Beef Sticks: Excellent. tasty w/o being too much, juicy and the pineapple was good too. Main:Duke's Luau Pork plate, great. I would get it again. The date had a ribeye, he says it was just alright. His side of macaroni was so so delicious!!!! It is one of those dishes I crave. We know we like a place when we both say we would go back, especially for the mac & cheese! Giving it a 4 star until we can go back and try more menu items.

ucJsG38UTbNzZfXEUbfQkQ.text: WOW!  Talk about a metabolism booster....the Thai Spicy Chicken, was insanely delicious and full of flavor.  The staff was amazing with our large group including 4 kids under the age of 5!  Love the outside atmosphere and open feeling.

mt3TQhaDbFKNIjVec_0o4Q.text: Ive never been much for trying new places... Mainly because Im usually disappointed.  So I stick with what I know.  Hula's was a new place and by the stars above you can imagine how my visit was.  We had put in reservations for 25 people here and while they were hesitant they happily put us outside on this large table under the misters and shade.  Perfect setting.  I don't recall the waitress name, but she did something great in the beginning.  We all would be on separate tabs and she wrote all our names down.  Some places go by where you sit and will flip out if you move. She rocked this.  We all started with many drinks and any appetizers.  Let me tell you this.. I hate sweet potato fries.  I really do.. however their sweet potato fries with their dipping sauce was to die for.  I couldn't eat enough of them.  I kept looking at my friends with this "are you kidding me??" face.   Delicious  Dinner came and it was ncie to literally see everyone order something different.  If you have friends and dinner that means you have a ton of food to sample.  We did just that.    I ordered the Ahi Wasabi Bowl on white rice with black beans.  Holy crap that was amazing.  I usually get a burger, but wanted to break my burger streak.. so I did this.  A few friends did burgers and I did sample some of them.  I couldn't believe how good they were!  The drinks were awesome, food was great and the service at this place just kicks ass all over town.  I can't wait to go back!!

M-0StZntmSg9Sx6HWzbaSA.text: This is a fun place to hang out with friends and have a few drinks. Food and drinks are good here and even more so during happy hour. My favorite is the lilikoi magarita cuz I'm a sucker for passion fruit beverages. The scorpion or volcano (large fruity rum drinks in huge bowls with a float of flaming 151 on top) is always fun to have among friends. It comes with colorful huge straws that you can use hit each other with afterwards, too. :)  It's also conveniently located off the light rail and the patio outside is nice and lively. We always start here when we do our light rail bar crawls and work our way slowly downtown. It's a great place to start out the night.

8MT-eCAUFkzUS25rAhmDWA.text: I moved to phoenix from oahu hawaii and heard great things about this place. They had Hinano on tap which reminded me of home. The coconut shrimp rolls were ono. The sashimi and poke were also good. Except the sashimi was not properly cut and the presentation could have been better. I had the Bali hai mango ribs which were very very good. The coleslaw needs some work and the sweet potato fries were broke da mouth good. The service was good and friendly. Definatly comming back for another visit

SMpBl23OuyGoC4U3jHA2eA.text: Hands down, one of my faves! I rarely get out of my side of town. Perhaps I learned a good lesson. Sometimes you have to drive farther than your backyard for some great grub! Hula's happens to be in the heart of the city and worth the drive.  We took our dog Darwin with us on this beautiful Sunday. Had an amazing brunch and mimosas. Service was excellent and the food was absolutely delicious. Hula's is a dog friendly environment and Darwin had an enjoyable time in the patio. Great deals during brunch with $2 mimosas and $5 bloody mary's. MMmmmmmm

b7Q41VgyjgtOpia77x7g4g.text: This place was awesome. It was upscale Hawaiian food to die for. The mixed drinks were fantastic. You must get the painkiller.

S9PUFp-sntixKa5heGHOsA.text: Ok, Asian fusion has so many faces, that its always hard to rate one against the other, because they're just different.  After a bit of a night, we stopped here and had one more, and I ordered the Ahi Wasabi bowl, with wasabi cream sauce.  YUM!  The ahi was cut like stew meat, and was cooked just right-tender inside.  I couldn't eat it all, but good.  My dining companion ordered Habanero Lime Chicken Tacos, and the same result.  She couldn't finish it, so it was boxed. We also split an order of Mac and Cheese.  Of course theirs used some variant of cheese that was just great.  Where was all of the Mac and Cheese experimentation when we were kids?  All around, good menu, yummy, and way better than any drive-thru at that time of night.

cFYhx2PUmQzYzjcJnnt-Zg.text: My boyfriend and I are new to the area and just driving around and found Hula's -we are so happy we did! We had couple beers at the bar before being sat. Try the koko brown seasonal on tap, soooo delicious! One of the best beers I've had. Food was amazing! I got the short ribs and he got the jerk pork plate. We where both super happy and definitely going to be coming back!

V9wlU-3tQ54pmiCQWRx7Uw.text: Update! I have been back to Hula's many times since the first time and it is still (fairly) consistently good. I love Hula's patio and fire pit...it is so nice on a cool day to sit by the fire while enjoying some beverages. Speaking of beverages, Hula's has a fantastic happy hour ('Tiki Time'). Drinks are about 5$ and it goes until 7 pm, even on Saturdays. This is craziness! The BF and I went there a few weeks ago and drank many many beverages (He likes the Dr. Funk and I am in love with the Lilikoi margarita (it is very tasty, trust me)) and the bill was still very reasonable. The food is somewhat hit and miss (hence the 4 star review), they have delicious jerk pulled pork that is always good, but other items were a miss such as the potstickers (tasted like Ling Ling's), the macadamia crusted fish (was pretty bland), and the chicken tacos (too big and not flavorful enough). I would probably stick to the pork. I STILL haven't had their coconut banana pie, but it always looks good....I might go there tonight and get it :-D.

SXdwJYwwJsx0A0zew0VQ-Q.text: Great patio!! We didn't eat, just day drinking. Waiter was great!

6rf1f0S8acjxRUBTOxvhFA.text: Went for drinks and appetizers to help benefit Friends of Animal Control and Care and was not disappointed! I am not a big fan of alcoholic beverages but this place made them fantastically. Got the Dr. Funk while my companions got Zombie and Hurricane. All were very tasty especially the Dr. Funk. MmmMMm.   The appetizers were well portioned, I got the sweet potato fries and the others got calamri and other fishy foods that I don't eat. No complaints from them so definitely a good sign.   Service was great, even though we were doing the special we still received plenty of attention.  I will be back but this time to try some food!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dr Funk tiki cup.

_Dt8sJYiIkWctlcy2Ec1dQ.text: it's not a big place, so don't come here in the middle of dinnertime and expect quick seating. That being said, come a bit earlier, put your name on the list, and then try some of their fantastic cocktails at the bar. Their drinks are great and the food doesn't disappoint. Try the calamari appetizer, it's delicious.

0LBsRr9gczXxfOJr55NMZA.text: Really cool cocktails AND sweet potato fries?! Have been taking friends here for happy hour because we always have a fun time.   The bar is lined with tiki cups of all shapes and sizes. There's even a drink that comes with a backscratcher? kinda weird. For a good time, order the volcano bowl: a multitude of rums, juices, and flaming shot of 151 in the middle, all in a giant bowl.  The really service sucks sometimes. - 1 star for that

zUBZNyohHez2qOe7SMG5Ng.text: The owner odd contact me to make things right.   I do appreciate the effort.  Maybe what we experienced truly was a one off.

yimUX-UGm0aDwuJ8wlsfTg.text: Wow! Talk about quality! Had a party of 6 and everything was awesome. And the pork sandwich was just ugh.... freaking good. Defiantly coming here again

9W_8X2JvGhi5gYwJ6hHgpg.text: Wednesday night happy hour (which lasts until 11pm)...was relatively busy for this day/time. Holy smokes, they're not shy with the alcohol in their drinks. After one, I was done! Seemed to be the consensus with everyone who was drinking... Also tried the coconut shrimp rolls, which weren't too shabby. Sauce was supposed to be pineapple/horseradish, but didn't seem at all horseradishey.  Our server (Katherine) was great! On top of refills, food orders, friendly, and fast! Bar itself was nice, was showing reruns of Gilligan's Island. Great patio seating, especially this time of year!

-KDBE2_EpalbSZxqzoIXDg.text: This was a fabulous dining experience. the food was very delicious.   I ordered the Pork sandwich with sweet potato drys and macaroni salad. for an appetizer i got the coconut shrimp rolls, they were great as well. Next  time in in town I will defiantly come back! The staff was very friendly and helpful with their recommendations.

6a7-8m9GXh8Fln71t3LF0Q.text: Hula isn't close to home for me, but after a perfect experience, I can't wait to go back and try more food! Visited for the first time on a holiday Monday for lunch and a few drinks. I had 1 pork & 1 fish taco and was very impressed. My friend had the Ahi tuna steak sandwich and was equally as impressed. I'm not a picky beer drinker, but my friend is. The bartender made some great suggestions and my friend was able to get educated and taste some great new beers! The weather was perfect for patio dining... And this open dog friendly patio is one of the best. Stop on in, you won't regret it.

afhygPuJ4P6iFysIkX_2lA.text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday in mid october. We had been wanting to try this place forever so we decided to make this dream into a reality. Sadly, it did not live up to my expectations.  Environment- I would give an A. First  I will say it is beautifully laid out! It was around 8pm on a Saturday night, so there were tons of people having dinner over drinks with good company. The hostesses were really nice and I was expecting a pretty good night.  Server- He was pleasant, he gave my boyfriend and I "space" which was nice BUT it was annoying having to track him down for refills and changes to our order. Like I said, he was nice but could have been more attentive   Food- Nothing special at all. For appatizers we did fish cakes and potstickers which had tons of flavor.  I also ordered a side of plantains, unfortunately they were still frozen when I bit into them so I sent them back.  I ordered tacos and my boyfriend ordered jawaiian jerk chicken plate, we both agreed our food was bland and mediocre at best. Because it was his birthday I also ordered him a warm brownie which was on the dry and hard side.  Overall, the environment is great but the service and food left something to be desired. I would only return for maybe drinks during  happy hour at the bar.  DINNER TOTAL: $54.15

Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brownie
- i would recommend skipping this (dry and hard)
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. plantains still frozen on the inside

MmtVZ_idjJTck4JB20qA-A.text: Crispy coconut shrimp rolls: Yum! This consists of 2 rolls, each cut in half. These arrived very hot, temperature-wise, fresh out of the fryer. The shrimp and vegetables(?) in the rolls were savory and delicious. There was a nice blend of textures, with a nice crunch from the roll. The cool pineapple-horseradish dipping sauce was slightly sweet and served as a great complement to the savory warm shrimp roll. I would definitely want to try this again!  Hurricane: This drink was strong! As someone who doesn't drink frequently, I was done after this one drink. Lightweights, beware! The drink tasted a bit too strong for me, so I probably wouldn't order this again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy coconut shrimp rolls with dipping sauce
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy coconut shrimp rolls with dipping sauce

yO_D4fU4q_ty9iVw0NKU9A.text: I live for the Mai Tai at Hulas!  Also they have some fantastic appetizers, my personal favorite is the coconut shrimp spring roll with a pineapple horseradish sauce.. Spectacular.  The burgers are delicious here, as is the pulled pork.  I admire that they have electric vehicle parking spots!  This truly stands out amongst the best in phoenix

KtIOcKl3PpgmMf4qRXbaNw.text: I have been here a few times. This particular occasion we just had drinks . Happy hour specials from 10:30am - 7pm on all drinks on a Saturday was a pleasant surprise! We were greeted and seated promptly. Our server was very polite and attentive. The drinks - potent. Great place to hang out and chat over drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tasty HH drinks!

gQFJPndBqHQdp8cc78oPUQ.text: Love the ambiance, great tacos, delicious mac, service was awesome! Definitely will be back!!  Only thing was limes were extremely dry... Probably got 1 drop outta each wedge

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos

bJhKYk8N9TQOdr_h-x7Qtw.text: Came here for Wednesday happy hour thats all day and had a pleasant time. I went right after work and it was kind of packed but nothing I couldn't handle. My face drink was the hurricane it was pretty strong. Also had the coconut shrimp rolls and they were sooo delish! Nice and crunch with some sort of sweet mango sauce as dippi.g sauce.. left me wanting more! Can't wait to come back here for the food.

cO8oF5pMaxSweQoiVTXUSA.text: Our first time here and we will be back!!  The food is excellent, good size portions and reasonable prices!  Great happy hour.  The best poke since I was in Hawaii!   Our server Morgan was terrific!

IIQIy8VkASSGaoW6SxSYPg.text: Love this place have for years! - great atmosphere, great food, good drinks.   First major complaint ever is that "Two face tattoo" bartender is a BIG Grump!!  Simple order - 3 beers and we get high drama from this pretend cocktail God.  Poke And Wings make for a great app combo!  Came back for lunch and it was so good!!!

_F5iMmNmxnP5VBbpOHMysw.text: Definately for the college age group.    The food was really good.   We had macadamia encrusted mani and jerk chicken.   The bowls are huge.   Great service.

uyxYXTWzqql5I2TMuyJuLQ.text: My last review was 4 stars, I had to up it to 5 for the simple fact that they donated 10% of their proceeds to Phx Animal Cruelty. This almost made me cry, and I'm not the type to cry.  I loved Hula's before for their great atmosphere, food, and cocktails, but this just blew it all out of the water for me. I wish more businesses did such a selfless act.

Yd0ct2ABYqarHQE-vFNqqg.text: I love this place! The island inspired decor and ambiance are spot on. The alcoholic beverages are some of my favorite in Phoenix. The steak sandwich is literally one of my favorite sandwiches in all the lands. Only gets 4 stars because I have been a little disappointed by some of the other food that I've ordered here but I would still highly recommended trying this central Phoenix gem out!!

pyGLuZJ2i_jSRP_Ggf4DTA.text: Our visit to Hulas has been amazing! we were greeted by the nicest hostess with the huge smile. Our server was super attentive and indulged all of our crazy needs. Food was amazing definitely recommend the poke the burgers and the Ahi Benedict. The tiki drunks are amazing!

4n0Vykf_BXw-LOFm1IiO3A.text: Fantabulous Downtown Phoenix lounging spot... great concoctions, super food, superb services and magnificent ambience - can't ask for anything more! Fab!  We keep going back!

KLsL3ELBegjy6rcU__4jIA.text: Great food,  great atmosphere!    The staff was very nice!  The Madagascar is a must try!!!

ueQ7P49UGHWpRFYyK31vpg.text: Really like this place. The food is consistently good. I feel like I only Give bad reviews on Yelp, I think it's because places I frequent, I frequent and forget to review.  If you haven't been. You should partake.

aGNdGfoy3iiT8OuqXFxaOQ.text: Super fun restaurant with Hawaiian based food and drinks.  Try some of the specialty  drinks and enjoy the great service and interesting food! We can't wait to go back.

_6Y8EBCvQl6lnr_K3vSQ9Q.text: As soon as me and my mom walked in we were greeted with a smile and the host seat us to our liking and gave us our menu. Once we sat down the waiter brought us some ice cold water to quench our thirst from the heat. We were here for the lunch hour which has plenty of good stuff for your palette. I got the Polynesian chicken sandwich and it was pretty flavorful. The chicken was perfectly charred yet tender and juicy. The pineapple was seared quite nice and the aoli was full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Polynesian chicken

xTQ50lvIE9KHkQ3IFVYbAg.text: Best ceviche anywhere in Phoenix...not to mention they allow dogs on patio AND serve them ice cubed water....so glad I moved next door!

9damJG2q4e0NdNzsbm27ZA.text: We were visiting the Phoenix area for 5 days and went here twice. We couldn't wait to go back and try more items on the menu and enjoy the cool vibe and great service. Our app favorites were the Hawaiian Ceviche, Samurai beef sticks and the calamari. The Blackened Mahi was amazing and the Spicy Thai Chicken Bowl did not disappoint. Then there are the cocktails! Beautiful, generous and priced right - especially at happy hour. We can't wait to go back and try more selections!

_PbK5lLnCwgeHzOAcRxxKQ.text: Great happy hour, and it is all day on Wednesday! They have the traditional tiki bar drinks, plus many delicious options. I am a fan of their HH appetizers and their full menu. Hawaiian is so hit or miss in the Valley and this totally hits the spot. One thing that was a surprise was the spicy sauce on the curry shrimp! Be forewarned, and maybe you will enjoy the surprising heat this place can bring!

vC04787i8hspQKmLxhdHEw.text: Only went for drinks but definitely a good time.  We had a giant flaming drink to share and it was very very strong!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yaassssss

ZKOWkjAgPSApnfoyme1H9A.text: Expected a lot more from the reviews we read, but food was meh. Service was good, our waitress was on top of it. We tried catching the attention of 2 guys just standing by the kitchen, and they just looked at us and looked away.  But our waitress saw it and came right away.

9palpVyCMzFAus1AMNAUsg.text: One of my fav spots to go to on weekend nights or just about any night of the week. They have ample outdoor seating with a huge fire pit in the middle that is lit in the winter. Inside they also have a great decor including a general seating area and bar area. They have a unique drink menu and I don't think I've ever been disappointed by what I've tried. They do have a few gluten-free options as well. My favorite is the habanero lime chicken tacos. They have a pretty decent happy hour. I also particularly like the sweet potato fries and a lot of the appetizers are really good. The key lime pie is incredible! The dishes are good size and I feel like you get your moneys worth. Most of all I just find incredibly relaxing to be sitting outside in downtown Phoenix at night in front of a fire pit enjoying some great food!

oTx7BQXT_2KBbBTcGQllHA.text: Everything was just so good! Six of us went to dinner while visiting the area recently and I wish we had one of these back home. We had the beef and chicken skewers with amazing dipping sauces for apps. I loved the variety here. I had the Korean kalbi as recommended by our super nice server. And everyone else loved their dishes, too.  On a side note, the restaurant is so light, airy and vacation-like and the bathroom made me want to redo mine. Is that weird?

I3z_1EQmP_6MmQBv4dIyvw.text: This was our place to go for any occasion. Today the food was poor to fair. We think the chef ran away. Staff still positive and pleasant. We will not be coming back in the near future

nmHBjjbdC6yEAGiB6ljDDA.text: Great place to go to with friends. I reccomend you try the Jawaiian Jerk Pork it is SO GOOD! Waiter was very attentive and always came to check up on us!

xqwZcQCua0rKLnliAnBxFw.text: Hula's is awesome! The appetizers are great and the drinks are even better.  You have to try the Scorpion bowl! It's delicious and big enough to share! It's literally on fire. Like wow, this drink is LIT.  I was skeptical of Hula's at first because I'm not usually one for themed bars and restaurants, however, I was impressed. Thanks, Hula's!

nl07UaSMMCwZ1qRQwmxgQg.text: Love the mai tai, the steak bowl is amazing! Service is always great! The atmosphere is very cozy and the style very sleek!

MRGB-fIRv_eE0worKRFh9g.text: Great food and atmosphere. Service was great. Affordable too.we were happy they had vegan options. Kids menu.

GBVjxjiH7FmGQR1s2hQxew.text: One of my favorite spots for happy hour.. great drinks, delicious appetizers and great entree items! If you like rum, this is the place to be.. I don't usually like seafood, but I always get seafood appetizers here!  I will always recommend the short ribs and the Thai chicken!

c7pbJSnELTZgFq48gFtpNQ.text: New location in central Phoenix is alright.  The old central location had a more interesting vibe.  One thing I would say is I miss the servers name tags, that list where they are from, it gives you an opportunity to interact with your servers.  Personal connection keep you coming back.  What makes you different?

0H4o6uu1hEM0JQq_b2PNGA.text: Yummy, good drinks for the public alcoholic in the group and the closet alcoholic alike. They also have some pretty good food. A good amount of choices for all -or- most diets whether they are a legitimate medical issue or a privileged self imposed restriction for what you put in your body. Not that that is a bad thing. Personally I find the dairy industry incredibly disgusting so I don't consume dairy, but I'm also lactose intolerant..

-TnbfTq29mbnVx86qM60Og.text: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix..... service is great, best place to get an old fashioned....and the ahi tuna bowl is always Super Fresh.......

xJYo8w3pS0GrWNPIp00idA.text: I'm SO glad they moved locations off the annoying central ave. It saves me so much time ordering my lunch to go from them. The new location is much more centrally located as well and looks great. Food is just as good and service is less pushy and less of an attitude than it used to be at the previous location. Their staff at the last location really killed my desire to keep going to their restaurant. So far at this new location I have had no problem and my orders have all came out as expected.

eA60gv1FkJSNMvP03cMuog.text: We had a business lunch here the other day and the food was amazing! I had the steak tacos they were so good and everyone at our party said food was amazing and definitely recommend a place to eat!!!! We also got to meet the owner when you were there Dana and he was so nice.

yS9yxRnjaSymFx_MSskueg.text: Came here once for brunch/lunch a couple of weeks back. The veggie burger was really good, drinks were amazing (beware: had 3 double mimosas and was out of my mind. Not complaining, this is actually a compliment since some places can have very weak mimosas, just be ready for it). Reason for the missing star is service. It was okay but the guy seemed very bored and apathetic, which can kinda bring you down when you're trying to have a Sunday funday

iKiDqTYNQNr4H0b-OVCTUQ.text: Decent happy hour and our waiter was good.. nice outside patio.. defin will come back..

3hP9WMI0PuhCaumFZnt93w.text: One star but should be a zero.  Never was able to get in because they don't take reservations for less than six people.  But there was also no place to sit and wait.

nSBIAKiJdizO3PDzmkQP_g.text: Hula's has been a staple in the Phoenix community for several years.  We have been going since it was on Highland and Camelback.  Cat and Cory were super attentive and checked on us frequently.  Cory was also super patient with an unruly customer.  Coming from a bartenders standpoint these are difficult conversations to have and she handled it well.  It was upsetting to see this situation in such a well loved bar in the community.  Thanks ladies for a great night!

vXDW7g4R3iKQlFirsMFevw.text: They got it all wrong, this new location that is...the vibe isn't what it used to be. We were seated close to the live music, it was so loud and I left with a screaming headache. I've now been there twice and each time they were out of drink specials or entree. Staff is as stoic as they were before.

awEDJLMEljMFeW-KmUHW8g.text: This spot is hoppin!  Happy hr is great!  Lots of sexy people at this spot!  Get there early, grab a seat at the bar and meet the sexy women!  Bring your A game.  Lots of professionals and great food, have the fish bites and Hawaiian mac!  Drinks are on point!  Try the pain killer!

I3pH_FaNz7lJtDVxLMr3oQ.text: This place is very bright! Great vibe, excellent service! fun drinks and great food! Great upbeat place!

F6roJbFAGNkdpu7qCIiddQ.text: Finally decided to make a trek out to Hula's Modern Tiki for dinner! When we arrived, we noticed the very open setup. The restaurant seemed very casual & laid back, I was loving the vibe already!  After we were seated about 15 minutes later, our server came by. We put an order in for the Scorpion Bowl and the Spicy Thai Fish Cakes appetizer. It was fun to see the Scorpion bowl come out with the flaming rum float in the middle. I personally enjoy fruity drinks so I was totally on board with this drink and would get it again! The Spicy Thai Fish Cakes came out just a little bit after and they were really tasty. Not really that spicy but more so flavorful. I'd definitely recommend these!  Then, for dinner, I got an order of Hula's Baja Fish Tacos. The fish was flaky and crispy but the taco didn't pack as much flavor as I was hoping. I'd venture on to trying one of the other taco options in the future but did enjoy my meal. My husband got the Luau Pork Sandwich for his meal and enjoyed it. I tried just a bite and liked it as well!  Overall, a good experience! They have Happy Hour specials M-F from 3:30p-6:00p. I'd definitely come back, especially to try some of their other cocktail & appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Left: Spicy Thai Fish Cakes appetizer. Top: Baja Fish Tacos. Bottom: Luau Pork Sandwich.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scorpion Bowl.

ZauCJ724nClRcHcfLDy97Q.text: Love hulas. I was a little bummed they moved further away from me, but the new location is so cool and just as awesome. Cheers! We just ordered the classic ceviche!

MMjmKhi5FdZW7AoYAFL-8A.text: One of my favorite spots in this area, the tuna tacos are the absolute best and i truly enjoy them! I also love the tea they have here! Also recommend the pot stickers and white fish ceviche!!

KHMFXKfSMRtbZiOebCRlOA.text: Great food- Great service! The drink selection is quite fun as well! We sat on the patio with a large group and we all enjoyed our meal and time at Hula's!

hsSGM9SByPi5pR-KnomAPw.text: Very friendly service and the atmosphere was super relaxed and laid back. I been to their other location on Central and Indian School. They have very good happy hours and their drinks are not too bad.

Zqf_jZmqAjPBwG_97GSxPg.text: I'd been to the old location once before but now that they're open within walking distance of my home I was excited to try it again. We started off with sharing the Scorpion Bowl. It says it is meant for 2-4 people, and they aren't kidding! The drink felt like it was poorly mixed initially but after giving it a stir it was quite tasty, though strong. My wife and I shared it and were definitely feeling it on the way home.   The Hawaiian ceviche was phenomenal - very heavy on the fish with beautiful acid flavor, served with wonton chips without anything distracting to the purity of the product. It's been a week and my wife is already talking about how she wants to go back just for the ceviche.  We did each get the fresh fish special - I ate the hapu served jerk style and my wife got the ahi lemongrass encrusted. quite enjoyed mine, it was a good combination of flavors - though the Jamaican style corn bread it came with was somewhat strange. My wife's didn't work quite as well, I don't think the tuna played well with the lemongrass flavors.  All in all, definitely coming back sometime.

9rBnFGkfBjinRs0A5oRa3Q.text: I'm ashamed that I haven't written a review on Hula's yet as it's one of my favorite places to dine when I visit Phoenix.  Being from Boston, I can safely say we have nothing like this.  Not even close.  So eating food with a Hawaiian and Polynesian flair is such a nice change from chowdah.    First of all, the place has as cool, open vibe with an outdoor patio and firepit.   The service has always been excellent and the staff super friendly.  However, the real winner is their food.  Everything I have tried has been excellent.   From the spicy edamame (bring your tissues), to the johnny cakes, to the jerk chicken and mongolian beef bowls and fish tacos, it's all outstanding.  Their flavors work so well together, and everything is cooked to perfection.   I have never had a meal I didn't savor.  I come to Phoenix every few months for work and always try to make this place a stop.   Love it!

k0ojY2sZ0lw5C8fSTk1L2Q.text: We have been fans of Hulas on Central for years. No better place when you are craving a Mai Tai and a little Polynesian flare. Went to check out the new digs. Truthfully we started out with a little bauble, but we let the owner know and he couldn't have been more apologetic or responsive. The Mai Tais and fish tacos are as good as ever. Their new Tiki room is adorable. Check out the wonderful "speak easy" right next door, wooden walls, Polynesian music, and special tasty cocktails...with a friendly entertaining bar tender to boot. Best daquari I've had in a long time. Aloha! Still our favorite taste of the Pacific...

16wIB3OQpfkPR9WNP06U9g.text: Forgot how much I love this place!!!!   $3 mimosas and best poke.   Last Labor Day in Maui...  can't go this year but food feels like you are there.  Everything is outstanding!!!

5Mq7SgT4IN7dmOIs28xDDg.text: We came here for dinner at the bar and had a great experience. We ordered their MaiTai, coconut shrimp rolls and ahi burger with sweet potato fries. It was all absolutely delicious. The service was friendly and prompt, the space was modern and clean, and the atmosphere was busy but not overwhelming. We will definitely be back.

smrKUvORRdWUNMvxK00e1Q.text: Very nice place we went in the middle of the afternoon and went to have some drinks and we also split a ceaser salad. Very very good I will definitely be going back here. The drinks where amazing flavor was very good not to strong they also came in cool fun cups . I had one that came in a coconut . My partner had a drink that had a big ol tiki face on it. We ended with some mimosas very very relaxed place.

Zh6TqEC-gDwboQMEb1Z4_Q.text: New location is nice with a big bar but they have limited parking space so be ready to use valet. It wasn't a busy night yet it took a long time to order drinks and food. Not sure if it's because of the new bartenders or it's their grand opening. We ordered the skewers and was pleasantly surprise that the portion was bigger than the old location.
