00qjVIF_mv251OYagGEJzg.text: Just had the pleasure of sitting at the bar watching the bartender serve and close tabs while my husband and I sat with absolutely nothing to make it appear we were eating/drinking. After waiting 5 plus minutes without even a greeting we left at 5:45pm. Good luck!

CwtWnFKPQmy4wzZUMNRKSA.text: I love this place. I have been here several times and I'm finally writing a review. Every single time I've been here we get great service and great drinks or food. I love that they have some sort of happy hour everyday.  When my friend and I come here we usually just get drinks and appetizers. We've had a couple full meals here and they're great as well. I love this place as it's very well priced and a fun place to hang out. The servers always make sure we're taken care of while not making us feel rushed.  This visit I had a few mimosas and they were great. We had the sweet potato fries and potstickers to hold us to dinner and they were super good.  All in all, I love hula's. This is one of my favorite places to go to lounge and have a few drinks. Thanks hula's! I'll be back soon!

EF1D_pyeJ3j3HLM5OxRYcg.text: On a recent trip to PHX, friends suggested we meet here for a drink an lunch. We loved it and probably went back 4 more times during the next 8 days. LOVED the Mai Tais and the Jered Chicken not to mention the plantains which are the bomb!

KzVhnuarUrW6pFFre2knPA.text: Great food! Excellent place to eat drink and enjoy your friends or family!  Had the Hula fish tacos, excellent!

-I3DgrfMwi187X_sBFqraQ.text: What can I say, I love a good tiki bar.  Hulas does classic tiki drinks well and has a good happy hour! -8 dollar cocktails are only 6!- and they have a bunch of food items for a good deal too.  My favourite drink here is the pink bikini martini. It's super sweet, almost candy like but I love it. If you like a zombie? They do a really nice one. If you want to have a crazy night, order the scorpion bowl to share! It comes with a little fire in the middle and tastes great, but you'll definitely be feeling it after one of those!  I like to order the potstickers and wings on happy hour. It's a good deal and the wings have a bit of heat and sweetness to them, and they are of course smothered in sauce. The potstickers are just delicious, I can't even say why, the combination of meat and fried dough and those bomb dipping sauces...damn!  I've had the burger here too and it's good. I don't think it's on happy hour though.  They have specials almost everyday of the week, check the Facebook page before you go.

HMJLVmyKdFWi2BaQ3cRBQA.text: Hula's has an impressive cocktail menu that included many of those multi-ingredient drinks that you never have all of the makings for at home. I had the mai tai and let me say, they did not skimp on the rum! It was strong and delicious. Worth the eight dollar price.   The menu is huge with a large variety of choices. We had 17 people in our party and every single dish looked delicious. I immediately had dinner envy though when my friend's ahi tuna Caesar arrived. It had a generous heap of perfectly cooked ahi on top!  Attentive staff. Clean dining room. Good food and cocktails. Definitely worth s visit!

pLTXA8XJdr2_I6eX2Q_BCA.text: The food is delicious, loved the Wasabi mashed potatoes substituted for the rice in my Thai Chicken Bowl.  Wowzie... And it's a big meal for the price, I have left overs for tomorrows lunch  The atmosphere is chill as advertised and the staff of engaging without being overwhelming.  Definitely coming back.

b3AZiPM8Uv2UDjGBTEwTow.text: Being familiar with the 90's tiki bar trend of tired, low-grade pseudo-Polynesian food, coupled with overpowered rum drinks, I approached the family's suggestion to try Hula's with some hesitation.  Much to my surprise, Hula's is quite different than the prior-century icon.  In a warm and inviting Old Town storefront, Hula's dim lighting, ample space and large central bar immediately brought to mind a comfortable dining and drinking environment.  Jazmine, our waitress, was patient, quite informative and quick to deliver our order.  We ordered a shared portion of the whitefish cerviche appetizer, and it was good.  The marinating of the fish in lime juice appeared to have been rushed, as neither fully tenderized fish nor a fully developed flavor profile were the result.  Next, we each ordered entrees and generously sampled from each plate.  The macadamia-crusted ahi, served medium rare, was very good.  A large cut of quality ahi in a nicely seasoned crust preserved the subtle balance of flavors between the two.  The luau-style pulled pork was tasty, if a bit sweet for my tastes.  Laced with a small dice of pineapple and pineapple juice, it remained satisfying none the less.  A scoop of jasmine rice helped to balance the flavors.  The star of the evening, however, was our older son's jerk pork.  Shredded, with a pleasant heat and light curry flavor, the dish was identifiable from its Caribbean origins, yet uniquely Hawaiian.  Portions are very large, and quite fortunately, the food was delicious enough to make this "a good thing."  Hula's Modern Tiki is a clever concept which, as the crowded dining room will attest, serves very good food.  Dinner for the four of us, pre-tip, was $75.50, making Hula's an outstanding value as well.

-Q1oxySRp0DadwyhspaoZg.text: Do you like being on vacation?  The only thing that's missing is the cliche Hawaiian music, which no one wants (except your Grandma).  You really feel relaxed at this place, and it has a very fun vibe though.  The bar has a great Happy Hour!  I don't know any other place that serves "painkiller" drinks, except in the British Virgin Islands.  It has rum, pineapple, coconut, and OJ.   Delicious.  The staff is always smiling.  Why not?  They're in a mini-paradise!  It's probably one of the friendliest places in town.  So two thumbs up for this place.  I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Specials
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great happy hour!

HVlm8sCS_0LCAueBfBNoTw.text: I've been here a few times for dinner. Great atmosphere with the indoor/outdoor space. I usually order something with ahi tuna because it is sooo good. I've also tried their pulled pork, which is equally as tasty. Drinks are strong!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi tuna tacos with rice and beans on the side. YUM!!!

NzMWRGQke5OVOUJgNGKxHw.text: I was not overly impressed.   I ordered the pork, egg, and hash meal. The pork was actually really delicious, and you can not mess up an egg. The hash is where it lacked for me. It was very dry and not flavorful. The service was great, and our waitress was very friendly. Probably would not come back, but worth a shot if you are near by.

DMLYhxrR4hPcn5dzVJJvew.text: My boyfriend and I came here before a concert and ordered a drink to share, I believe it was called the scorpion bowl it was amazing! Our burger was very good but the best part was their coconut cream pie  great place to check out!

i6FdqjrnRoGrlOPBnrAJWw.text: Always have the Ceviche it's delicious and the shining star of the meal. It's such a clean light dish. Absolutely adore the won ton chips that come with it. The neon multicoloured straws are a fun touch! The cesar salad it's also delicious! Good clean iced tea. Eventually I'm going have some of the super delicious looking cocktails!! Service is always very good and I like the open floor plan with the openness to outside.

5626dxrqB1sue_TL_UJ7Tw.text: I live right next to this restaurant. Tried so many times to like it but it's just not for me. This place would be fun for drinks though. It's always busy.  Oh and by the way, don't write a bad review because the owner will contact you and send you a condescending message :/

0tB0uqgtjsQqDZ_4a9ZPqQ.text: Coming here with a few friends after a long week is more than relaxing. I'm not originally from AZ so Friday night crowd here is more like a nice lounge with great food. The drinks are great. The crowd is always laid back just having a good time. The staff is always very helpful. I occasionally have take out here as well and after a while the staff remembers you and have your food ready when you arrive.   Friendly faces, cool atmosphere, mixed crowd, all calls for a great happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scorpion bowl. Great drink and it&#39;s on fire when they bring it to you-literally.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tasty desserts!

0qZUikYTr6sz-On-vYPr0g.text: I was actually having a decent time at my most recent visit to Hula's Modern Tiki. Our server was on top of her stuff and never left drinks empty. I found it to be a bit pricey for the area -- $14 for a platter of chicken, rice and plantains. But aside from the crunchy rice, it was good.  My problem came at the end of my visit. Our server informed me that she used my card to ring up someone else's check (it was almost double the price of my check). She informed me that she took care of it and it would straighten out in a couple days. No worries, it happens. What she failed to tell me was that not only did she charge my card for the wrong check, she also charged me for my check. Double swipe = double charge. I was under the impression she just refunded the difference. This caused an enormous headache for me. It was a Friday night. Because she swiped my card twice, it put a fraudulent security hold on my card. I was unable to use it all weekend long. By the time I got everything sorted out and got my money back, it was Wednesday.   This isn't something that should've been handled by a server. This was a management problem. If she would have come over and told me right away what happened, I would have just opted to pay her in cash. I know sometimes that double swipe sends my security settings into an angry frenzy. I'm hoping this was an isolated incident and not something generally handled by servers. The event caused me such a headache, I will definitely not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cocojoes chicken plate

q_iL8Js8TEyw-IZ9r8e-Wg.text: Me and my husband went Sunday early 6-5-16 afternoon... We always love coming to the hula bar but after this last visit, we will be sticking to Scottsdale location... The girl put us right in the middle on a tiny table next to a family nothing wrong with kids I have 3 but I didn't have space to put my purse down because the kid had his stuff right next to me.. Then on the other side was another couple and we were so close that it was hard for me and my husband to enjoy ourselves because it just feels like not enough space and we were so close to the 2 families that we couldn't even hear our own conversation...spacing is important it helps to promote a relaxing atmosphere and feel welcoming this made us so uncomfortable that all we had was coconut shrimp rolls which are my faves and sweet potato fries.. Food is awesome but I can't enjoy my food if I can't feel comfortable with space in a restraunt.. Me and my husband love the hula bar and we will go back it's our fave place to go and to hang out but Scottsdale is where we will be going it's a lot more spacey  Went to try out this hula bar with some friends since it's closer to home... Loved it we got the scorpion bowl and also my faves coconut shrimp rolls and sweet potato frys... It was yummy... And mixed drinks were good also :) and we brought friends to try it out and they loved it, they said food was yummy :) and they would definitely come back :) thanks again hula bar!!!

pQj08XqaCb6VwwXMelV4iw.text: Delicious, is the only word I can use to describe the fantastic Scorpion bowl, an alcoholic drink for two. My house salad was delicious along with my spicy Thai chicken bowl. My love, had the chicken sandwich, which he loved. Our waitress Bailey, was super friendly and welcoming. We will definitely be returning specially to try their Hawaiian chicken and also their Volcano Bowl (alcoholic bowl) meant for 3-4 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Thai Chicken bowl
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wall decoration.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scorpion bowl for 2 people! Yummy!

dfIvzl16Mu2TOXiqcau8Ow.text: 4.325 I love the ambiance of this place. It feels like a Friday night party every time. It's just HAPPY and happenin'  in here! I love sitting inside by the large glass window, or in the area where you're half in half out and the breeze gently blows, or outside by the fire pit where my pooch gets a water bowl and even sits next to me on the comfy-couchy chairs. The mood is relaxed yet lively.  I hate the jammed parking. They need a parking lot across the street and not one shared with a mini mall where an accident is just waiting to happen. Even walking through it feels like a disaster.   Now for the food.....it's Hawaiian/Asian mix sort of....I've been here a ton and I still don't quite know where to put in on the food chain. In the past I always had the raw tuna poke. See it was so delicious I didn't venture far on the menu because I could never get enough of it. This last time it was WAY salty and WAY over seasoned with soysauce. What happened to all the fun flavors that use to be swimming in there? I also had the thai chicken wings which were fine but nothing to write home about. The ceviche was outstanding though. Great hint of lime flavor and fresh! Hubby had the kalbi short ribs and again my man of many words states "They were good, I liked them". I tried them and they were seasoned OK, not the kalbi I'm used to that you can't put down until you've sucked all the juice out. So from all the times I use to love this place to this last visit of slightly above average food....it use to be one of our favorite places in Phoenix so I'm sticking with 4ish stars for now.

ExAH1s4YRSkis6fPppeLlw.text: Pulled pork jerk was pretty good, plantains are good , not a fan of the rice. Overall it was okay nothing spectacular. The setting and outdoor patio was nice and allows dogs.

L8opNamldtxIAZAH87vK6A.text: This place is really cute for ambiance but the food was pretty out there for me. I would definitely recommend this place for a happy hour or drink destination but don't recommend any of their meals.

JrKxRliOcYzDenGk5syKwQ.text: The specials they have are amazing! Everyday there is something different! Tuesdays are 2 starters and 2 specialty drink for $20, Wednesday happy hour all night, and if you follow them on Facebook you can get "the word of the day" and get some pretty awesome deals. The bartender Matt is always great!

R0JAnWRRF0sKF7qiFG_dKw.text: Hmmm... so I've been to this place and have had great meals before... but this time, lunch for my girlfriends 30th bday, it wasn't as great as I remembered. The food was decent but it wasn't great for the price... the services wasn't as attentive as I would like but by no means would I call it bad. If you're interested in food with a polynesian influence... I would check it out... but if you don't have that requirement, there are better places to go in the area.

p6S7PtGgUmWeCqJDM7EAOQ.text: I've been to Hula's plenty of times before when I used to work close by.  I don't remember why I wasn't that big of a fan as I haven't been back in a while.  My bf has been wanting to come try this place out.    The weather is starting to cool down, their patio is spacious and open and it wasn't busy.  The service was ok - not the best.  The four stars is based on a happy hour experience.  The drink options were great and I ordered so many happy hour items that I was stuffed.  Items on the table include hawaiian ceviche (good), crispy coconut shrimp rolls (ok), sweet potato fries (can't go wrong with sweet potatoe fries), spicy thai fish cakes (ok), calamari (not a HH item, but tasty), and pork tacos (good). I also ordered a drink, but don't ask me which it was because I don't remember.  It was good though.   For two people, it was around $40 - but both of us were stuffed.

rlMHhazChhhhTWz-iDH0oQ.text: This is denitely our "go to place" for hand crafted cocktails. Authentic island menu items are served. Service is always friendly and quick. These people know how to run a successful restaurant.

BDmlYV8TBzdpHtffAxlhMQ.text: We were fortunate enough to have a great friend who knows her stuff. We met Maureen at the Hula Tiki Grill for a fun lunch.  The weather was perfect outside, so we sat underneath a half shade, half pre-summer bliss. We all ordered Mai Tais and they were amazing.   We ordered taco plates, my guy got the chile chicken and I got the spicy shrimp and we shared one each. We are fans of trying errythang. Mo also ordered the chile chicken which was made with a fresh green chile salsa, mild yet flavorful.   We stayed there for hours, drinking Mai Tai's and Kona beers like we were on a beach somewhere yet out in the heat. We had an amazing time with great service that I won't forget. Thank you Hula's.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kona Koko Brown Porter
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Shrimp Tacos!!!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Chile Tacos, lunch combo

N_-zE9FPU6S-FxKt2U834g.text: Excellent food, nice ambience, pain in the ass to get in and out of if you're driving because of light rail in middle of Central.

-_Ucvg7qe__TSwJN5OcOfQ.text: I was let down when I arrived for dinner here. My fish patties were over-cooked. When my dinner finally arrived the black beans were cold and the rice was hard and cold, and the chicken that came with my meal was not that great either. When I got home I had to use the bathroom immediately.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chicken and Plantains were good.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cold Black Beans, Hard Sticky Rice.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My First Appetizer Fish Cakes were a little overdone.

e3woA79HGvfWai-usydYDA.text: Wonderful place. Ambiance is perfect for a fun dinner with the family. I can see this being a perfect spot as a gathering place with friends for drinks.

uykZxZCYk1cU9gAWxQAwHg.text: I was tempted to grab a grass skirt and wiggle into Hula's for their Tiki Time Happy Hour (Monday - Friday 3:30-6pm). But I opted for the Phoenix summer staple: a sundress and flip-flops. Love the mid-century modern feel. That gets a star :)  It was around 5:30pm and it was busy, but our server came over and took our drink orders when she saw us join a friend's table. I asked for Malibu and Pineapple and my friend Zombie'd out. We were given menus and she left without clearing any plates on our table, where our friends had several (not to mention a couple empty glasses).  She came back with the Zombie and told me they didn't have Malibu (what a disgrace to Tikiville's everywhere!!) but the bartender said I wouldn't know the difference and to bring me this. She set it down. I looked at her and said, "No, thanks." AUTOMATIC MINUS TWO STARS - one for NOT having Malibu and another one for trying to pass the fake crap off.  I ordered the Surfrider Chicken Sticks and Steak Tacos while my friend ordered the Mango Chicken Caesar (someone else in our party had ordered it and enjoyed it). She didn't take our menus and all of our drink glasses were empty. A few comments were made about this.  Ten minutes later, we get the Surfrider Chicken Sticks which were SET ON TOP OF MY MENU (damn, really??). They were cold. Decent, but cold nonetheless. My friend's salad came and I was told it would be a minute for the tacos. Another 20 minutes and they still hadn't come. Not to mention my empty plate SITTING ON TOP OF A MENU, empty water glass and my friend's empty glass.  A couple friends got up to leave and their empty plates and glasses remained even after WE got our check. I was billed for the tacos but I never got them. It took another 10 minutes for her to return with a correct bill.   Awful service, cold food, no food and a fake-Malibu serving bartender give this place ONE star in my book.

NRtdVWntxTeq0me6uybEcQ.text: i love this place! our waiter was great and the food was fresh.  TRY THE PINK BIKINI

o6eLkvVHVw_ZFscHwYjZzQ.text: This review is more of a 3.5 star one, but I round down as a general rule.  We hit up Hula's tonight for dinner. All in all, some good-sized portions (I had the half rack of ribs), decent sides, and very good service.  My ribs were a bit pedestrian: it said mango BBQ, but it was basically just... BBQ sauce. Nothing wrong with that, but nothing amazing going on here either. The ribs were cooked well enough, coated in sauce (I enjoy both dry and sauce-drenched, so no big issue here) and they were just fine. They just weren't anything too special.   The sweet potato fries were dead-on, and the aioli, while it could've used just a bit more kick and a bit less mayonnaise, was a good touch.  The mac 'n cheese was a big disappointment to me. The noodles were over-salted, almost as if they had salted the water entirely too much, and it just had nothing special going for it.  Mac 'n cheese is a tricky beast: you have to convince the eater that this is worth the calories and shame, and this one failed desperately in that regard. Not enough flavor and yet, too salty. A good sized portion for $5, though.  The girl had a pulled pork sandwich which was tasty enough, and she really enjoyed her side house salad. (It was tasty. I tried a bite.)  Our friend had the Hula Burger and it looked big and cooked nicely, and she seemed pleased.  Overall, a decent meal. The service was very good, the ambiance was fun and open, and it was definitely serviceable. I'd like to go back and try one of their fish options in the future, since they had a good selection of mix-and-match fish and prep styles that sounded really fun.

jWRjdSbfWZkSb2SIlpW8RQ.text: My dear Hula's, What happened today? Maybe it was the lunch rush, but that's no excuse. Our ice tea and water tasted very weird and slightly sweetened. If you're trying out something new, it's not a good idea. our food, which consisted of a lunch salad, sandwich and sweet potato fries took forever. The fries were cold, the ahi tuna very very over cooked and hardly any pink. Please get better soon. I will probably be back, but I will make sure it's not during lunch and that I order something different.

5zHHlRX69VD5EFeK_YRUFA.text: We went to hula's for my friend's birthday dinner, and it was fantastic! The atmosphere was so relaxing and fun, and the food and drinks were great. I highly recommend the pink bikini martini! Had the chicken sticks for appetizers and split the Mongolian beef bowl. Will be back again!

znBy9535TU-QREhYuVltJQ.text: The tuna poke is great. Unfortunately it's a dinner item so sometimes they don't have it for lunch.

mSimCXOja5aRCf46BBRuMQ.text: Marvelous place to go for Happy Hour. Great patio. Great atmosphere and nice service. Wednesday is Happy Hour all night.

R3yKkaP70xlrm38aCIlQow.text: This place is amazing!! The service is great. I come here for a drink almost every night because this place is that wonderful. The servers like Christine, Keith, & Charlie are spot on & have my regular drink prepared as soon as I sit down. All of the bartenders thus far have been so skilled, friendly, & attentive. Manager Kyle actually works with his staff & is very involved in making sure patrons are treated like privileged guests. I would highly recommend this restaurant/bar to anyone who wants amazing bar service & a personalized fun experience. I feel like this place is the modern day Hawaiian version of Cheers!

fU4SLvNX-yQDi0YmtuFF3Q.text: This past Wednesday happened to be their 2-year anniversary and we were fortunate enough to be there for the free appetizer / drink coupon as a result.  Drinks were great -- definitely liking the laid back, tropic vibe.  Food was decent (macadamia encrusted mahi, ribs), but didn't raise the bar for food of this type.  Only downfall was service -- our appetizer never made it, and extra drink did (not complaining about that!), had to ask for our waiter on a few occasions, and the check took a lot longer than would be expected.  My bottom line:  Would love to hit this place at happy hour or late night drinks, but would probably look elsewhere if I were looking for an above-average meal.

iSu5GFWus1rC7u2tnNiSpg.text: I love a good theme restaurant, especially ones that serves awesome girly drinks in tiki-cups.   My friend, Kelsee I, and a couple others came here for dinner on a busy Saturday night  but were seated almost immediately. The place was packed and was great to sit outside on a cold night. The heater was really hot and could have been turned down a bit.  I had the steak sandwich with sweet potato fries and side of sweet plantains. The steak was chewy so I had to cut it up in tiny pieces. I must admit that I had a late lunch so I was not hungry and should have saved room for dinner but everything tasted fine. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and my girly, Dr.Funk drink. Worked up a good buzz.  I need to come back for more. Maybe next time, I might be adventurous enough to share a giant fish bowl of booze with the table.

5tgwIsE3AIvh9TvcYyfC4w.text: Visiting from Chicago we found Hula's on YELP.  It completely lived up to the reviews!  We will be back on our next trip.  Food - simply delicious.  Close to anything we've ever ordered in Maui.  I had the butter fish crusted in macadamia nuts.  Fabulous.  The mango chutney topping was the bomb.  Great flavors and combinations going on.  Drinks - excellent.  Well poured, mixed and delivered with love.  Staff - very helpful with recommendations and had a great sense of humor.  Ambiance - sit outsdie.  Awesome patio area with firepit-perfect for a cool February night.  Will recommend to all who visit from Chicago.

SEBKH81ovxP15Mnn4dHnkA.text: There were so many things on this menu that I wanted to try, it was hard to narrow it down. Cajun/Hawaiian fusion will do that to you. I ended up going with the fish tacos and they were great. The Hawaiian Mac salad was pretty tasty too! We had the Cajun burger, which was also very good. Cool tiki vibe and tons of open patio seating. They also donate 10% to non profits on Mondays, which is commendable.

8qNtBGDl2-OwH0Te6FaqIQ.text: My friend has been here before and recommend we go for drinks & apps. We went on a Wednesday so happy hour prices are all day which is awesome! The drink & food menu offer many choices and variety, which I really liked! I ordered a Mai   Tai which was really good! Not too sweet and you could taste the liquor for only $5 The sweet potato fries with secret sauce were excellent and shrimp rolls were pretty yummy too. We just had apps but I will def be back for lunch or dinner :) :)

f6X4KtlTrNfKp5QSZx2svw.text: mainly for their drinks and the happy hour on Wednesdays!!! We had many different things for food and all tasted really good. The place has nice decoration and you really feel comfortable wherever you sit.  The 5th star will come when they don't force you to tip :) (Can't I decide if the service was that good or not?)

vgP8Ypmke3NcD0oZs6toGQ.text: Great spot on a Friday after work to grab a drink with friends or co workers, this place is "Light Rail Friendly" which means if you want to do a little bar hoping after a few drinks then you don't need to drive to the next bar. When I want to show off uptown phx, I bring friends to this place and everyone always enjoys this place. The happy hr is decent but the real deal is when you get a volcano bowl or spider bowl and share with a group of people. I just love the ambiance of this place and how great it is for groups of any size. The only reason why I don't give it 5 stars is because the service could be super slow and the waiters tend to forget about you. But overall I am a fan and I will be back for more good memories!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Volcano Bowl with half regular fries and half sweet potato fries.

u3VJf5okqz3b7QSXRAdb3g.text: Hula's is a great little bar. I like it a lot. Their drink pours are strong! I still haven't had any of their bowls, as I haven't been there when I want to get wasted!   The food is pretty good. I've had dinner and brunch there and been absolutely fine with the food. As with most of Phoenix, its a little pricey. Not ridiculous though.   Get their drinks! They specialize in that! Dark and Stormy would only be made better if they used better rum (Whaler's? C'mon...I thought you wanted to make me a good drink) try Kraken in those (they didn't have Kraken when I asked).  Sometimes they have Gilligan's Island on the TV in Espanol or Frances, which is fun!

8Yu0RYfw5f1cuzKo1z4pLw.text: I always enjoy going to have some good food and lovely drinks.  Service is great and you can't beat the all day happy hour on Wednesday.

77jCWrt4WyJH9zb6DDQtdg.text: This is only the 3rd time I have eaten at Hula's and this time around it was better than the other two times.  I had the chicken tacos which were really good!  I love the decor of the place and cant wait to go and sit on the patio when the weather get a little warmer.

oDggk6uUIg4_JfUmVAx-Yg.text: Love Hula's! I have been going there for just over a year now, and take people there every chance I get. Everyone who goes enjoys the food, the atmosphere, and the service. It is certainly a unique place with a laid back attitude and funky decor, but it appeals to many people. One of my favorites is to get the potstickers as an appetizer, followed by the luau pork sandwich- as the menu reads, it is "heaven on a bun". And that is an accurate description! The mixed drinks are great, as is the iced tea. If you have not tried the banana cream pie, get to Hula's NOW for this amazingly decadent yet remarkably light and delicious dessert. The service is great, and the staff knows the menu and is happy to help you- there does not seem to be "not my table" attitude there- they want to make you happy. I have had two birthdays there, as well as other celebrations. I am sad it took me so long to find this great place, but I look forward to many more meals there. Note to fellow dog owners- Hula's is VERY dog friendly with seating on the patio with heating or misters depending on the season and water bowls for the pooches. Expect lots of visits from the crew of Hula's so they can say hi!

aPIBv8nC6AczGvUoIKxIqQ.text: This is a cool place for happy hour or dinner. I feel like I'm on vacation when I eat here. The coconut chicken was pretty good. The drinks are strong which is great. The servers are friendly.

08Jy5eR9hHRPEf8W4Hm9bg.text: Had a great time at Hula... we went for brunch, promptly seated, Drinks were awesome.. food delish.. waiter Kyle very nice

PXUuUCzMc2Dhi6MexiWW0A.text: My boyfriend and I always drive by and finally decided to check this place out for lunch. It's very open and has super cute decor. It was so difficult choosing a cocktail, they all sound delicious! We had the coconut shrimp rolls to start. They were amazing! He got the tacos, which were okay but definitely overpriced. I got the enormous Thai chicken avocado bowl. It was really good, but we could have split it. We left with food babies in our tummies. Next time, we will come on Wednesday for happy hour!

CRxmIIqCkYiIMWLUiO5R0w.text: This place is in my "circle of trust" when it come to good food and good staff. I suggest trying the shrimp rolls and civeche... AMAZING!

OdDZunOTjBQkzVZVUCayVw.text: I stumbled across this place as it was close to my hotel.  I'm a creature of habit and will definitely be back.  The service was great!  I had the tuna burger and it was delicious.  The patio was open and the weather was perfect and like the name says it has a very cool modern feel.  They also have a nice selections of cocktails.  I would definitely recommend Hula's Modern Tiki.

tAlTh_YXAuCLuAFoUrFpTg.text: First time visiting Hulas, and I really enjoyed it. The atmosphere and ambiance is very laid back and tropical, with tiki heads and surfer posters everywhere. Clean, friendly, and an awesome drink menu! Cuisine offers a mix of seafood and island favorites with your standard burgers, steaks and fries. Vegetarian options are readily available. Our party had no problems with service on a busy saturday night. I ordered the ribeye with mashed potatoes, cooked medium rare. I'm not the biggest fan of ribeyes, and the price was a little steep, but overall the meal was flavorful and hot. I'd have to say that the real highlight here is their tropical drinks. Men, here is a bar where you can order a Mai Tai with no shame. No touristy girl drinks here, only strong Mai Tais made with excellent rum! If you're a fan of the 50s and 60s like I am, or you're looking for something new for dinner and drinks, try it out!

J8yJusiOyTh4ysvvUgSGJw.text: I came here for the first time on a rainy Tuesday afternoon for lunch with a great friend I hadn't seen in 6 months.  Our server who was cute as a button picked up our "we are not in a hurry vibe" right away.  We ordered a bottle of wine, fairly priced and loved the added touch of a chilled wine glass.  Our food was very good but no real risk was taken. We shared the fish and shrimp tacos which were flavorful but I had to add some hot sauce to give it a little bite.  The beans and white rice were a simple filler, nothing more.  The menu looked interesting and the prices were fair so I would definately try it again. There were only 2 things that I found disapointing, first was after we ate I ordered a martini, one from their menu, it was fruity and you couldn't taste the alcohol at all.  The problem was it was served in a very small martini glass and I feel when you are going to make a fruity concoction and call in a martini the glass should be bigger, not the James Bond shaken not stirred size. Second problem, as we were eating a woman came and sat at the table right by the restrooms and plugged her computer into an outlet that made the cord block the restroom door.  Now my companion and I couldn't decide if she worked there or not, she never ordered food and wasn't there long.  But just the fact that the cord blocked the door and could have been hazardous really bothered me. Overall though I give the place a B+

Sg2Y6JPcGWGzaUVXzD_8Yw.text: Looks like 3rd time is a charm! The food was Amazing esp the fry's and the pork! Awesome service and I'm willing to chalk my other two visits up to just bad luck based on the individual server. I will be going back again but next time I think I'll try the lunch portion like I had been getting because they give you a lot of food on the reg. menu or whatever it's called.

BVRpslNM6jKmorO5snYFkA.text: So I had a first date and needed to pick a spot to go.  He was naming the places and I was yaying or naying them.  He said there's a place where you can sit outside and there's a fire pit and I was sold.  I got there first and got us a table outside and under a heat lamp and the wait staff was really nice while I waited, making sure I had everything I wanted.  He got there and we both ordered a beer, and he got the hula burger and I had the coconut shrimp roles with a side of plantains.  The shrimp rolls were good, not amazing but I would get them again and he said it was one of the best burgers he's ever had.  I stole a few fries and they were awesome.  I wasn't that impressed with the plantains- I'm used to a different preparation but they were okay.  I would definitely go back for the great atmosphere and to try out some of their specialty drinks.

N6lMzmyPMmkZotZGgaUHPQ.text: When you take a look at a place like Hula's and see that it has eighty-eight reviews it makes you think, does it really matter if I put in my two cents? Well maybe Hula's doesn't need my cents, but they are well deserving of five stars and a few dollars.   I am not a huge Yelper. Okay scratch that. I am a huge Yelper but not a very good one.  I love looking at the events and use it to gage the places I venture to, but you will never find me on a forum and rarely writing a review. I decided that Hula's was worth that rare occasion.   Like I said I am a fan of the Events page so I decided to try out Yesterday's Urban Wine Walk. I'll admit that the walk turned out to be a bust for my friend and I (for reasons of timing not event qualms) but Hula's was the best part and made the walk attempt worthwhile. The wine was great and our friendly server was more than willing to describe the options and chat about a great place to find a good Malbec. Thanks for the tip. My favorite wine was the Carmenere they were offering. My friend was a fan of the Fume Blanc.  The only thing we had time for was a starter and we went with the spicy Thai fish cakes, which were amazing. Perfect size and flavor and presented as if it was the after shot for a cooking demo. I have been wanting to try Hula's since they opened and I am willing to admit that the walk was my excuse to get down there. Now I know there is no excuse needed and I will definitely be heading back down for a full dining experience very soon. I suggest you do the same.

rURANSvfGxtQEvkmYA9y4Q.text: I'm just gonna do the damn thing and give this place 5 stars.... they seriously have the BEST coleslaw ever!!! I hate coleslaw and this stuff is really good. I love the cilantro in it and how it is not too saucy unlike myself.

plgdAm6nuNKWFzt-cZTlNg.text: I heard about this place and what doesn't sound appealing about a Hawaiian themed restaurant?  We walked in and were shocked at how packed the patio and restaurant were.  There was a very short wait that we spent checking out the awesome bar.  We sat down and I loved all the tiki men statues lining the walls.  We ordered two drinks that were both fruity and delicious, 1 of which came in an adorable tiki shaped glass.  We started things off with some delicious sweet potato fries, and I got the shrimp tacos and my friend got the macadamia crusted halibut, I tried a bite of hers and both were delicious!!!  I can't wait go back with a big group of friends so we can check out the bar a little bit more next time.

6DcDtEo4WtY9aHb2deQMOA.text: I love this place...the food is always great! I am greeted by the owner when I come in and usually have a great wait staff! Thanks Tia for always making my experience a great one...

0mDfTp-rTAXM0HJn3A5xJQ.text: Watch out, Downtown. Because Uptown's coming after you. THE LOCATION ---------------------- Situated in a revamped geometric building dating back to 1965 (ancient time in Phoenix-speak) within the same Central Ave shopping center as Lola Coffee and Haus, directly facing the St. Francis Xavier Church basilica. Camelback/Central is the closest light rail stop. When you first walk in, you'll notice the patio: a collection of tables and a long bar tabletop placed around a firepit. I immediately knew that this was going to be a regular evening hangout for the uptown crowd. Tonight's temperature was perfect to be outside and as it cools down further, the firepit will be even more attractive. Inside, the main dining room had shelves lined with kitschy tiki heads overlooking the otherwise regular dining area. The bar area is much cooler, though. First off, that giant hexagonal window is awesome and I think everyone should have one in their house. I'm glad they respected the original design by keeping it. A long bar with hanging lights, as well as another long tabletop. Moving images projected high up on the inside wall, which would easily be visible while going down Central through the giant window. MENU --------- A limited menu today, with plans to expand it soon. A lot of Hawaiian-inspired dishes, with fish understandably being a highlight. I decided to try their island style poke (ahi, soy sauce, sesame oil, avocado, green onions, and macadamia nuts - $9) and their cocojoe chicken plate (coconut encrusted chicken breast, lilikoi sauce, plantains, black beans, and rice - $15). Full bar with a drink menu including a dozen plus typical tiki bar specials, including a 2-4 person Volcano Bowl. I decided to stay dry today (it's only Monday) so I'll have to imbibe some other time. FOOD -------- The poke - 3.3 stars. The cut and quality of the fish was nice and went down easily, and the ingredients of soy, sesame, and green onions were all there, but somehow I was a little underwhelmed by it, which was strange, since I'm a big fan of poke. Nice chunks of avocado, although the macadamia nuts were missing. The chicken plate - 3.3 stars - The coconut-encrusted chicken breast, cut into long strips, was really nice. Cooked tender and not in the least dry. It was the highlight and I thoroughly enjoyed it. My server had warned me upon ordering that the lilikoi sauce (basically a jazzed up passionfruit puree) was REALLY sweet so instead of having the chicken smothered with it, to have it on the side. And I'm sure glad I took her advice, because it was way too sweet for my taste. I asked her if they had any other sauces that I could try and she immediately brought three others over - a mango salsa, a peanut sauce, and an ahi glaze. The latter two didn't do much for me, but the mango salsa had the perfect amount of sweetness and complemented the chicken much better. The rice & beans were cooked jerk style and were decent, although the plantains were missing at the outset. When they came a few minutes later, they had nice warm caramelization on the outside, but unfortunately were really cold when I bit into them, as if they hadn't finished defrosting when they were fried. As for dessert, no space in my belly for key lime pie. Next time. SERVICE ------------- I had the pleasure of meeting Dana, the owner. Really friendly and excited about opening up in this uptown location. He was very appreciative of my business and looking forward to integrating the restaurant into the local scene. My server was also very friendly, jovial and attentive. No complaints at all in this department. RANDOM INTANGIBLES ---------------------------------- Music went from 80s to chillout lounge to rock. I just remember hearing "She Drives Me Crazy." You can't go wrong with Fine Young Cannibals. It's True. The view from the patio is great, in its uptown way. Of course you have the light rail going in either direction, while the M&I Bank building emanates its capitalistic glow from up the street. I looked up at Landmark Tower and saw the silhouette of someone dancing on their balcony. Must be a fan of FYC (as well as having the Bionic Woman's hearing powers). FINAL VERDICT ---------------------- Seems like uptown is giving downtown a run for its money with all the openings in the past 18 months, and Hula's Modern Tiki is another welcome addition. The location is great, and I could see it having a an awesome happy hour (don't know if they're planning one), with folks hanging on the patio in the non-summer months. Now the food may need some tweaking to be truly stellar, but to be fair, it was Day 1. There were definitely some bright spots and I'll come back to try more (the great service and friendly atmosphere didn't hurt). So, all in all, food + service + overall impression on its first day = 3.6 stars, rounding up to 4. As they say, onwards & upwards. youtube.com/watch?v=Q7jG...

6NBcwTtC4FbMEBjqLKFiUw.text: What a wonderful December evening to have dinner on Hula's outdoor patio. We got there about six, and were seated immediately outside next to the fire pit. I thought we might get to hot, but it was Great seating. I ordered the Blackbean burger and yam fries. The burger was delicious and so were the fries. I'm not much of a fan for mixed drinks, but I did order a glass of wine that was just perfect with my food. The service was great, and I would go back to this place.

M9BaEPXPeNR9QGuRT8G4_Q.text: I was there Wed nite. I was with the party of 5, and I concur, it was NOT a good meal for any of us. Giving credit were I can, the ceviche, sweet potato fries and shrimp rolls were good. Other than that, the service was mediocre, the ginger in the cole slaw created  a bitter flavor, the sticky rice was not hot and had an added spice that none of us could name, and my pulled pork plate was just plain awful. The meat was smelly and tasted musty. I'll let our other guests describe their own dishes. As for Tracy D, we are NOT snowbirds, rather we have lived here for over 40 years...raised here, and own & run businesses here. We all dine out frequently! I think your comments to Patti S were pretty rude. A review of a restaurant is NOT a personal attack. Yelp was created for us ALL to voice our opinons. A bad dining experience happens. Unfotunately, this was one of those.

QuEC_4utir1nMsRJoFCljQ.text: I am so excited to have yet another awesome hot-spot added to the Phoenix restaurant scene.  I've been watching the renovations of this building for a while now and read the blog of all the fantastic things they have done inside the place, so I was waiting at the door 10 minutes before they opened.  Needless to say, I was pumped to finally eat here.  We were welcomed in a little bit before open time by Dana, the owner, who is a really awesome guy and his enthusiasm and excitement is truly infectious.  You can tell that this is his baby and he is so proud.  We were given menus which are minimized for the time being, but there are still a ton of stellar selections on there.  For a starter we chose the sweet potato fries and they were excellent.  They were not too sweet and had a fantastic texture.  Crispy on the outside and slightly soft on the inside made for a pretty addictive pre meal snack.  Next up was the ceviche, which was actually brought out complimentary by the chef.  I've never had ceviche before, but if this is what it all tastes like, I love it!  The fish was lovely and had a nice firm texture and the spices/peppers added a great bold flavor while the coconut milk mellowed it out a bit.  My dinner entree was the Cocojoe's Coconut Chicken Plate and it was delicious!  There were two huge, flattened pieces of chicken totally covered and crusted in coconut.  It was also slightly covered in a deliciously spicy and slightly sweet lilikoi sauce.  I loved it, but my husband loved it more, so I let him have it and I traded him.  Now I had the pork plate which was also delicious.  The pork was tender and the pineapple/soy bbq type sauce was addictive!  There were also chunks of pineapple which was a nice addition.  The coleslaw it came with was actually a great stand-alone side.  It had a tangy buttermilk base with just the right amount of pepper.  For dessert we got the key lime pie.  It was amazing.  It was so tangy, smooth, and creamy.  It was simply unbelievable, and unlike any key lime pie you have ever had.  I adore this place.  I'm truly in love.  I will be back here many many times.  I cannot wait till the weather is perfect for relaxing on the patio and sitting around the really cool firepit.  Obviously, I was impressed with this place.  The architecture and reuse of the building is wonderful.  The laid back/island atmosphere of this restaurant is a True winner that will be bringing in the people for a very long time.

WkzjO8MX2Y185uQ5N8vCEQ.text: Not gonna bother writing a super long and descriptive review with almost 200 reviews before me. Bottom line I liked this place, I will come back for sure! Was told multiple times that I needed to come here and finally did. Had the pork sandwich on the brunch menu and it was really good.  The only problem I had with the place was our server was just a little weird, not rude or anything, she just would comment on things that she thought we were looking at on the menu and just kept walking by with her input, but not a big deal. And then not like this place could help it but I was really bothered by the other patrons there, the tables are close so I guess you can hear other people more than you would want to but some of these people were just real stuck up. Being at a trendy place doesn't make you super cool, so just chilax and have a good time or go home. But yeah, not like they could do anything about it, but if your thinking about going and your a snooty brat, just don't.

cjaHotnUr4fP0okUdTXSgA.text: I am in love this spot! I have made it my personal mission to try all the restaurants in uptown and this stop did not disappoint! We went on first Friday around 6 which was risky but they seated a table for two in about 15 minutes. They play great music btw. We got Kona big wave on draft which not a lot of places have. We ordered the potstickers, I got the Hapu fish and my boyfriend got one of their sandwiches. All the food was AMAZING! We loved every bite and were planning out what we were going to try next time as we finished up our beers. A great spot in uptown and a must try for the food and bomb atmosphere!

Z0mwY0ML2aPPeKVPKZkOUg.text: I had dinner here with some friends a couple of weeks ago.  As appetizers, we ordered a half and half order of sweet potato and house cut fries, crispy coconut shrimp rolls, spicy edamame and crispy fish bites.  All of the appetizers were quite tasty.  The spicy edamame is definitely spicy - leaves your lips burning a bit - but they were oh so good.  I loved the pineapple horseradish sauce with the shrimp rolls - great pineapple flavor.    For dinner, I had the blackened wasabi Hapu - lightly blackened over wasabi mashed potatoes with seasonal veggies.  The flavor on the fish was good as were the potatoes but I'd like to have a little more kick for the potatoes - just a little more wasabi flavor.    We also had dessert - coconut cream pie.  You definitely want to save room for this.  It was very creamy - very rich - very delicious.  I believe Bailey was our server that night - absolutely wonderful - provided us with a lot of laughs and great service!

P9jdADOh12d8wtTi_jKsJA.text: I have to tell you a story before I write this review... Initially I had nothing but bad things to about Hula's. Hula's is the ONLY reason I ever Yelped in the first place. I went there and was not impressed in the slightest on my first visit over two years ago now. The service was not the business and the food was not what I expected at all.   Today I am most definitely humming a different tune...  Now that I know what the menus has to offer and I have a better feel for the happy hours and specials and have been here about a dozen times... I am a fan! I have had breakfast and dinner enough times to try several things on the menu and have had most of the cocktails. I love the Kona beers they keep on draft and the atmosphere is shakin! The staff is fun and friendly and always accommodating.   Hula's you have a patron from here on out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Halfsies on breakfast w my best friend. Hash and the Eggs Benedict. Both were delish and great w beers :)

aEi8Utt-A8hV9_n7O1_uew.text: This is a beautiful restaurant, quite modern. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. The seafood is the specialty, and it is done well. Cant honestly say i was blown away by the flavors, but it does make for a nice evening all in all

uBwIJIkuve_eGFtQGCpsFw.text: Come for happy hour! The drinks are cheap and STRONG! Real strong!!! I love the indoor/outdoor feel to the place especially when the weather is nice (which is always right now). We pretty much ordered all the food off the happy hour menu and were not disappointed. The food came out fast and hot. Everything was yummy and was perfect with our very strong drinks! Will definitely be back soon for that afternoon buzz.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everything we ordered!

4rJMceBYL9XgCaM3Qr-WFA.text: Hula's Modern Tiki is awesome!  Our group consisted of a bunch of friends from high school and we had the beef sticks and shrimp rolls (I think that's what they're called) and the were outstanding appetizers.   The Blackened Wasabi Mahi with wasabi mashed potatoes and greens was very good. The wasabi will do its usual dance with your palette, but it is not so overburdening on the taste buds that it turns you off. It is quite the opposite. As a side dish, the fried plantains are just the right counter to the fish. It really complements and balances the meal.   For dessert, the Key Lime pie and the Coconut Cream pie will make you wish you could buy each whole pie. I thought the Coconut Cream pie was probably the best I've ever tasted.  The only dish that needs to be on the menu is Spam Fried Rice, a staple in Hawaii.

cqGRrfvqh1feCYNbpE_R8A.text: Had an absolutely great experience here last night. Keith and the rest of the staff were very friendly and the food and atmosphere were phenomenal!

Br7JvbNfbYNLSftAwU_NmA.text: I live 2.3 seconds away from here.  The place is super chill and great costumer service.   My drink was always filled up to the top. Its like they watch me take a sip and come over and fill it up. I loveee it. My waitress was cute and so outgoing. You can tell she love what shes doing.  I had all their vegetarian dish here. My favorite one has to be the tofu tacos. Their sauce is so yummy and the black beans is on point.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetarian tofu bowl and germain had steak.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The big sur black bean burger!!!

kTjgyLqqKH3EfbQcc1I-bg.text: This is one of my top five for happy hour spots.  Food items are good and cheap.  Quality of the food, especially the fries is tremendous.  They leave the skins on the potatoes so it gives them a special flavor.  I have  never had a bad server and have eaten here many times.  The other night Cherise waited on me . I loved the cool hair color.  When I want a larger meal I order the pulled pork sandwich, which is never a disappointment.  If you haven't tried Hulas, you have missed a good time.  The Tiki bar look is the best.  They have the best Mai Tai's outside of the islands.    Terri J

5Li93ELHIuuKGEKHcWgXMA.text: After the husband, my friend, and I had finished at Paws in the Park with our dogs on Saturday, we headed over to Hula's to check out how pet friendly their patio was. We found a nice shaded table in the corner and it wasn't long until someone came by with waters for us and a dog bowl with water and ice for my Australian kelpie and my friend's long haired chihuahua. Awesome!   Once we had chilled with some $2 mimosas, we ordered lunch. Holy cow, that Hula burger with cheddar was just what I needed after a long morning of playing with my pup. My friend got the side mac and cheese as her meal and was very surprised. As an avid mac and cheese girl, she said it was comparable to the one at The Capital Grille (without the lobster, obviously). Deeelish! Husband also enjoyed his Hula burger with side of mac and cheese, but mostly his Dr. Funk, despite the ladylike color. Looking at their weekday happy hour menu, I wouldn't mind coming back just for a drink and a basket of their crispy sweet potato fries.

XuVHQhAzvhUc4K_Nq5G99g.text: I had dinner here with the husband a couple of weeks ago before we went to a Suns game.  We sat on the patio because the weather was brilliant.  The place is cute and the patio is really very pleasant.    I ordered a Zombie and a Painkiller cocktail (don't judge, I was rocking a migraine and desperately needed relief), and each one was nice and potent.  My husband just had iced tea.    I searched the menu for something with shrimp in it, but I was seriously left wanting in that department.  Instead I ordered a starter of lobster bisque and another starter of tuna ceviche.  The soup was hot and quite flavorful, but I would have liked a few more pieces of lobster meat.  The ceviche was extremely good and was served with flash fried wonton 'chips'.  I really liked it and my only criticism was that it was the lime juice was overpoweringly tangy and it could have benefitted from some avocado chunks to help cut down the tang a little bit.  My husband had the black bean burger which he said was really, really delicious.  All in all it was a good visit, and aside from our server not refilling our drinks in a very timely manner it was a good dinner out and I expect we'll be back.

q2sBOJ3eS1YVWrLJIbqwGw.text: We really love this place.  Service is outstanding and the food is great.  We started with the shrimp rolls as an appetizer and my wife had the Thai Bowl and I had the perfect lobster bisque and seared ahi on wonton chips with wasabi cream and ginger.  All excellent.  We finished by sharing a slice of very good key lime pie.  Drinks are strong and tasty.  All of this happened in a great, open atmosphere.  Everybody who works here is happy.  Everybody who eats here is happy.  We will be back.....probably this weekend.

KSkURVEf5rdbqtnoI6QXrQ.text: Take advantage of Wednesday all day happy hour. The food and drinks are better than average and the servers are nice and appropriately attentive.  I had the shrimp eggrolls, which were a good tummy filler. ceviche, which I didn't realize that dish was supposed to be a little sour tasting, so I didn't care too much for it. shredded pork tacos - solidly good. and traditional ribs with slaw - pretty good, as well.

Mrb8YpoARF6VDRVCbJ1b9g.text: First time visiting yesterday and it was fabulous!  Birthday brunch on the patio - pineapple mimosa (they also offer OJ or cranberry versions during weekend brunch) & a painkiller (rum, coconut, pineapple & oj) were a great start.  He ordered the Loco Moco - raved it was the best he's had away from the Big Island.  Visually, it was the most appetizing I've seen served in the last couple of years.  I went with some smaller plates as there was so much I wanted to sample.  We had the Hawaiian ceviche ("fresh white fish, "cooked" in citrus juice, coconut milk, chili, cilantro, garlic, wonton chips") to start and it was delicious.   I ordered a side of spam and crispy coconut rolls - both were great.  There were lots more items we want to try so we will be back.  Service was great, hostess sat us right away (sunny patio, great for hanging out), and food came up quickly.  We made it a point to talk to the MOD to let them know we are now two huge fans.

DRjRRPvOk23lOjMS1QVo6w.text: This was the first bar we went to when we moved here. We quickly became friends with the bartenders and come here at least once a month. The atmosphere is fun, the Hawaiian look is cool, the food is good, and the happy hour is the best. They have happy hour every day and all day on wednesdays! They have delicious tropical drinks that make you feel like you're in paradise. I would recommend this place for a more casual and relaxing bar!

x3I7lXoOSjjXq7rQmceUtQ.text: I like Hula's because their food is pretty consistent. At least in my experience. My favorite is the poke. I crave it! Every time I get something other than the poke I always wish I made a different decision. Love the Mai Tais too.   The food is good, not great. We normally go for brunch specials or weekly happy hour all day special. Makes it worth it for us. They seem to always have new waitresses who tend to make the experience inconsistent. They forget things, like to get our order or refill our drinks. We go enough that we expect this and it's worth the happy hour pricing.

3dxRUIXB6D2iF8I9xgaekA.text: We will definitely come back here soon! Came for a random date night and lucked out on a 2 n' 2 night! Meaning 2 appetizers and 2 signature drinks for $20. Our food had so much flavor and the vibe was relaxed and fun. Best part of all is that it was dog friendly !

e-x1ug4p1GxXeq2Ipl042Q.text: So it's been 6ish years since I was in Phoenix, but a few weekends ago I came back. I was with a different friend and definitely had a different experience. We were in for dinner and drinks this time and sat at the bar. Drinks were perfect! I had the tropical itch and my friend ordered several different ones. We had the ahi appetizer which was great and then I had the steak tacos and the brownie for dessert. Steak was cooked to perfection and damn if the slaw or seasoning in the rest of the taco wasn't a spicy surprise! I'm not into spicy, BUT I enjoyed it. The bar staff was attentive and always checking in to be sure we were taken care of. I will definitely be back next trip.

EX7aC1srSfV0cJH7tVtM8w.text: Wen here last nite had to wait about 45minutes.to be.seated.then had to ask to order a volcano drink bought it fast then did not see server for about 25 minutes then got to order food ordered starters then ordered our dinner.and.everything came out at once and food got cold trying to eat everything at once then got my ice tea I was waiting for iam giving 3stars because food was good

W0TXmczt211xTqmJFa2yjA.text: I was staying at a hotel nearby and stopped in for lunch. The bartender, Matt, talked to me for 2 hours about designer cutlery. I thought I knew it all but I was sorely mistaken!

RzzuCyncUcflx1ePfaf-pg.text: Heard about this restaurant from a friend and decided to take a co-worker who is relocating to another office out of town.  And I am glad I chose this place.  The service was a little slow out of the gate, hence the 4 star rating, but got better as the meal progressed.  I order a fresh brewed Iced Tea . . . it was fresh, clear, with a hint of island fruits.  For my lunch I ordered the Calamari Sandwich with the Hawaiian Mac and Cheese for my side.  The sandwich was perfect . . . the calamari was grilled perfectly and the sauce and greens were just right . . . while the Hawaiian Mac and Cheese was good . . . I would have loved to see a little more pineapple to give a litter sweeter taste.  Overall a very enjoyable lunch . . . the only bad part was that I will now only be communicating with my co-worker over the internet . . . but because of this . . . I found another nice restaurant.

2ggb_ofciIV7mEpHW-t8Tw.text: Check this place out for happy hour,  good drinks,  the ambience is  nice, specially if you sit outside.  However don't come expecting great food or outstanding service.  Things taste a bit defrosted, I might be wrong,  but you know how you have frozen taquitos warmed up in the microwave? Yeah,  sort of like that.

82-DYR3pz3l1qZq742v3Pg.text: Mai Tai !!!!  Excellent !!!  This is a "must go to" every time I am in Phoenix, always great food experience,  Great fish taco's but everything I have tried there is great! Nice bar, well run, comfortable, happy crowd of customers... says it all!

BPQnqug6aYmfwynwSIjZFQ.text: Screw you, Hula's. As if Spouse and I aren't alcoholics enough, you have to go and open one of the funnest (that's right, I say funnest) restaurants in Central Phoenix, fill the menu with phenomenal island drinks, and plop the whole thing within stumbling distance of our home. Our livers are on you, buddy.  It takes a lot to impress a professional boozer (that's a lie, but let's move on). That Mai Tai I had last night tasted better than the ones I had in Hawaii. And can I just say how refreshing it is to finally get some fruity options (because I am a huge fruit) rather than the same ol' margarita and martini variations served at every other restaurant in town. Not that I don't live for margaritas and martinis. Let's be honest, I'd drink mouthwash if the bartender poured it in a glass, mixed it with grenadine, and served it to me.  Where was I?  Oh, there's food too. Loved the sweet potato fries. Loved the Hula burger with sauteed onions. Loved, loved, loved Spouse's coconut chicken thingie. I am so ordering that next time because he refused to share. So stingy. BTW, I love that they have a Pupus menu (that's Hawaiian for appetizers) because I am a child (teehee, I said Pupus).  Speaking of next time, we're going back this weekend. Bringing a bunch of friends to hang with on Hula's groovy new patio. And I'm ordering about 17 more Mai Tais. If Hula's could go ahead and place an AA phone number on the drink menu, I'd appreciate it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mai Tai!

6nErcV4oyh4wjvmlAdBhkQ.text: We have eaten here several times now since we moved back from Dallas. Food is usually very good and the service is usually good as well.  BUT tonight the service was terrible!!! Waited a very long time to be acknowledged after we sat down and when it came to check out our waitress was even worse than the start!!  In addition, the noise level was unbearable!! This place needs sound absorbers for sure!!

ga08vZwyGdVjIQRo94UGAw.text: We visited Hula's last night with our Dinner Club...and the 13 of us gave it an awesome review.  The service was excellent, the drinks were delicious (HH all day on Saturday until 7...drink specials only), and everyone was very happy with their food.    From what I tasted my faves were the Blood Orange Martini, the coconut shrimp rolls, the poke, the wasabi fish, the korean beef short ribs, and mac 'n cheese.  I liked the vibe...casual & interesting...old school Hawaii Five-O on the wall, classic 80's music playing, garage doors open to the patio, and the huge hexagonal window.  Would love to come back and hang next to the fire pit when it's a little warmer out.  Totally recommended!!

LpHHVXyqpeU9tICB-2j0Fg.text: We have some new friends who have never ridden the light rail.  The 4 of us decided to take a trip downtown and pick a restaurant that was an easy walk and one the we could enjoy for less than $50 a couple with a few drinks.  After doing the required internet searches we ended up at Hula's Modern Tiki on a Friday night in July.  We arrived around 6:30 and wanted to eat inside (they have a cute outdoor patio) as it was still a hot.  We were the first ones on the waiting list and created a seat at the bar.  Cute place filled with Hawaii type memorabilia.  My wife's Mai Tai was very good which can be a challenge to find in Phoenix.  We were seat in about 15 minutes.  The wait staff was adequate.  The spicy edamami was actually spicy and I ended up eating most of it.  We ordered the Ahi Taco's and the Carne Asada Taco's.  Each were two large taco's stuff with Ahi tuna and steak cooked to order.  There was enough for 3 or 4 taco's each.  Delicious.  My wife enjoyed the black bean and rice combination and she doesn't do beans.    The concrete floors make the atmosphere a little noisy but not obnoxiously so.  The 4 us were able to carry on a "real conversation".  I also notice a manager type "floating around" obviously paying attention to the details.  It showed.  I later introduced myself to the manager (Dana) who turned out to be the owner.  I always enjoy a restaurant where the owner/manager is actively involved.  The price came in right at $40  and we all agreed we would go back again.  It would be a really fun place on the patio when the weather cools.

NoFi3AfariLG_zDZDfgXRw.text: I frequent Hula's often; I enjoy everything about it. The five stars, I give it today are solely for Alan the new bartender . This young kid with the cool Mohawk hairstyle gets it. He knows he's in the hospitality business and that his primary goal is to take care his guests. He's attentive, helpful, happy, and he genuinely appreciates your patronage. Kudos to the owners for recognizing his talents and moving him up the ranks.

cuonARRgxGFbqTkIBhANpg.text: I agree with Emily J.'s review.  I don't love Hula's but I like it!    We sat on the patio by the heat lamp.  It was pretty dark in on the patio around 6:30pm.  We sat, we ordered, and we waited, waited, waited for the food.  It was a long while before our food came out.  We did not see what the food looked like.  It was so dark out.  The food was alright, but nothing that will make me drive out to eat there on purpose.    The server was very friendly!  The hostess was a little rude.

bDx90UyyP4x4LESSWRixhw.text: Favorite restaurant. Wish I remembered the name of this awesome server there, but everyone is great that we have had. Food and drinks are awesome and they have great daily specials, happy hour throughout the week.

KDFf7_SfV1tLN5AJ0ZEVBg.text: I really loved Hula's.  Decor: I think it was an old garage or fire department prior to being opened as an upscale tiki joint.  Despite being a 'modern' tiki joint, I love that they have big-screen plasmas and projection TVs playing 1950s and 1960s movies, like Jack Rabbit Slim's from "Pulp Fiction".  Underneath the bar is a very large and impressive collection of vintage tiki mugs.  Lots of framed posters of 1960s surf movies.    The food was pretty good.  The drinks even better.  Hula's mai tais go down smooth and, due to the typical Phoenix heat, it's easy to get two or three.  They managed to do a really good job of mixing the upscale with the vintage tiki stuff.   Hula's is the best tiki joint in the Phoenix area!

JS8W1iWQYebMdoP1mtWNVQ.text: Absolutely love this place. Used to be my Sunday spot. Great rum drinks, the bowls are amazing and the shrimp app is to die for

DKHL4qq9GGawnckmQjuUoQ.text: I love Hulas. Food is good, drinks are good, atmosphere is nice. One of my top 5 favorite places in Phoenix. If you like key lime pie, this is the place to get it.

_9YEd7L6K0Xct8-MgvvX4g.text: Have not tried their food yet, but had a drink with some friends and I absolutely adore the atmosphere and great service!

NmRh9kPZESB52h-JcDm7PA.text: Food is absolutely amazing! I come here for their tacos. Short Ribs are pretty on point as well. Their drinks are OK if you don't mind rum and sweeter drinks, I'm not so into Rum, so I guess I'm SOL there. But they have an ok beer selection and wine available as well so there are other options too. Finish with a side of plantains for dessert,  trust me, you won't regret it!

QbbL03DhLIqchmwk7sz46A.text: The jungle curry rice bowl is absolutely delicious. Actually all of their rice bowls are great. Also love their tacos, veggie burger, sweet potato fries and all of their tropical drinks.

Emlj2baIDO3E0-XQinxxjg.text: The food here was straight exquisite. I ordered the calamari sandwich and it was awesome. The staff here is all very young but incredibly friendly and efficient. Everyone knows the restaurant menu up and down. I always enjoy having a late lunch out on the deck. I wish there was a valet service to park the Phantom, as there is very limited parking available due to it being downtown. I don't recall the exact menu name item; however, if you're looking for a petite desert I would definitely recommend what I believe is the tilapia tiramisu. It's the perfect blend of protein and a savory desert. Overall it's a very vibrant atmosphere and I would recommend anyone looking for quality food and service. MMG

Fad0I1NZTXbMlHE716yBHQ.text: I have been here with my girlfriend three times now. We absolutely love this place, they have great food and drinks. I always get their Steak Sandwich, and its amazing every time!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I will be coming back

LALsrI3OnwbJCrVktzD0Vw.text: Cocoanut dessert is awesome. Have been there a couple times. Like the central Phoenix location.

C3gtZW2QCt8lPd5aEkocJg.text: We stopped by Phoenix on our way back to LA (from Sedona) and we tried to find something new (besides Mexican and Italian) around the area. We stumbled upon Hula's and didn't regret it! Everything we ordered was superb: Luau Pork Sandwich, Ahi Tuna Salad, Habanero Chicken Tacos, Ahi Tuna Bowl, Calamari, Ceviche and Poke! Their seafood's so fresh and everything was flavorful!

1nY6AtgPyZkfV5VKZvqh-g.text: This is an great placed. brought to phx from from santa cruz,ca. one the best things that has crossed over to az from cali in a long time. the staff is great! the poke and dr funk are my favorite! ive never brought a guest in for their first visit that didnt return because the food, service and decor are awesome! VISIT HULA!!! another wonderful thing about this great spot is they regularly give back to the community by donating sales to various nonprofits in arizona! i heart hula! and u will too!

ty91ClHNAB2_mZ918tGbsQ.text: great spot in downtown phoenix.  our day drinking party got loud by this stop (#5) on the lightrail adventure.  our party didn't try any food but we did find a great mix of people in here and some nice stiff drinks.  did we need those at this point, probably not!

nEiaFI7yc7e8jmi0eCbvCA.text: I have been to Hula's several times for drinks, but went today for lunch. It was freaking AWESOME. I had the Big Sur Black Bean Burger and my husband got the Hula Burger. Both were delicious and one of the best burgers we have had in a long time. The service was excellent!! I will be back for sure.

NgAeUTMCBwyV81N0HdGHmw.text: Butterfish done Coconut Style - WAS AMAZING. One of the best fish dishes I've had in town. The drinks for happy hour were great too! Loved my martini.... yum. Would highly recommend... only oops was when my husband asked for ice with his water, the server poured his 3/4 filled glass into the pitcher and refilled - wouldn't be a problem, except that he had already drank some... So the point - don't drink the water - drink the martinis!

3eQYER2rh7tvLqoej-K6pg.text: So full disclosure. My good friend and biz partner in NYC went to school with one of the owners of Hula's. I was in Phoenix this past week and ended up going to Hula's on Thursday evening, and I sat with a few locals that were new regulars to Hula's and they were talking about Yelp. I have known about Yelp, but had not been on until tonight. I thought it would be a good start to write a review of my experience at Hula's. FIrst off I have to hand it to anyone that has the guts to open a new business in a bad economy and a full blown recession. I am in the banking industry and I can tell you things are not getting any easier. Especially opening a biz in a place as devastated as Phoenix. Hats off to them for that. Place is beautiful, very hip, hip enough to be considered hip in NYC,and thats saying something. Had a good crowd, I would say whatever urbanites exist in Phoenix, they are going to Hula's. Very eclectic crowd. Young, old, gay, straight, families. All seemed very comfortable sharing the space, which is what I look for in a place that I would frequent.  community being very important to me. Nice to feel and see that vibe in a city that seems to struggle for identity. The many trips over the years that I have taken to Phoenix on business, I have noticed a big change happening in the past year in the central and downtown corridor. The light rrail being a big part of that. Speaking of light rail, very cool to be sipping on a great Mai Tai, sitting with good friends, having a fantastic burger( as good as I have had), and watching a fast moving train go rushing by a huge hexagon window. Hexagon, Octagon? Anyway, I walked around, and to my eyes they did not miss a detail. Very well thought out. I would say they need some landscaping in the front, and I was told that is in the works.  The staff seemed very happy to be there, no bullsh#&t delivery, came off very real and very willing to please. Cute staff always helps, and they have a bunch of cuties, with no attitude, just lots of warmth.   The drinks were a hit with everyone. Saw this huge bowl with a flame in the middle of it go by, that looked dangerous on many levels. BEsides my burger, I tasted their calamari and the poke, both I thought were fantastic. Fist time I had poke, will be looking for it back in NYC. Liked the varied menu, a touch of island lifestyle around the world. Good idea and original.  All in all, I would have to say that I compare restaurants wherever I go to the ones in NYC, and then rate them on if they could not only make it in NYC, but could thrive there. Hula's in the right location, and the modern mid century meets tiki 60's, Palm Springs decor, not the ticky tacky decor I was expecting, could thrive in the right neighborhood. West or east village, or Tribeca, or Brooklyn.  Maybe I will talk them into coming this way next. All in all a no brainer, and a must if your into a really well designed, well run neighborhood restaurant, with really good food and cocktails at very reasonable pricing.
